review_body: The free tour given by Pineapple Your was a fantastic way to meet other hostel stayers and a fabulous way to see some gorgeous sights and learn a bit about the island's history. Layed back hospitality. Perfect for a new arrival.

Best hostel in Hawaii. The tour with the Pineapple Exp is absolutely worth it. Our guide was Ryan (or Hawaiian Ryan), fun and with all the cool facts. Bring your camera, swimsuit... and enjoy. Perfect day in a beautiful island! Thank you Waikiki Beachside Hostel.

Perfect place, very close to the beach! I extended my stay twice Nice people, very helpful. Free breakfast each morning between 9 to 10 am.Free tour on Wednesday,wonderful (10 to 15h30), guided by a super guide Ryan and his very friendly doggy Yoda !Loved it ! :) Will recommend +++

Let's be real, it's a hostel on Waikiki. This is not luxury accommodations but a great place if you just want a place to shower and sleep. Pay the extra for a renovated dorm.Hawaii Ryan gives a free tour on Wednesdays and it was better than one of the paid tours I went on.

Signed up for the free Wednesday tour of the East Side of Maui through the Waikiki Beachside Hostel, figured there was nothing to lose! Ended up having an incredible time, learning a lot about the local culture and some historic landmarks. What a wonderful perk of staying at the hostel to get to take this tour with Ryan! Would definitely recommend 10/10!! Mahalo!

...Do yourself a Favor and take this Awesome Tour with Ryan... (it's FREE) ...and He was Friendly, Informative, and Surprisingly Funny too... and the Tunes Played Made the Adventure a Great time had By EVERYONE... and Made friends with People from Germany (Lisa)...USA (Keegan)...y Mi Mala (from Montréal/Spain/Morrocco)... ❤ ❤#ChiLiWiLLiE2u ❤ ❤ #2020HawaiianLifeStyLE ✌

Thankyou for the touring we had a great time james from dallas texas i have been here for a week so far but this had to be the greatest experience ive had throughout my trip and i hope to comeback soon and experience all over again

Stayed here for three nights. Breakfast is provided good service at front desk if you need local information and where to go definitely ask them. Great Wednesday tour with Ryan. Small group with a lot of fun. The greatest thing is it’s free!

Hostel is very friendly and my bed was very comfortable, best nights sleep I’ve had in a long time. Large communal area and decent coffee at breakfast.The hostel offers free trip on Wednesday, Hawaiian Ryan our guide is super knowledgable and friendly! Tour is fantastic and visited places I wouldn’t of known about travelling solo. Def recommend.

We took a tour with the pineapple Exp, Ryan was very friendly and accommodating, he took the time to show us all the good locations and explained the history linked to them, and also played nice music on the way.I highly recommend it !

Nice hostel for a couple of days in Honolulu. There’s free breakfast (toasts and oats) I can recommend the free tour on Wednesday with Hawaiian Ryan! it’s so much fun traveling to East Oahu and getting background Infos from a local.

Stayed at Waikiki beachside hostel for a week. Very short walk from the beach! Offers a free half day tour on wednesdays which was AMAZING! The guide from Pineapple Express, Ryan (some may know him as Hawaiian Ryan) was awesome and made this day so much better! From his music playlist to his knowledge about the island and all the places we stopped at I enjoyed every minute! Highly recommend. There is also a full day tour on saturdays that Ryan runs as well and I’m looking forward to it!

Great location a easy walk to the beach. Staff were great (especially wendy, shes so nice)Met some awesome backpackers. Did a free tour and it was well worth putting your name down for, took us around the amazing beaches

Rooms are clean and large.Staff at reception is super helpful and friendly.Don't forget to sign yourself up for the Pineapple EXP tour on Wednesday! It's definitely a nice way to see the east part of Hawaii. Not to mention the musical taste of Ryan, your guide!

The place is a little pricey during peak period during Valentine Day. Otherwise provide good money for the value. Pretty much on Waikiki beach and downtown in Honolulu. On some days, it even has live concert.

The free tour on the pineapple exp Wednesday was amazingsauce!! Went to a beach and did flips and had so much fun and saw a bunch of cool spots and did it with some cool people. Really a lot of great views.

Was the best experience I had so far, the hostel is 3 minutes by the beach so catching the sunrise every morning was a blessing and are so many things to do around. They offered us a free tour around island witch was amaaaazing. Truly recommend this place.

I'm not entirely happy with breakfast hours (9-10) but otherwise the hostel is quite nice, rooms are clean. Location is perfect, close to the beach, the zoo, also walking distance to Diamonds Head. Definitely recommend the free trip on Wednesday too! It's amazing!

The hostel provides great activities like a free trip with a local guide Ryan, takes you to many places that are so photo worthy...a nice place to swim and provides great chat and bangers.. worth doing

The hostel was ok. Good place to meet people and great location!! We did the sightseeing tour with Ryan which was awesome, we saw a lot of spectacular places which we wouldnt have seen without this tour! Best thing its for free! Definetly recommend!

I was there for 5 days and it was a pretty nice hostel.. the dorms got a lot of space, fridge and some had a kitchenette. The location is superb, the staff is very friendly and always willing to help; they even have a free tour to some nice beaches and sightseeing spots. Beware that the included breakfast is just toasts with jam, peanut butter, etc. Would come back another time

I would say that my stay in Waikiki Beachside hostel is being amazing! It’s very well located and the staff is nice, but the most incredible part for me is that they offer a free tour on Wednesdays with Ryan, he is such a great guide and very nice! He took us to very nice spots and I could go to many places that was on my bucket list!! Such an amazing tour experience! Must stay in waikiki area!!

Wow...what can I say. This is my first day at the Waikiki Beachside Hotel and it has been awesome. I am traveling solo and I met people from Taiwan, Switzerland, India, everywhere on earth on this free tour offered by the WBSH. I literally stayed 3 nights in a 4 star hotel with a ocean view for the past three nights and the hostel is literally one block over, a 4 minute walk. The staff at WBSH (Daniel) are extremely helpful. They let me store my bags until after I comeback from the tour and check in properly.Oh yeah you get a cold continental breakfast included or you can get a hot meal next door for les than $10!

Arrived Tuesday night and joined the free shuttle bus on Wednesday! Best decision ever.. met really awesome people, visited all the dope beaches, and Ryan the driver gave great island tips about things to do in the area!

Awesome day with Ryan and pineapple exp tours, He showed some great spots along the east side of the island. Got in a cheeky swim and some great photos. Travelling solo, picked up at the hostel and would do again 10/10.

Ryan from pineapple express has a great free half day Wednesday tour of the East side thru the Waikiki beachside hostel Quick peek at Diamond Head, Hanauma Bay blowhole and some other great spotshe also does Saturdays and some ThursdaysAwesome tour guide...he Rocks!

My wife and two adult daughters are only one day into our planned six nights. We have a four person room. It's very clean. The beds were comfortable if somewhat squeaky. The kitchenette was basic but adequate. The highlight so far was the free tour offered by Pineapple Exp. Ryan was a fun and informative host. The four hour tour includes several great scenic stops. At one stop we stopped to swim. My family brought our snorkeling gear, so we saw countless fish and two sea turtles.

Awesome free tour .Beautiful views. Hawaiian Ryan is knowledgeable friendly The East side of the island has spectacular views. Make sure to sign up for the tour as soon as you check in ..it fills up fast.

The hostel is clean. Nothing fancy but good enough. We stayed in a private room that had plenty of space. The only bad thing was that the beds squeaked and there wasn't enough silverware. The free tour on Wednesdays is a must! It was a perfect way to start our trip.

The admosphere in this place is awesome, with great rental prices.The Pineapple Exp tours are an excellent way look around the island and see many places at once! Definetely be coming back soon for moreThanks for the best experience!

We are have a great stay at the hostel!! The free tour Wednesday with Hawaiian Ryan was awesome. He took us to some wonderful spots on the eastside of the island with some great lookouts and beautiful beaches.

we toured about 10 different locations on the island and took time for swimming and snorkeling as well. Most Beautiful Day of my Life. Do Yourself a favor and Book with Ryan. Pineapple Express is sure to deliver.

Good place to stay, nearby all you need in waikiki beach( acuarium, zoo, diamond head crater, beach parks, moped rentals, abc stores).nice price for the room and amenities.first time in Honolulu, coming back again! Great free half day tour with @thepineappleexp ! Mahalo

I had a wonderful stay nearby ocean. This lovely hostel is in the eastern end of Waikiki Beach.And located at the second road from Kalakaua Avenue along the ocean.I stayed in the corner room on the 4th floor with 4 beds.The reception staff was helpful.Nearby is a restaurant without glass in the window named “LuLu’s”.Open from breakfast to midnight drinks,it was very convenient for me.The number one hamburger shop in the hamburger section of ranking for 14 consecutive years is nearby.There is also an open-air and friendly LGBT bar is in the same building.To the center of Honolulu is about 15 minutes on foot.Bus stops for The bus and Pink bus are conveniently located nearby.Several biki stops are also nearby.Kuhio beach nearest this hotel is surrounded by a breakwater, so It is recommended because families with children also can rest assured.This is one of the cheapest hostel at Waikiki in Honolulu.But I thought it's worth more than accommodation costs.I am thankful for a memorable stay. Thank you very much.

We have spent 11 days at the hostel. It is very clean and nice. Very close to the best beach. You can even book a free half day east Oahu tour with Ryan, at the reception. The tour guide is great and knowledgeable

We had a great stay here. Very clean and had a great staff. Everyone was very helpful. We stayed two nights. I would highly recommend. Loved Ryan’s tour! He did an amazing job and showed us lots of unique places!

The hostel is pretty chill, the staff is very nice and the best part of your stay will definitely be the free sightseeing tours they offer. Our tour guide Ryan took us to several bucket list hot spots, gave us some input on the islands history and was overall very kind and entertaining! Great experience!

Great free tours on Wednesdays!! Leaving at 9.30 in the morning.. Good for going to the scenic places around the east cost of Honolulu.. Takes around 6 hours. Don’t miss it. Sign your name in advance to the front desk guy

Good free tour with great overlooks and some secret spots. Our guide Ryan was really friendly and took nice pictures of us! He took care of us and provided us with water and great music during the drive.

This hostel is so central and they offer a free half day tour!! I wasn’t expecting much but Ryan our tour guide was amazing, we were driven in luxury in a great van all around Oahu, saw some incredible views, Ryan made sure everyone got chatting and it was really fun and informal, I would have paid a lot for this tour, great bonus, couldn’t ask for more!! Thank you! Lauren

Thought I had received the best price for my booking. When I arrived to the hotel I was charged and didn’t realize I had already paid on hotels.com. I was charged over $100 LESS by the hotel compared to the hotels.com price. I wrote Hotels.com and received less than caring responses. They did not compensate the difference and not offer a future discount for the discrepancy. Why bother booking with them if you can get a better price direct from the hotel? Use their service to find hotels and contact the hotel directly. Then you ensure you’re getting the absolute best deal and helping the hotel owner receive a better income rather than this useless site.Photo does not include $20USD key deposit refund from the lowest price which is in CAD

Kirstyn M
Whistler, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Great Location. The hostel offers tours, one of which is free. For a free tour it is more than worth it. I would definitely recommend to give it a try. The driver was extremely friendly and helpful. Took us to the best spots in town!

Great stay for backpackers. On Wednesday’s they have a great free tour that is done through Pineapple Express tours. It was a very fun tour and tour guide was very fun and knew so much about the island!:)

Apartment style hostel so the rooms have a kitchen and balcony, very large common area that serves toast and coffee in the morning. Super close walk to waikiki beach and amazing tours around the island (with an excellent guide) that are easy to book through the front desk :)

Adequate, but had some problems that made it not very pleasant. I would likely have given 3 stars if we stayed in one of the other buildings away from the noise and pot smell of the building next door.Pros:Great location - one block from beach, food trucks in back, convenience store on corner, half block to bus linesGood staff - friendly and helpfulInexpensive for WaikikiRelatively clean, but run downLarge lounge areaNice community of travelersCons:Noisy in building B - Next door hostel to the east is actually a hangout for long termers which constantly play loud music, party, talk loudly, and smoke tons of pot which wafts over. The lobby quiets down by 10pm, but the next door building can still be partying for another few hours.Run down - patio sliding door needed to be picked up to actually move it, window curtains broken, window broken so it couldn't be open, front door had large hole in bottom corner, ceiling fan was abysmally slow but there were plugin fans that worked well.Lack of supplies - have to buy towels for $4 but they were sold out, no soap, not enough dishesBright - lots of light came in through the window and the broken curtains don't block itThis could be a very nice hostel if they did some maintenance and had a chat with their neighbors.

We came in for one night between flights, so experience is limited to less than 24 hours. The best I can say is that WBH is kind of okay, and does offer a relatively inexpensive place to stay in Waikiki. We had a semi-private room which is a partitioned area inside a larger dorm room. the beds were okay and the sheets and pillow case were crispy clean. Our "roomies" just outside were considerately quiet when they came in very late (thank you!). Unfortunately, the whole place has the air of a place slowly falling apart, and no one giving a rip. Staff seems resigned, at best The place was very noisy with party noises going on until late - not unexpected with young traveling crowd, and not a problem for us (...ironically, when we went out for breakfast the next day we were greeted with the sight of our old guy neighbor outside in only his droopy white BVDs, sigh...not really a problem, but not really appropriate either). Our room had a small deck with sliding door, but just across was a loud drinking party, so we needed to keep the door closed, which made the room very hot. the air conditioner literally roared, so we turned it off. Slatted curtains over slider door were filthy and were also useless, as all but four slats had broken off. Room was dirty - weird stuff (euuww...) had run down and sort of coagulated on one wall and not been washed off. there was a lamp, but cord was unplugged and wrapped around lamp base. Corners and edges of floor were deeply dirty. Door was dirty and blackish around knob area and edges. Bathroom tiles were grimy. outside walkways were also dirty. My feeling is that the place gets "cleaned" but not with any efforts to actually clean things. Did not even want to experience "breakfast" here, so walked around the corner to nearby Denny's. We are not picky people, and not looking for luxury, but this place just looks like no one cares, and mostly just do the minimum. However...gotta say the location is great. We were returning from several weeks of low-budget "third world" travels- our most expensive place cost less than 1/2 of WBH and each place was extremely clean with evident pride of ownership. The contrast between these places and the very slovenly aspects of WBH was glaring. I'm giving my first ever poor review because the issues I raised could all be addressed with a little effort.
This was an amazing tour!! Great way to see the east side of the island. Awesome attitude and lovely experience. Would highly recommend to anyone check out the waves and turtles FIVE STARS.

Fantastic tour, Ryan showed us the best places with amazing views. We did some cliff-climbing, swimmed and ate very good food that Ryan recommended. I strongly recommend this free tour, he is professional and has great sense of humor!

My trip to Oahu was pretty spontaneous and I booked the hostel last minute, they didn’t have any empty spots in any booking platforms left due to high demands during peak time-so I was panicking I thought I had to sleep on the Waikiki Beachshores. Danny at front was extremely hospitable, and communication was great via email until they eventually got me in a female dorm that covered my entire 12 days in Hawaii. People say the room is what you pay for, it is modest in terms of facility but it is fine but the location right by the Waikiki is on point and very convenient to plan your trip.Every Wednesday, there is a free tour around the east coast of the island that is affiliated with the hostel. I was noticed that there is one free spot left last minute and decided to join on a whim- which is one of the best decisions during my vacation! You can visit multiple local places around the island that is not accessible with public transportation, and the 5 hour tour covers all the major must-see visits- Hanauma Bay, Spitting Cave, Hanola Blowhole, Makapu Point. Ryan is the most experienced and professional guides you can see in Hawaii. I had a minor medical first aid incident which was handled on point, and an interesting historical background is provided throughout the trip.

It was amazing trip to many different viewpoints. The guide told a lot interesting stories about places that we passed. There were great swimming time during the trip. Finally, it was comfortable van with ac.

I really enjoyed my time here! The free walking tour was awesome and defintely one of the highlights of my trip by far!!Ryan the Hawaiin was an awesome guy, brings great energy and music and really knew his stuff! I found out at the end of my trip that be also does a full day tour of the North Side to go swim with turtles—i really regret that I missed out on that, id recomend asking the hostel about it because I found it super hard to find reasonably priced tours and he’d be a fun person to take you around.

Great hostel! Friendly staff AND a free 5 hour tour on Wednesday! We were able to see so much of the island! Take the tour if you are there when it's offered. There is a great community space that I was able to meet so many people at! 10/10

A really clean place, with the best location at Waikiki. You can meet amazing people there and also the guys from reception are really friendly and their tour guide Ryan is just amazing !!! The place is safe and comfortable

A-mA-zing experience with tour guide, chauffeur Ryan! Yes - being free is a good deal but even paying would be worth it!!! Even got free water and we really needed it. Ryan took us to really special spots!

This place was super affordable and open for people planning a last minute trip. The not very many amenities were included, the staff was great at providing information on what to do during our stay. The best was the free island tour that the hostel offered! It was super fun, provided us with a lot of spots to visit, and we saw some hidden gems that we probably would not have seen otherwise! Definitely made for a more wholistic experience!

Great free tour on Wednesdays of Diamond Head and Koko. Lots of scenic views and a little swim! The guide is very knowledgeable and great music! A must do when you stay at the hostel. Provides free water and stops at a public beach for a bathroom break!

Great free day trip offered by the Hostel, the guide Ryan was excellent, got to see a lot of beautiful sights, beaches and interesting viewpoints, would definitely recommend the company that conducted the tour was great The Pineapple EXP!

I participated the tour on Wednesday that the hostel provides for free. We went many places near Honolulu even went to a beach in Halona Cove.The tour guide Rylan was awesome guy who is very friendly and takes care of us a lot during the tour make sure everyone enjoys it. Good to make friends in the hostel if you are solo traveler. AWESOME!

Excellent free tour! They take you to really nice places, lookouts! The hostal is very affordable, room is spacious and has its own kitchen, very clean and location is perfect.Everytime I come to Honolulu I stay there!

+Close to the beach. Nearby shop. Also nearby is Troll - Public Transportation Stop. For breakfast - jam and tea, all you need is enough, because you do not want to eat a lot when it is hot.-The room was very hot so did not go to sleep. There were 3 air mixers connected in the room, but that didn't help me sleep anyway.Once, when I returned to my room, I noticed that the papers stolen from the drawer were excursion vouchers.I locked my passport and money in the safe in the room. Therefore, I advise you to leave absolutely no important items in the room.

I have been in Hawaii for 5 day in a really convenient place! This hostel has all that you need to stay relax close to the Waikiki beach, the diamond head is a good hiking from the hotel. The rooms and common area are perfect to meet nice people to go surfing.

The free tour on Wednesday was amazing! The hostel is really well located, 2 minutes only from the beach. All rooms have their own bathroom and I think also kitchen. I would have preferred to have a kitchen outside of the room, but it was fine. There is also free simple breakfast every morning.

Best tour in Honolulu. Free tour and so much fun with Ryan. I recommended it sooo much!! We went to a place that no tourist knows about. We saw some sea turtles, a beautiful beach and the vibe is so nice.

The tour was so amazing. The tour guide is so friendly, he had patient and he explained everything. I just loved and for sure I recommended for everyone! Just so thankful for everything!!!we had such a great time!!!!

The hostel has a free tour of part of the island. The guide is amazing, friendly and courteous. I would highly recommend based simply from the tour. Normal tours cost $140 plus. So definitely getting a lot for your dollar

The best part of my trip was clearly the island tour with Hawaiian Ryan. So many memories were made. You should totally do both the island tour and the FREE tour on Wednesday!! My hostel room was clean and the staff was friendly!

The best part of my trip to Hawaii was the free tour on Wednesday (yes, free tour) with Ryan. Ryan was so personable! It was like getting a tour from your "best friend", he is funny, while giving us information about the island. My sister and I are senior citizens, and Ryan was right there to (literally) lend a hand--getting in and out of the van, on short hikes to beaches, or whatever. Ryan's tour really made my trip. Sign up at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel (comfortable hostel). bring a tip for Ryan, it is so worth it!

The stay was soo cool! We were really satisfied. Room was clean, reception helpfull and the best was free tour with Ryan!! We so enjoyed this little trip!! Thank you so much for that once again :). Definitely recommend this hostel. Beach 2mins walk, in the centre of Waikiki!!

Free guided tour! Ryan was an incredible guide, his bus was a nice size and had great visibility. He took our 8 person group to many different spots on the island, a few he promised no other tour would go to such as Spitting Caves. We went to a small and not busy beach for about an hour to swim, make sure to bring a suit! He told us about the history of the island, and mixed in personal stories to keep us entertained. He made personal connections with each and every one of us without being invasive, which is a huge plus for a quiet gal like myself. I can’t believe such a fantastic tour didn’t cost me a penny. 10/10 wish i could do this every day i’m here :) Thanks Ryan!! He also has $20 Friday Night fireworks tours that I hope to attend. Aside from the tour the hostel is a pretty good stay. No towels which sucks for the amount of humidity and no AC but that’s to be expected from a deal like this, so I won’t complain. Coffee, tea, oatmeal, and toast provided in an outdoor seating area near lobby. 5 minute walk to the beach.

First of all, the Waikiki Beachside Hostel is great! The newly renovated 4 shared dorms are the perfect size and my room had a kitchen. The tours with Hawaiian Ryan (Pineapple Express) were off the hook! He took us to places that only locals know of and they were beautiful! I would stay at this Hostel every time I visit Waikiki just for the tours alone! Nothing against the Hostel, it was great, but the tours made my vacation experience amazing! Thanks to everyone at the Beachside Hostel and Hawaiian Ryanl for making my vacation feel like a once in a lifetime experience!

I booked this hostel because they offer free half day tours on Wednesdays. Our tour guide Ryan for Pineapple Exp was great and took us to some fun spots on the East side of the island! Highly recommend.

Location is perfect - a 2-min walk to Kuhio Beach.Other than that, everything about this hostel is terrible:- Dorm rooms don't look like they do in the pictures... They're old, dirty and smell bad- My bunk bed shook every time one of us breathed too heavily, and I honestly thought it was going to collapse while I slept... - Wifi doesn't work in the dorms, only in the lounge area (and even then it's slow) - Not enough outlets in the room- No hand soap in the bathroom - Towel is $4- You get bedding to make your own bed, which you have to return to reception- There are creepy, drunk men hanging around the hostel all dayI've stayed in hostels in 40+ countries, and this is definitely among the worst. If you must book this place, book online for the $30 rate because walk ins are charged $35.

Lovely place, lovely environment. The dorm was actually not a dorm but a small flat with cooking facilities and daily cleaning. Great atmosphere and free tour of the island on Wednesdays with the magic Hawaii Ryan! Knowledgeable and friendly guy who takes you around the island for half day, totally free of charge. Would totally recommend the stay and all the tours they have to offer (way cheaper than others). If I’ll be back, no other place I’d rather stay!

Great awesome and fun free tour done every week on wednesdays organized by the hostel the driver named Hawaiian Ryan picks up from hostel at 10am and the tour goes till 3:30pm lots of fun and good time

I mean yeah! You get what you paid for. Met amazing people. Had a blast here. Stayed for 12 days. Wow what an experience. Staff will be nice to you if you're nice to them but that's common courtesy right? Come with an open mind and you will have the time of your life here!

The reception team were great, helpful and knowledgable. They play a big part in making this hostel a welcoming and fun hostel. The room I had was good, a 4 bed dorm. it had a bathroom and kitchenette and fridge. We had our 2 beds in 2 seperate rooms although it wasn't spacious. Lockers in the room. It was clean but not pristine, the turnover rate was very high and the cleaners probably need to be given more time to scrub the bathrooms. Rooms were being refurbished while I stayed so they are improving.Common are was cool and spacious the indoor outdoor aspect was nice. This is where everyone has their free breakfast, toast and peanut butter and Jam (jelly) I recommend buying some avocados if you want to make everyone else jealous. The location is great. Just outside of the Waikiki hustle and on a park were you can get some shade.

Sure, a hostel is not the „4 seasons“. Fair enough. But. I stayed there for one night in a 8-bed-dorm. The beds are horrible. You get sheets which you have to return. They charge you for everything: towels or the storage of your luggage before check-in or after check-out. Good: Perfect location. Waikiki beach is one minute away, a little supermarket just around the corner. And the stuff was quite nice. I saw many hostels and this one is one of the worst.

There are renovations being done but all in all it was a great place to stay at this price point. I met some great friends there that I am sure will be in my life for the long run. 10 years from now I'm pretty sure that I won't remember the renovations being done. There was a free tour that was amazing. The driver was personable and funny with a great heart! He lent an older man some cash because the gentleman left his wallet at the hostel. When the man went to go pay him back, the driver politely declined. Amazing. 5 stars from me!

I stayed in this hostel in a mixed room for 4 nights. The location is brilliant, but I was actually speechless about the room. I obviously stayed in a not renovated room. It is way not as what is shown on the management pictures. The "kitchen" is basically just a microwave and a fridge. No hardware, cutlery,etc. The beds were just some kind of cheap, metal folding beds. Squeaky and shaky, have never seen such beds in hostels. Bathroom was OK. More or less working AC just in one room. In general (walls, floors) the room needs a renovation. I would not stay there again. Next door there is a much nicer hostel!

If your in Waikiki on a budget and cannot afford a hotel or resort, the hostel location is great - one block from the beach.I stayed in a four bed dorm and the room was considerably spacious with to two bed rooms in one suite, and a private bath for the four beds.The bathroom could do with an upgrade, and the windows could also have a bit of maintenance, however, if your not planning to stay in the room during the day, which let's be honest, your in Hawaii, why would you, this will do the job.There is common area below with tables and chairs, lounge and TV where breakfast is served.On Wednesdays they offer a free half day tour with Pineapple Exp and our guide, Hawaiian Ryan, was brilliant, you hit all the hotspots in . Also worth looking at the full day circle tour offered on Saturdays which is considerably cheaper than other companies :)

Cons:From my past experiences with hostels, I was expecting them to rent towels. Usually you would give a deposit and when you bring the towel back you get your money back. Well here they sell the towels for 4$ and on too of that it's really bad quality.No personnal lights at the bed... kind of sucks if someone needs the light but the other person is sleeping. Not convenient at all. Saturday tour (organised by the hostel) leaves at 9 and breakfast starts at 9... went there at 8:45 to grab a toast before the road, the ladies making the breakfast refused to serve me.. the toasts were ready, the jam was on the table... it's a self serve process... i don't know what is the big deal to open it 10 min before, especially when they are the one who organised the tour at 9amThe breakfast is from 9-10am which is way too late. All other hostels serve their breakfast before that. I only had breakfast there like twice during the whole week because I wake up at 7, wanting to enjoy my day and not waste time, so can't wait until 9 am for a couple of toasts.As other people have mentionned, there are no blankets. I went in July so no need for a blanket, but in the colder season you definetely need a small blanket...They offer a tour for a discounted price but there is only one tour. The full island tour on Saturdays and a half day tour on Wednesdays. I noticed that other hostels offer different discounted tours every day.Pros:The location is great you can walk to restaurants, shops, beach, etc. Only 10 min drive to Diamond Head. The island tour on Saturday is only 35$ when on the streets they try to sell it to you for 85-120$. It's totally worth doing the tour with the hostel. Book your spot asap. They also offer a half day tour on Wednesdays, for free.They clean the bathroom every day. For a hostel, it has everything you need for a couple of nights. The staff is very nice and helpful.

This hostel fun place to stay. I'm here still. It is not bad and fun people here! I was very surprise when free tour was offered. was amazing! tour guide Hawaiian Bryan was great guy! very funny guy! yes, I recommend this places.

todays tour was amazing! Hawaiian Ryan was a great, safe, entertaining driver and took us to some cool local Hawaiian spots! Also, it was free since I am staying at the hostel! it's a great set up they have going on. Must Experience!

Perfect location close to the lovely and less crowded queen's surf beach. Basic room, AC working and handy to be able to use the kitchen. Staff on reception weren't the most helpful or friendly unfortunately. Basic breakfast is toast. Cleaners in to keep it tidy which was great. Less atmosphere than your average hostel but thoroughly enjoyed the free tour by pineapple exp tours (highly recommended). Give the barefoot beach cafe nearby a visit, also recommend renting the bikes.

Had an amazing and insightful experience on the tour, Ryan was helpful and took us around some great spots. Got to go with a good group of people and best of all, it was free! If you get the chance to go, sign up!

Stayed two nights in the semi private room. Honestly it was totally fine. Staff were friendly. Cheap laundry ($3 for washer & dryer). Internet worked pretty well. Had aircon in the semi private room and could lock the door to your room. Had two boys in the rest of the room who were polite and clean. Apartments next door were loud but didn’t bother me too much.

The 8 person dorm room was filthy, mainly because of the mass amount of long hair all over the tile floor. Not just a few strands, completely covered, like walking on a fur rug. Not ideal. Bathroom was out of toilet paper and the one bath mat outside of the shower was soaked and brown ( normally white ). Ehh just wasn’t my favorite place to stay. Have stayed at other hostels in the area that were much better at the same price. Won’t return. With that being said, the location is great and the staff friendly. Let me check in early without any issues.

The pictures shows you the only good room I guess cuz alll the rooms I was worn friends of the times I change where soooo old and dirty, the “breakfast” was ridiculous, they Internet sucks!!!! It’s only good at common are

The Waikiki location is amazing and I took the airport bus. The room in the hostel is very basic, I had to turn the bunk bed around to get it somewhat stable. The lockers were basically useless as they were coin op. My backpack did fit under my lower bunk. There were 2 bunk beds in the front room and 2 bunk beds in the back room with a bathroom for 8 girls but that worked out ok. It would have helped if they would put a mirror over the useless counter that was suppose to function as a kitchenette, then the girls doing hair and makeup wouldn't have to hog the bathroom. I was there for 3 nights and it was ok. The downstairs garage area had some tables and lounge chairs, some books. Overall not very communal. The worthless breakfast of toast, jam & p-nut butter was only 9-10am. But there was a gal who cooked breakfast at 8am for $5 and I had eggs and spam - well worth it. I've been to great hostels all around the world and this is not one of them. No bed lights, $4 charge for a towel. And I usually pay much less however this is Waikiki so it was cheaper than me having to go into a hotel for just myself. So this has to be the deciding factor, it's not a great hostel but it's in a great location.

I've stayed in hostels in the past. Upon checking in, you are issued clean sheets for the bed, but no towels. Looks like a nice place from the street, but the rooms are really shabby. For what you get the prices are very high. Had a reservation, but couldn't even entertain the idea of staying after seeing the room. On the plus side, they didn't argue about cancelling.

I stayed here for 3 nights on my first trip to Oahu alone. I had a good experience even rooming with strangers in the girls dormitory. It was a simple room, not much privacy and we shared a bathroom. There was no A/C but there was a fan that worked fine for me. The bedding was simple but adequate and there wasn't much of a view from the balcony, but the location was perfect. It was within walking distance of Waikiki Beach and some great restaurants and places to shop. I walked an hour from there to Diamond Head Summit and there was a transportation hub right down the street so I got where I needed with no problem. All in all, a good time.

What you see is what you get! Friendly staff, free wifi, basic breakfast, very closed to the main beach of Honolulu and close to the main street by walk.Cool place to stay between trips and activities around Hawaii.

The staff was super nice and helpful regarding recommendations in the area. The room, on the other hand, was just okay; the bathroom was filthy and unbearable to shower in. At night, the area was very loud and it was hard to sleep through the night. On the up side, there is a free breakfast (toast, jam/peanut butter, oatmeal, coffee/tea) as well as wifi. I would only recommend this place for a quick stop, not an extended stay.

Was in a good location, and the price was right (for Wikiki). Other than that it felt unsafe and was very dirty. The sheets given to me were dirty and the bars above me holding up the bunk above me were jammed full of bottles and trash. Homeless people and semi-homeless beggars seemed to come and go as they please, as their accomplices let them through the gate freely for breakfast and any other time of day. One morning I witnessed a stabbing during my breakfast. Most people didn't seemed concerned, which makes me believe that crime is common there. The staff were friendly which was a plus, but over all the place was a dive, and I've stayed in Hostels all over the world!

By the time I got to Waikiki at the end of my trip, I was pretty exhausted and decided at the last minute to treat myself to a hotel for a couple days. Since I had booked the Waikiki Beachside Hostel a week earlier, I didn't expect a refund, but the front staff was very kind, and really went out of their way to accommodate me. Although I ended up not staying, I did get to check out the room, and believe it to be as good as any hostel I've stayed in, and the location can't be beat! A good inexpensive alternative to a very expensive area.

You have to pay $4 for a bath towel; NO BLANKETS, they only give you sheets! NO ELEVATOR, 4 FLOORS, OUTSIDE STAIRS. AC is VERY LOUD and TOO COLD. Hostel is dirty; no hand soap in the restrooms; staff was not friendly; "free" breakfast is weak coffee and toast.

I have stayed at this hostel many times. When I go to Hawaii, I fly on standby because my husband is an airline pilot and it is one of his benefits. So, when I travel alone, I go to the hostel and share a room with 3 other traveling women. I have made lifelong friends with some of my former roommates who come from all over the world and are usually very educated, clean and respectful. It's like going to a girls slumber party! The hostel is a 3-minute walk to Kuhio beach on Waikiki, and accessible to public transportation. Less than $50 per night, it's a steal of a deal!

What a dump ... Waikiki is very touristy itself, which is a shame because its not sold or advertised that way. This hostel is shockingly bad. Receptionists really don't care, wont resolve any issues, just shrug their shoulders and tell you to call who you booked it with!. They are meant to be representing those people! They charge for towels and baggage storage. Anyways, their adverisements are false, we thought we had private rooms, which we did, a door seperating us from 2 other random people, we had to go through their space to get to ours! Mis-sold! Breakfast consist of weak coffee and toast! Not cheap either. Try other hotels/hostels first as this is a rip off 0/10 ...

Rooms overcrowded, hostel dirty, AC is SUPER LOUD. It's hot in the rooms and when you turn it on it sounds literally like a generator so you resort to opening the doors to get air in. They have no hand soap in the restrooms, unclean, big hostel, don't really get to know people. Only thing good is central location, and the bunk bed rooms, some have a dingy kitchen. Some staff were helpful, not so friendly. Would not stay here again for the money I paid.

Pros:- superb location, next to an ABC store (7/11) and Waikiki beach (south end)- large dormitories were spacious- the key given is actually a waterproof bracelet that can be worn at the beach. - dorms contained various kitchenette tools. Mine luckily had a large fridge and clean microwave. - though I didn’t use it, laundry was cheap ($1-3USD)Cons:- pictures didn’t match in booking.com, makes it look lovely but these are only the top tier rooms (I presume)- cleanliness was poor. Housekeeper did attend daily though only for a quick wipe down of the floor and remove trash. Bathrooms could be improved greatly. There was hair left over. Showers were poor pressure, and no hand wash provided, not even a bar of soap. - during my 4 day stay there were multiple smoke detectors running low battery that beeped every 2 seconds literally. I asked reception to investigate and change but they left them to beep for days. Yes, days. Sleep was terribly interrupted. - “breakfast” is toast with a choice of peanut butter or jam/jelly. Water and drip coffee provided and only served for one hour (9-10am), not a minute before or after. Gluten free or celiacs nightmare. - the communal area is outdoors so there isn’t even a place indoors to hide from cooler weather. This is also the ONLY place to get wifi. It was not a extended to your room/dorm. - dorms barely contained an outlet/plug to charge. No personal lights, only ceiling. - the communal microwave is disgusting. Overall: definitely wouldn’t return and rates in bottom 3 of my almost 1000 hostel stays around the globe. 2 stars solely because of the location.

Stayed here for two days (in a four-woman room), then two more when my other plans didn't work out. By far the most comfortable accommodation is the four-person space. There's a bedroom (more or less private) and two twin beds in a kitchen-like area. The bathroom is shared by all. My suitemates were a mostly silent young woman in a coat and long pants who'd fall asleep with her music playing, a visitor from France who's self-employed and has come to Hawaii five times in 2018, and ... the mystery woman, who found herself a BF and returns to the hostel to change clothing. In that room, someone had brought in a dispenser bottle of hand soap for the bathroom (yay!) and there was dish soap provided by the kitchen sink.My first night on the return was in an eight-person dorm, and it was untenable. I moved the mattress from the upper bunk to the kitchen floor (can't climb up and down). There was no place to set things other than to pile your luggage on the floor. (I've stayed in much more well-planned hostels where there are drawers under the lower beds, shelves with charging stations and reading lamps for every bed.) The three young women already in the room had used every inch of space: clothing and swimsuits hanging off the bunk frames, cosmetics and belongings from one end of the dresser to the other.) I checked with the front desk, and was moved to a "co-ed" room with four beds. The private room was used by a young couple, and my roommate was a very pleasant young man visiting from Germany. He was a delight to talk with; best conversations of my four-day stay. This room was also the cleanest and most nicely appointed -- decorative tiles in the bathroom, extra space to set belongings. While there is a very large public area, with various set-ups for lounging and visiting, I found it difficult to find a good discussion. Everyone seemed to be glued to their phones. There was a small gathering near the large TV watching the surfing championships. Since I was up and on the beach by 8 am every day, I never partook of the free breakfast (coffee, toast, peanut butter, oatmeal). None of the three rooms I sampled had the sort of total darkness that I am accustomed to. In the kitchen mattress space, I discovered that I was sleeping in front of an uncovered window. That room was also the most noisy in the early morning, with delivery and collection trucks driving on Lemon Street right beneath the windows.Having typed all that...I would stay again. The property is almost right on the beach, and there are many amenities practically at the doorstep. (I became a habitue of Starbucks-on-the-sand, all four mornings.) When my trip plans changed, they had space for me, and the on-line reservation system worked for booking. There are several Biki bikeshare stations very close. The staff ranged from helpful to very friendly, and the rooms are cleaned daily. You can't lose the key: it's a digital wristband that works on your own door. Did I mention how close the beach is? It's a great value and a nice place.

This hostel's location is incredible!1 block from Waikiki beach and easy access to shops, restaurants within walking distance. Room was small but ok. Kitchen and bathroom were inside the room which was convenient.They have lockers in the room only 4 for 8 girls however it worked out for my room.It took a quarter every time you opened it. It would try to only open it once or twice a day or else it can get a bit pricey. Not too much of a social atmosphere and hard to meet people has a solo traveler however I was able to meet a few people over my stay there. Overall my stay was nice, the staff was nice and helpful with questions and guidance on things to see and do. They have a rental place next door with scooters, bikes and such. I highly recommend them. They were reasonably priced and it was the highlight of my trip for sure. I took the bike around the island and had a blast.They also have an ABC store which is like a convenient store in Honolulu right next to the hostel which is great for necessities and snacks.

The rooms are old and not very clean. The hostel is super big and that's why you don't really get to know new people, furthermore they are strict with the quiete time after 10pm. So if you just want to drink a beer after you have to do in your room...I think for a cheap bed it is okay, but don't expect more

I’m seriously suspicious about any positive reviews here and am convinced they are fake.We had bad vibes from our arrival. Its in a sketchy place, the rooms are dirty, dark and smelly. Our balcony was actually just a view onto more loud and sketchy hostels, that didnt lock...you had to jam the door with a wooden pole. We had to swap the pillow and bed sheets we were given initially as they were seriously dirty...to be fair so were the sheets we ended up with, but the first ones looked like someone died on them.When I asked the man behind the desk if he had any reccomendations of stuff to do, he said ‘oh no, I mostly drink’. We did some laundry, whilst waiting with the 3 policeman who had come to the hostel for reasons I dont want to know.We paid almost 300 dollars for this experience.This hostel should be shut immediately to avoid ruining other people’s travel experience of Waikiki.

Pretty nice location, easy walk to bus stop, city centre and beach. A bit dated but what can you expect from a backpackers. Another hostel directly next door which is very loud. Semi private rooms are lockable. Cute marine themed wall. The breakfast was toast and jam and peanut butter, nothing fancy but it’s free. Not a bad place to stay

Great location and very affordable for Waikiki. It’s very old and the rooms are dark but clean. You can’t expect a hotel cleanliness or services and the breakfast is very simple and served in a strange hour for a tourist focused accommodation, between 9:00-10:00. There’s nothing cheaper than staying in a hostel for a solo traveller but if you are in 2 might have other options with a similar price.

I stayed at Wikiki Hostel for 1 week as a single girl traveler and I loved it. It is a hostel and not the cleanest, no hiding that. But the staff is great, so nice and try to help you any way they can. I got a 4 bed girl dorm, great people and room was nice. They have safes in the rooms, so your stuff is safe. Parking was great on site in garage. Breakfast was coffe and PBG sandwich, all i need. Shops just around the corner, good restaurants walking distans all around, Wikiki beach 4 min walk. Really safe neighbourhood, i walked alone at night and felt safe. ATM there, coffe shop 3 min away... Really great stay, good value.

Great location, not fancy at all, but it is a hostel after all. The Stayed 2 nights. Great price, great location, close to the beach, nice to watch surfers in the morning. Would stay again for a short solo stay.

Check in was easy, The room had 2 beds and a semi-private room as well, the room was clean and had a microwave, full fridge/freezer and a cooker, very few plates or cutlery.The rooms are very hot at nights even with fan on.The bathroom was ok, the shower not the best and the toilet paper is so thin.The breakfast is at 9-10 am only starts and finishes on time. They have toast, jam, peanut butter, tea and coffee.Plenty of places to seat in the common area and as a tv.The location is 1 block from the beach and the price is good value for the area.Staff are helpful with information.Internet good.Lockers are 25 cents every time you need to open them and are not the biggest.

This hostel is situated in a really good location, a few steps away from the main street of Waikiki and from the beach. Breakfast is only one hour from 9 to 10 am so a little bit too late for people that want to enjoy a full day of adventures in Oahu. It is also an average breakfast with little choice. Nevertheless, staff is really helpful and kind. Rooms are basic and not too clean but the price you pay is good for what they offer, considering we're in Hawaii. There is no elevator so it was a little bit hard to carry the luggage. On the whole, good but not excellent but a good compromise to stay in Honolulu for a cheap price.

Waikiki Beachside Hotel was not bad at all. The checking/check out was straightforward. They offered tea/coffee and toasts with peanut butter, jelly, and/or butter for breakfast. I stayed in a 8 beds female dorm which was pretty much a one bedroom apartment with two bed bunks in the living room, and two bed bunks in the bedroom. My roommates were awesome and we kicked it from day one. I never thought I would meet so many solo female travelers at once, but it was so empowering. Now I have girlfriends in even more places in the world: Israel, Germany, San Francisco, Canada, U.K, Switzerland...

Stayed in 3 in Waikiki and this was my favourite! Breakfast could be better but great shared room, great location, cool place! Seemed very social and the staff were very helpful too. Thanks for the trip!

This hostel is a great location literally central to all the best of the best. The beach one block away. They have a wonderful socializing area and a really nice zen area to read and listen to soft music was my favourite part. The rooms were average and had everything one needed. was nice to have a stove and fridge in the room.

Hostel is located really well close to the beach and shops. I had a 4 bed room girls share dorm. All the girls I met while staying there were really nice but the rooms were pretty basic. You don’t get a towel, get some sheets but have to make your bed yourself, the air conditioner in my room was pretty loud and weak too. Also in the morning the rooms get really bright not really good coverings on the window- so hard to sleep in. I was also located on the 4th level- there’s no lift only stairs and know one helps you carry your suitcase. The breakfast included is only toast, peanut butter, jam, butter and tea and coffee. Would only recommend this place if you’re on a budget trip :)

Oahu is a beautiful island with a lot to discover. The location of Waikiki beachside hostel is perfect to discover a lot of the sightseeing attractions. To do some hikes, get the app "All trails" and find the perfect one for you. I really loved the Coco Head hike.Waikiki beachside Hostel is a huge one and perfect to meet other travelers to explore the island with. The beds are not very comfy and the rooms are not always clean. But the staff is very nice and they try to help and support you in the best way possible.

This was my first time staying at this hostel but my father that I came with has stayed there 3 times now. I didn’t really know what to expect because I’d never stayed in a hostel before. It was a blast and the price for staying a block from Waikiki beach can’t be beat. You get to meet people from all over the world at this place. It was a great atmosphere and everyone; the workers and the guests, were all super nice. I will definitely come back to this hostel on my next trip to Honolulu.

We took this hostel for the great location. The room:The complex has a lot of (former) apartments which have a sort of living room with a small kitchen (microwave, stove and fridge) and two beds, a bathroom and a separate bedroom which we had. So you share the apartment with two other people. The rooms are kept clean daily and the beds were simple but ok. Air conditioner made a noise of a grizzly bear all night.Breakfast is included, coffee, tea, toast peanut butter and jam. No plates, the knives in the peanut butter and jam were full of stuff. The ladies who serve this are just standing there being shaggy and watching the clock until it’s 10 o’clock. * towels are NOT included but can be rented for $4, something Booking.com didn’t mention on their website. The staff:As long as we were there I saw none of the staff members smiling. When we arrived the girl at the reception was acting ok but later on when I had a question the two girls at the desk had more attention for the tv then for the guests. When we left it was the same, no friendly word and when we asked to store our luggage for a few hours they charge $5 per backpack, crazy!!The location:Literally 5 minutes walking from Waikiki beach so the location is great. Restaurant in all kinds are very near. In summary:The most simple thing that costs nothing is teaching your staff being friendly. The only reason I can imagine why this hostel gets so good reviews is the location.

I would like to thank all of my 3,995 readers of my previous review on Trip Advisor of the Waikiki Beachside Hostel. It's my most read review on trip advisor! After visiting here in May 2018 I would like to reiterate my last review back in 2016. Once again I would like to say (OUTSTANDING) and Thanks to the owner and staff for creating a safe environment and providing a remarkable experience to first time and repeat visitors traveling to Hawaii on a budget. Peace, Happiness and Longevity. Mahalo

I stayed here on my first trip to Honolulu. It was my first time traveling solo and I couldn't have been more grateful for staying at such a friendly hostel! The ladies I roomed with are so kind, and I made great friendships here during my stay. I loved how conveniently located it was to all the shops, stores, restaurants, and Waikiki Beach! I knew prior to my trip that I will be staying in a multi-bed room and that the amenities are not similar to a 5 star hotel, but I didn't mind it since the service was great and the ladies I roomed with were so welcoming to me! If you're budget traveling to Hawaii, definitely give this hostel a try!

Great hostel in WaikikiVery very close to the beachConvenient stores next door A bit noisy because of the building architecture but a great way to meet plenty of people travelling.Would go back there.

The bathroom smelt terrible 24-7, the staff were average at best. The place was just full of longterm staying americans - alot of them were crazy. The dorms were average and super hot! No fans were supplied to help. The only upside was the breakfast - which was okay. Left two days early because it was so bad!

This is an amazingly priced place to stay for where it is located, or anywhere for that matter. It's a hostel - expect what comes along with that; plane Jane furnishings, etc. but with nice staff and a safe environment. You are within walking distance to Waikiki beach, numerous restaurants and things to do, including the Waikiki aquarium, the zoo, and diamond head. The rooms were old in appearance but clean. I stayed here leading a school trip with 30 high schoolers (boys and girls both). Their prices made it affordable for the kids to have an amazing adventure. The staff were more than competent in helping me book such a fiasco of a trip. The greatest thing about this hostel though, was the wonderful staff member who helped my large group at 5 in the morning when our transportation to the airport (set up more than 5 months ago, mind you) didn't bother showing up. They were not answering their phones and were not returning my urgent messages. The man at the counter, I can't remember his name but he was Caucasian with a shaved head, took it upon himself to contact a fleet of different cab drivers to come by without any notice and truck all my kids and chaperones to the airport. If he had not been there to help, I don't know what we would have done. We weren't even late to the airport, thanks to him, and that's a big deal with 38 people!

Great location, 1 min walk from Waikiki Beach, very friendly staff - the rooms are weird though, they look like little condos where they have put bunks in. More bathrooms would be helpful. All rooms seem to have a kitchen which is a plus for the budget traveler.

I recently had my second visit to the waikiki beachside hostel. The first time around in 2016 I had an amazing stay largely due to the other guests and friendly staff.This time around the amazing atmosphere was gone and the staff were simply courteous as oppose to friendly. We also experienced some small easily resolved issues with our booking.We stayed in a 4 bed female dorm, it was clean, spacious and great value for money. The location is perfect, close to everything waikiki has to offer. He arm band style dorm keys can be worn 24/7 including in the surf. The staff uphold the noise curfew and are available round the clock making the street outside the hostel which can get a bit sketchy feel safe. I would both recommend and return to this hostel.

We went to Hawaii and were looking for a accomondation with a resonable pricing.This hostel did this job quite well:+ Very good location (2 blocks from the street and very close to an ABC store)+ Very nice staff+ Internet was working well in the "lobby", not so well in the roomsThis is just a info, not a complaint* its a hostel - things were available and OK - it is not expensive so don't expect luxury* There is no direct parking spot (as mentioned on the webpage) but not too far away there is a option to park on the street. This was quite fine for usAnyways - I'd come back if I would come to Honolulu again.

This hostel has a really great location, literally a block from the beach!! The rooms are outdated and very basic, but the staff is very helpful & kind :) the price is also good for the location as well.

This is a typical US hostel. It's just very mediocre. Location is excellent. Staff are very helpful and efficient. That being said, I've stayed in much cleaner and nicer hostels outside the United States.
