review_body: The crux of it is: the Waikiki Beachside Hostel is your typical hostel. You sleep in a bunk bed with a lumpy mattress and a pillow that really needs to be put out of its misery (although I actually slept pretty well), you share a bathroom with eight people (but there's only two towel hooks), and the rate is cheap.The staff are friendly and helpful, and the location is hard to argue against. The coin locker in the rooms is a bit of a scrooge move, the wifi always connects but the internet doesn't always actually work, and the air conditioning unit in our room looked as though it was roughly duct-taped into a hole carved in the wall.But it's a hostel. As long as your expectations are in line with that, you won't be surprised or disappointed.

Lemon road is about 10min walk from where everything is happening (where cheesecake factory, malls and hotels are). So Waikiki Beachside Hostel is 2min walk from the less crowded side of Waikiki beach. It is very convenient. ABC convenient store is just right outside, there is a Starbucks and Subway and Burger King nearby. The bus stops are just 2min away as well. The bus takes you to Pearl Harbour, the airport, Diamond Head etc ($2.50 for 1 way which can be reused within 2 hours)The free wifi is very slow but no problem, there is free wifi at the beach (public hawaii wifi). The free breakfast is limited in choice (peanut butter, jelly, toasted bread & coffee) if you want more choices you can pay for it. There is a small hostel cafe that serves breakfast lunch and dinner. We stayed at a semi-private room (a room in a room). We have our own private space and the balcony. We only shared the bathroom and the kitchen.The hostel is clean. But it probably depends on your room mates as well. Ours was super clean. Would recommend this place & would stay again if i ever go to Honolulu again.

I stayed at this hostel (Room 304) for just one night before my flight the next afternoon.The POSITIVES:-Good Wi-fi access throughout the property-Kitchenette, refrigerator, dishes and cutlery in shared room-Good security, with wristband electronic key. $20 cash deposit required.-Helpful staff who gave me detailed directions on how to climb Diamond Head-Clean rooms-I was able to get a free late check-out!The NEGATIVES:-Beds are a bit creaky-Coin-operated lock-box in room-No towels or hand-soap-No A/C in my room, only a portable fan and ceiling fan. The room seemed hotter inside than the air temperature outside!-My bed-sheet had tears in them.-Quiet hours are supposed to start at 10:00 PM; however, the receptionist on duty didn't switch off the loud music in the lounge area until 10:30 PM. And guests remained there until late chatting and drinking. Bring ear plugs just in case! Some guests had their doors open, and you could hear voices from the rooms.-One of the receptionists didn't seem to personally like me for whatever reason. When I requested a late check-out in the morning, he coldly shook his head, and simply said, "No." No reason was given or sense of empathy. I decided to ask a different receptionist a few hours later (when the first guy's shift was over), and she granted my request with no problem whatsoever. Why the discrepancy?

I went to Hawaii for the first time in August, and I thought that a hostel would be suitable becasue I was traviling alone. I found this hosel online and booked a 8 womens dorm. All in all Im happy, the room was nice and somewhere clean. The only thing was that the beds are a littlebit shakey, and there is no airconditioning.Otherwise I met so many nice people, even new friends, and the staff was really helpful!

I'll preface this by saying that I'm probably a little past my hostel days but in saying that, I didn't mind my stay. I stayed one night initially and then returned for 3 after visiting the Big Island for a few days. Pros - Most of the staff were really friendly. I arrived at about 7am after an international flight and was able to check in then and there - definite bonus, I was expecting to have to store my luggage etc. Then when I checked out, they didn't charge me because it was only an hour until my airport shuttle arrived. I didn't have a problem with the cleanliness of the bathroom or the semi-private room and common areas were well kept. I was also lucky enough to get relatively tidy housemates. Cons - I think the rooms probably need some maintenance - the aircons in the semi private rooms aren't great and the wifi can be patchy. Overall, would I stay again? Maybe not but I'm probably reaching the end of my ability to tolerate hostels for what they are stage of life. Would I recommend it to others? Yes, even if just for the location.

Been there in 2015 and had the time of my life! Right in the heart of waikiki beach and just 3 minnutes away from the beach! The staff was helpful and ready to help whenever had a problem especialy Yianni! I will be back soon! Loved my stay!

I've stayed in many hostels, and this was the dirtiest one I've stayed in. Panties and bikinis all over the room to hang to dry, a hole in the bathroom wall, hair everywhere, dusty fans, pop bottles that must have been there for days. We were not impressed considering what we paid. We got a hotel for a similar price and managed to have air conditioning and a bathroom that was clean. And this was just down the road from the hostel! Honestly, the location is amazing and the music was pretty cool. The employees were nice enough and I liked their key system but the facilities were just not good enough. I was so hot all night I slept terribly. If you are lucky to get a room with AC, count your blessings!

I stayed here for 8 days, and it was perfect for what I wanted. The rooms are hot, but you're by the beach so you should be out all day anyway. Rooms are cleaned daily, with bleach(you can smell it sometimes). Staff are willing to help, give advice and directions. They pass on messages that have been left by your operators. It is by a main road, so bring ear plugs. But if you're used to hostels, this is fine.

Can't beat the deal! Yes, it's a hostel which means you're going to be sharing space with others and will have to provide your own toiletries (general supply store right next door has everything you might need). I stayed in the four person women's dorm and yes, the rooms are stark but have the essentials of a bed, outlets to charge phones, fridge and microwave, and PLENTY of storage space including a balcony to dry your clothes. You can't beat the location: right at the end of Waikiki Beach and one block from the ocean with everything on the Waikiki Strip within a 30 minute walk (lots of live entertainment and free classes at the Royal Hawaiian Plaza). There are also public busses and excursion busses that leave from Waikiki to other parts of the island.Staff are very knowledgeable and polite. I also got very nice roommates that were easy to get along with (although one did turn on the light to read at 4PM some mornings). I hung out and did stuff with them part of the time and then did stuff on my own as well. I also was put on the fourth floor and there was no elevator but walking up and down all those stairs provided me a much needed workout and they staff said they can put people who don't want to do that much climbing on the 2nd floor instead.My own complaint is about the locker needing a quarter each time you want to put your stuff in to take out the key but there is a change machine in the lobby. If you're looking for a four star hotel with maid service and all the amenities provided, stay away. If you're looking for a place to sleep and store your stuff while you enjoy the beauty and activities of Waikiki and you're willing to share space with others, this is perfect!

The location of this hostel is nested between all the expensive hotels. The rooms are old, but clean and very spacious when it comes to hostel standards. Met a great bunch of people. It is one road away from the beach and very centrally located if u want to explore the Waikiki and Honolulu area by foot or hire a Moped at the store next door. I would recommend hiring a moped and travelling round the Island, which is definitely a very affordable and fun way to see the Island in one day.

The hostel has a very good location just next to the waikiki beach! The price is good for what you get! We were 3 friends and I booked a 4 bedroom! Unfortunately the forst night we needed to sleep seperately! Otherwise you have your own kitchen and bathroom! They breakfast is included, you get toast with peanutbutter and jelly:) The staff is friendly! And they clean your room everyday! We would go back:)

Stayed here over the past 10 days with a friend. What I love about it is the community of Travelers that come through this place. Many characters and you do get to meet some great people from all over the world. Rating this place is hard because as the previous review I just read also stated what we experienced. We did get cockroaches I'm sure this issue will be fixed and I certainly experienced the no internet on level 1, so make sure you have another source if you can. We also had problems with our air conditioner not working properly there were fans which we used as well. Some rooms are fine, but others have there issues. Rooms with kitchens didn't come with enough utensils to cook with. I wasn't wrapped with breakfast..so I bought mine for a cheap price at the little cafe attached. I staff were helpful and welcoming even though one if the cleaning staff suggested it cockroaches maybe our doing...how dare we use the kitchen to cook. hmmmGreat location to the beach at Waikiki..traveling on my own as a women this place is safe and other travelers look after each other. So ultimately if you want to meet people and of course the price here is great. Waikiki Beachside Hostel is worth a visit for those who want to meet people and save money. I also loved the space and artwork.

There is no internet on 4th floor, where i am staying. Manager Chris David don't let costumer play their own music on communal area. He only play his own playlist that no body likes.He started a contest on Instagram and promised to give free bed to winner every night. it was a total lye.The breakfast is worst ever. Only bread, jam, butter and peanot butter. They dont even give plates.There are cockroaches in every room.ople staying in the hostel.Just stay somewhere else.

Location:1 block from Waikiki Beach near the zoo.A take out place was there and bicycle and motorbike rental. Dorms:I stayed in an 8 bed dorm and it was split into 2 rooms of 2 bunk beds with 1 bathroom and fridgerator. If the rooms were a bit bigger, would have been better. There was a locker for 25 cents. It was a decent stay for 1 night. Staff:Very courteous and helpful. Lots of info and caring.Hostel:- has a lounge sitting area downstairs.- Wifi works well downstairs but not working well in room (was in 405) on 4th floor. - roughly 40 usd for a bed. - the store takeout place had good food. I may stay again but for a night or two only. It is not a bad option for a couple of nights.

I was passing through Hawaii and had an overnight layover, so gave this hostel a shot primarily to save money. It was not worth the savings. I was in a shared room (4 males). My room was on the street, so it was quite noisy. There was no AC on our side of the shared space, and even though it wasn't particularly warm out, I was quite sweaty in that room. It wasn't dark either. The other person sharing the space with me hijacked the only fan when he stumbled in so it was only blowing on him all night. All I needed was a modest place to close my eyes and get a little sleep, and this was a giant fail. Need a cheap place to stay in Waikiki, then this place is the spot. Don't bother with the breakfast - there is a great juice/sandwich spot just a couple blocks down toward the beach that is worth your time. I still have a bit of the backpacker spirit in me, but wouldn't recommend the shared rooms to anyone that can afford better.

Basically it's a good hostel which offers all facilities you need. The hostel is located very close to the beach. It's like a three minutes walk from there. The rooms are pretty clean because the friendly staff takes care about them every day. Unfortunately there are still cockroaches running through the room. Two things really annoyed me: The wifi and the lockers. At the wifi I got kicked out every couple of seconds, it's absolutely no fun to use it like this. So if you plan to video call somebody, this is definitely not the place to be. The bad thing about the lockers is, you get charged a quarter dollar for every use. You can't just use your padlock like in every other well equipped hostel in the world. A quarter dollar doesn't seem to be much, but well, you have to pay every time you lock the door, so you really have to think about, if you got everything in or if you need anything out before closing the door. I don't understand why the hostel accepts that guests may get robbed because they just prefer to refrain locking their stuff to safe their change.

This place is perfect for young people who cannot spent too much money, is very close to the beach and not exspensive. The room are not too big but you need just to sleep and take shower so is not a big deal, the problem it was the breakfast was not satisfied, just bread and peanuts butter nothing else.

My friend and I had booked a semi-private room at this hostel. Our room was the back room with an own balcony and you could lock the door so that the inhabitants of the front room couldn't access your room. Private locker for your valuable is available for each person individually next to the bathroom.The kitchen is in the front room, microwave and a fridge is also in there which is great to store your drinks and food. Basically, you are sharing the fridge,kitchen and bathroom with two other people and not with the whole hostel. The room is very basic but considering it's a hostel it fullfilled my needs. A further plus is that the Waikiki beach is only 5 min away by walk, what more do you want. Wifi was good in the room and in the common area downstairs. Unfortunately they don't offer any tours or events but that was Ok for us.

It was my first time staying in a hostel. i stayed in a 4 bedroom female dorm in single beds with aircon, fridge and shared bathroom inside. I arrived early from an 8 hour flight and wasn't able to checkin. The staff were happy to store my luggage while I used the phone to book tours during the day.The shower handle was abit difficult to open and the water leaked constantly.The hostel is located around the corner from ABC store , the trolley stops, short 2 minute walk to the beach! the staff are really helpful. You can hire scooters and surf boards downstairsGreat place to stay when you just need a bed to sleep on.

We've been there for 5 days. Check in possibility is 4 am each day, when we arrived at 11 pm, no problem for late check-in. Receptionist was great and told us everything what we would need to know. Breakfeast enough but not wide choice possibility. Room, when we stepped in, I've shocked. Blue room with no chair, gardrob. Good news was the balcony where we could spend our days if we wasn't at the beach. Summarized opinion is good, based on the prices we got.

First; I've never used a Hostel before. That being said, I wasn't too sure on what to expect during my 8 night stay.For me, check-in was quick and I was given a couple sheets and instructed to find a bed in my room and place my confirmation sheet on the clipboard at the end of the bed. So I located a bed, verified with the front desk that the person on the old confirmation sheet was no longer there, and made up the bed leaving my bag on top. Later, I came back on find my bag had been moved and someone sleeping in that bed. He didn't speak English so, that was a loss for me. That put me on the top bunk right in front of the small wall AC unit in the back room (the front room beds had to deal with the downstairs noise). I slept with ear plugs to muffle the noise. The unit also made it too cold for me to sleep...so I blocked most of the air with my backpack...but at least the room still had some cooling.The room was messier than I expected to find. There was stuff, clothes, suit cases here and there...but usually around a bed. The refrigerator (old) was about the same...impossible to tell what food belonged to who. The floor looked dirty (it was) and the bathroom was also pretty messy (at the end of the day, I guess that is what it should look like after guests are hitting the beach and then returning to clean up). It almost appeared as though there was no housekeeping services...but I later saw that there was a daily service. So apparently, we were messing up the place that quick! There are lockers in the room (takes US quarters only), but only one worked as the other 3 had foreign coins jammed in them. I was on the 4th floor so the free WiFi wasn't very good due to range. The bathroom definitely needed to be renovated. So these were a few negatives for me.There's no smoking anywhere on the property per a local law. But a couple of my roommates went on the patio any way to smoke...one of the other roommates complained to the front desk. They put up no smoking signs all over the hostel including inside our room.I had a rental car so I was really popular with my roommates. I parked on the street and usually had to walk a little ways for free parking. But never too far (at least for a jogger).You are located just a block from the beach and the Honolulu zoo. Also, this place is located at the end of the "tourist strip" of stores and restaurants....so walk up one side of the street as far as you wanted...then back on the other side. So these are definite pluses to picking this hostel.I did a short 5 mile jog around Diamond Head every day...usually in the morning, but a couple runs were in the afternoon. Going clockwise, I was in city for the first couple miles...but the second half was all along the ocean side where there was some awesome views. This again is another plus in my book.Now the water coming out of both the kitchen and bathroom faucets had a foul smell too it. To me, it smelled like something rotten or dead. I dreaded brushing my teeth..yuck! I mentioned this to the front desk and the hostel manager said he looked into it, but didn't notice it. So on check out, we both checked it out together. He agreed there was a weird smell to the water coming out of the bathroom faucet. So this is a negative to this place. I have no idea if anything was actually done to resolve this but suspect some effort was made based.There are only 3 washing machines and 4 dryers (US $1 each). When I went to use them, the housekeeping staff were using all but one of each. Why aren't they using the hostel industrial washers/dryers?...I later found out they don't have any. The rule is they leave at least one washer and one dryer open at all times. That is good in theory, but if more than one guest wants to do clothes at the same time, it doesn't work. So this was a negative.Breakfast: toast, coffee, water, peanut butter & jelly...no juice. I don't usually eat breakfast so I this goes down as a neutral rating cause I couldn't honestly rate a free breakfast...if that is what it really is.There's a big screen TV down stairs and some charging stations. Lots of people would hang out here depending on the time of day. I met people of all ages from everywhere around the world here. So overall, I don't know how to rate this place..compared to a hotel, it wasn't even close...but it's not supposed to be...you're sharing! I asked a lot of the other wayward travelers staying at this hostel how it compared to others they've stayed at...most said it was about average. Some have had better and some had stayed at much worse. So overall, I feel the place was a little run down and needs some updating. But it is manageable. The price is tough to beat. It's been years since I last visited Oahu..I was extremely disappointed in what I found due to growth and tourism. I probably won't ever be back to this island for vacation...that being said, it is not because of this hostel.Best advice I can offer on this place, is to reference other reviews for advice on this place as I just don't feel I know enough about hostels to give an accurate review.

Pros:Great location in Waikiki beach Cheaper than a hotel Cons:Everything elseThis is a genuine budget backpackers hostel. If all you're looking for is a cheaper hostel in good location, where you can put your bags and sleep at night, then go for it. But don't expect much here and you won't be disappointed. Rooms are somewhat clean, but in poor condition. When we arrived we checked into our room which hadn't been cleaned yet so that was a pretty bad effort by the staff. Staff are average to say the least. The job sort of gets done eventually, e.g checking is into a room which hadn't been cleaned then we had to wait while they cleaned it.The beds are very average, our doors and windows had holes in the mosquito nets and the air conditioner barely worked. The kitchen in the room had a stove and fridge but no cooking utensils or pots and pans etc... so the kitchen was a waste of space. The water was hot in the shower, that was a bonus. And there is wifi. I'm not in a hurry to stay here again and wouldn't recommend it.

For the money, this is great value with a killer location. Sure the rooms are very basic but good enough for the adventurous who just need a clean room with good staff close by. The manager is a great guy who takes his job seriously and does it well. Very nice front desk staff. I have been hear twice now and will be coming back. I stayed in a mixed dorm and everyone was very considerate of each other.

Overall it was bordering clean [a few marks on sheets and smelt like smoke and old looking]. Great great location! Very lovely and helpful staff! Great value for money- we had a double room with a shared bathroom our room has AC which was very much used' :) perfect for one or two nights.

This hostel is well situated and the staff is very friendly and the room was clean. But: the stairs and the corridors were dirty, the common space is an open garage: dark and unwelcoming. The are no activities organized or suggested for the guests, the information was minimal and impersonal, and the ambience is completely non existent. The Hostel is noisy, and the rooms are spacious, but the terraces too close the other building. The location is very good, close to the beach, the buses and the aquarium. I stayed only one night because I did not like it at all. I was reimbursed for the days i did not stay, that was appreciated. It depends on your expectations: just a place to sleep... if you don't mind the noise and the heat. I would not recommend it.

the staff were great. the location couldnt be beat-2 blocks to the beach. we felt safe. my wife & i are 56 and had our 19 yr old daughter. we booked a semi-private room (max 4) with a kitchenette and they didnt put anyone else with us which was very considerate. only thing is they do not supply towels (it said we could buy from them for $5 ea but they ran out months ago). so we had to go 10 blocks away to get cheap towels which we left with them for future use. their website needs updating with respect to their activities calendar (they dont have any anymore). we would stay here again given the prices around here

This hostel is my 3rd hostel i have ever tried in the US. This one is the best comparing to Miami and LA hostels.The room are spacious and there is a small kitchen+ fridge.The shame thing the locker isn't free i was prepared to bring my own key to use them, but you have to pay 25 cent per use / occasion. The bed is strong, the mattress is ok.In my room 8 people sharing a bathroom! in the morning and evening i have to wait to use it.Get ready this place is full of Asian people and they like getting up early - so noisy at 6amThe location is great, in the neighborhood local people live.But i am sorry your photos on tripadvisor are photoshopped! The place doesn't look so good in real life. And the lobby is a garage and everyone from the street can come in.

I don't have much experience staying in hostels so I'll just state the facts. It is in close proximity to the beach but further from nightlife. It is a bit loud because the common area is between 2 buildings so the sound echoes up to the rooms. The staff are very nice. The rooms and beds were decent. Breakfast of toast, butter, peanut butter, jelly, coffee & tea was good. One room had no air conditioner another did, but both also had a fan. They didn't have any towels left the 3 nights I was there. They do have limited parking spots.

Honestly location is very good as you are just a block from Waikiki beach but unfortunately this is the only good point consider that I spent 37$ per night!- Common area is an open garage- Rooms with a kitchen inside are too small for 8 beds and consider that it seems you sleep in a kitchen!- rent towel is extra 4$- deposit key is 20$Then after staying in hundreds of hostel around the World I saw the most unbelievable thing, the lockers (just 4) in the room were not free, you have to pay it everytime you use them! Yeah exactly if you close it and forget to take something and reopen again, sorry you wasted ur money!For me location is always important but in this case doesn't justify the lack of the rest.

I stayed here on my last night while in Hawaii. Their service was reliable and professional. They have many resources at the desk and the desk staff are willing to help you locate information or must-sees in the city. The hostel doesn't have an elevator but the rooms are clean and quiet.

We rented a private triple and were very happy. Had AC, comfy beds and a great shower. Parking right out front was free until 5pm then $10-15 overnight which was perfect as we had a rental car. Location was great, we walked around safely. Staff were great and let us change before our check-in time. Would stay here again.

there is no mistaking this place as anything else but a hostel with a large turnover of visitors. very run down and worn. luckily, just needed a place to store my luggage, bed to sleep and a shower. also, wifi on fourth floor very unreliable.i give it points for having an excellent location. only a block away from the beach as well as public buses, if you want to take in the other sights of honolulu. definitely stay in the semi-private room, which is a walled in section of a larger room. the only thing going for this semi-private 'room' (on the fourth floor) is that it is air-conditioned and surprisingly insulated against the street noise, while the outer room is not. don't know how anyone can sleep comfortably without AC or ear plugs.

The location is perfectly situated. A minutes walk to Waikiki beach and the zoo! There are two bus stops just around the corner from the hostel for just $2.50 (one way) can get you where you need to be on the island!! The staff at the front desk are very helpful and informative. Being a young female travelling by myself I felt very safe in Ohau. I thought that this was very clean for a hostel! They also offer free tea, coffee and toast 9am-10am. Enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

I rented a single spot in a 4-bed room. The rooms are previous 1BR / 1BA / 1 living room apartments. The bedroom in mine was converted to a semi-private room with a small AC. The living room which is by the door and kitchenette had two single beds very close to each about (about 2 feet) which made it a little awkward with a male and a female that close. The beds were very squeaky, not the bed itself but the frame would move on the floor metal on tile every time you moved much. The bed was not very comfortable, thin. You only get two thin sheets and a pillow cover - but since it's so hot that's all you need.There is a box fan in the room, only one fan for the room. It is very hot, even in October. It would be better if there were two fans so each person could have a fan blowing on them (there isn't a way to angle the fan to get it hitting both people. The kitchenette was a surprise, with a full refrigerator, oven/stove, sink, microwave, and some dishware.As others said, the lockers cost 25 cents each time.The room wasn't in very good repair. There were small ants that would roam the kitchen several times. The bathroom had a bunch of mold behind the sink. The shower was a little grungy.Breakfast is just toast, peanut butter and jelly, tap water, coffee (pretty good), and hot water for basic tea bags. It's only 9-10 am which means if you start the day any earlier you’ll miss it anyway. They don’t give you plates at breakfast, which isn’t good for a messy sandwich. Bring a plate from your room if you have one.It wasn’t too loud when I was there except for two of the seven nights when inconsiderate guests were loud in the lobby past the 10pm quiet hours. I called the desk and they said they would handle it, but nothing happened so am not sure they really cared.The only thing really good about the hotel is the location and the price. If that’s most important to you and you aren’t expecting a nice place, then this is your place. The bus stop is just a block away and I didn’t have to connect too many times. You are walking distance to the free Kuhio Beach and free hula shows on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday at 6:30. There is a small shop underneath with relatively cheap food – or there is McDonalds and Burger King a few blocks down the beach – everything else is pretty expensive.

Fast and easy check in and out. Clean and comfortable. I bunked with several types of traveller's but two young ladies from Europe asked to go surfing too. I was happy to oblige, it's the right thing to do....SHARE THE STOKE! And we were all stoked to a great morning set of waves.

It is one of the cheapest hostels in Honolulu and thats also what you will get. It is hard to find contact to others because it is quite big. But the location is great. You are just minutes away from the waikiki beach and also the busstop to get around. For low budget traveler like us, it is good.

It's a nice place to stay. Some of the rooms are with kitchen. The quality of cleaning depends on the housekeeper. Some of them are really precise, another ones are not.The main building needs reconstruction - the doors to the balconies are too old and it's hard to open/close them. No air conditioners in the big rooms. The windows have to be closed, otherwise you want be able to sleep because of the noise from the street.Anyway a lot of nice people over there :) It's pretty near to the beach! This is the best thing: I really enjoyed the sunrise and sunset almost everyday.Very nice and helpful personal.Mahalo :)

Our hostel came with a room that has air con and we had to share it with another 2 patrons. One night was about $40. Pretty decent for a room that has a toilet and shower facilities (shared between 4 people), a comfortable bed with pillows, bedsheets and blanket. There's also a kitchen and stove. You can make your own meal if you want to. A fridge to keep your drinks chilled. The only thing you need to bring are towels and your toiletries.

No rooms available at decent price in Waikiki except this. $40 for a bed in a room of 4 beds. Fortunately I got a bottom bunk. No A/C and very loud...you can hear all street noise. Also you have to bring your own towel...or buy one but they were out. One shared bath for eight beds. Guy in bed across from me threw up in the bathroom. I guess you get what you pay for....lol

If you want a good place to crash or dont want to spend too much on accommodation this is a very good hostel on the lemon road with very close access to the beach. The Waikiki beach strip is just 2 minute walk. Transportation is accessible from two sides the beach or main road. Rooms are good can get a bit hotter but few rooms have AC. Access to the facility is restricted using chip system and guess what! the room key is waterproof so swim with it without having the fear of losing them. Overall a good location if you like beaches and shopping. The rooms are clean, beds are nice and clean bathroom but lockers inside the room are paid you need a dollar to lock it every time you access it.

During the labor day weekend, I found this place to be the cheapest in Waikiki area. Although it involved sharing a room, I saved almost 200 dollars a day, just selecting this place over a hotel. The location is wonderful. Just one block away from the beach, the zoo and many other locations. I have seen many hostel residents carry their surfboards and walk to wherever they could surf. The beach that is closest to the hostel is the most peaceful one as it has a breakwater wall. There are many wonderful restaurants and stores. A cheap carry out is attached to the hostel for budget friendly food purchases. Two to three ABC stores are located within a block. The ABC stores are the Hawaiian versions of 7-11, albeit a lot more items to choose from. The hostel itself is clean and the rooms spacious enough. I had to share a 4 bed room. The beds are firm enough to sleep on. You get a set of sheets to lay on your bed from the front desk. Housekeeping is punctual. It is not noisy at night as there is a noise curfew at 10 PM. A scooter/moped rental place is attached to the hostel for convenience. Local residents are discouraged by asking for an onward travel reservation, this keeps the hostel trouble free. The airport shuttles recognize the address. Breakfast is free, but it only consists of PBJ sandwiches and coffee. Residents are friendly and it is a good option to save money if you are travelling alone. Waikiki hotels are pretty expensive. The main shopping area of Waikiki is a short 10 to 15 minute walk away.

review_body: Waikiki Beachside is in the perfect location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I stayed in an all girls 8 bed dorm and thankfully had lovely ladies in my room. The room itself was dirty and falling apart. The shower was breaking and sometimes it was difficult to turn on. The air conditioner didn't work and if the window (that doesn't have fly screens on it) was open we got a nasty smell from a dumpster across the road. The hostel had a great vibe though. I was there for 2 weeks over 4th of July and it was very busy. Their 10pm noise cut off in the lobby area was fantastic if you had an early morning. I had friends staying in a different building of the hostel and their room was new and very clean with no problems.They have free use of snorkels, floating rings and beds for the beach which came very handy most days. The wifi was very slow, but mostly because of how many people used it. The security at night was great with the keys/wristbands.

The hostel is a nice one close to the beach which different types of rooms (from private room to doorm). Cleaning was every day and breakfast was ok; we only tried it twice. The staff was helpful and friendly. I will stay there again, if I would make it back to Hawaii again.

I've stayed at several hostels during my travels and this would have to be the worst.The rooms are dirty and the air conditioner barely worked. There's lockers in the rooms but you have to pay 25c every time you open them to lock them again - ridiculous!

Friendly staff, clean & conveniently located hostel with good wifi coverage into the rooms plus a change machine that is useful if you've run out of quarters for the buses. Breakfast is only coffee or tea with peanut butter and jam on toast. Luckily I happen to like this American staple so no complaints there but some of the extra charges annoyed me such as lockers in the room cost $1 every time you used them and bag storage on check out was $5. I've never had a hostel charge me for bag storage ever! Towel was $4 for a hand towel and though I don't mind hiring one, it seemed excessive. Check in was at 3 pm and this was not waived when I arrived in the morning even though the 8 bed dorm I was booked in only had 2 other occupants. One of the guys I met at the hostel told me they let him check in at 11.30 pm so they aren't thinking of disturbing sleeping customers. Overall, I would look for another place next time to see if i could better.

The atmosphere and feeling of this hostel is so disappointing compared with so many other great places ive stayed. instead of making you feel welcome you're made to feel like just another tourist coming through the door for them to scam - the website advertised special offers which on arrival they added additional terms to which were not displayed on their website which was misleading. they also make you pay a $20 deposit for their key/wristband which is extremely flimsy and breakable from which they hope to make more money off you. you also have to pay for lockers, and even to leave your bag in the luggage room! gives off such a bad vibe, to them your just another tourist and a chance to make a quick profit off.I've stayed at loads of hostels but this was especially poor. rooms were dirty and the floor was rarely cleaned, no air con, beds are so cheap you can feel every movement of the person on your bunk, they advertise 'breakfast' which is just bread and coffee (no milk for your coffee). Also advertised as some sort of party hostel but at 10 they chuck you out.Overall its everything a hostel shouldnt be and makes your trip worse when you know your just another one for an opportunist hostel to make money off.Avoid and stay elsewhere

Just love this place! The vibe is awesome, very close to the beach and car rental place. We met really great people and the staff was super friendly. I will recommend to all of my friends. Wouldn't have gone anywhere else. Very clean and safe place to stay.

Its just minutes from the beach and has a great location for going exploring in Honolulu as it is close to the bus stops. It was a good place to stay for a while and the set-up makes it so that you get to know people from all over the world. I'd stay there again if I travel to 'Oahu again.

I went to check in and they gave me my room information and then I went to the room and saw about a 50-60 year old man in my room. I was confused because I booked a 4 female only dorm, and all of the precious hostels I have been in were for college students and younger individuals. So I went back downstairs and somehow my reservation had got messed up in there system. Luckily I had my reservation and booking I formation printed out. The staff were very nice with looking through the system and trying to figure out what happened. I was staying for three nights and they were only able to get me in a female form for 1 of three nights. I ended up cancelling my reservation for the others nights because I was VERY creeped out. The staff was great with refunding me but I simply was not impressed. The breakfast was only peanut butter and toast. So very friendly and nice staff trying to help but I unfortunately did not have a great experience with the errors and the inside cake who stayed there creeped me out.

This is a very nice place for students, international visitors, and anybody with a shoestring budget to call home away from home in Honolulu's Waikiki Beach area. This place is just 3 minutes walk from the beach, 2 minutes walk from the bus stop on Kuhio Rd, 4 minutes walk from the Zoo, and less than 1 minute walk from restaurants, bars, and shopping. The rooms are small, each with up to 4 beds. Coordinating bathroom timings can be a bit of a problem. There are microwaves and kitchenettes with kitchen supplies so those that don't eat outside can feel completely at home, with some homemade food. Maintenance comes in once daily and makes sure the place is clean. Receptionists are friendly and knowledgeable about the area, including landmarks and tours.Breakfast is not included but there is a cash-only restaurant downstairs that serves breakfast upon order. Some rules are pretty weird - like one cannot have visitors, and has to bring the bed sheets down upon checkout. And they charge $5 for holding on to your bag after checkout!An AWESOME place overall - highly recommended for tourists on a budget.

Clean, VERY SAFE, walking distance to the beach. Met some Great people and would definitely stay here again.I was in a all girls room for 4 and rarely saw the other 3 guests. Room had EVERYTHING needed for a paradise trip if your traveling alone or on a budget.

A friend and I stayed here for a week in an 8 bed female dorm. Staff are nice and lovely. It has all the basics you need for accommodation - free wifi, a semi comfortable bed, air conditioner and a bathroom. it is amazing for the amount of money you pay. The whole time we where the room was never filled up. My friend and I literally had a room to ourselves for a good 3 days, people come and go and you actually meet some really cool characters. The only down side is that the location is pretty much at the end of the main strip, so it takes longer to walk to the other end of the strip (but to be fair, it only takes like 20 minutes and I'm just lazy) and that the bathroom is not super clean but is clean considering 6-8 girls have to use it everyday. There's also laundry facilities down stairs (for a charge), which is handy and continental breakfast is served everyday - toast, cereal tea and coffee. You just need to remember to bring a towel.

We came to Waikiki Beachside Hostel tired and out of mood. We were greeted with a smile and we immediately felt welcomed and our mood was lightened up by the staffs positive energy. Coming straight from another hostel, we were surprised how clean and spacious our room was. There's even a refrigerator and a microwave in the room that we could not have been expected to see, since the other hostel(which cost as much for a night) didn't even have any tables or dressers where we could place our belongings. And you can have a morning coffee and peanut butter and jelly toast for free. We we're really satisfied with everything. Princesses might complain about the air con making too much noise or the fact that you have to make your own bed. We didn't mind.

The road is a bit hard to find and the street sign has been taken down. The majority of the staff were really friendly and very helpful! The one gentleman at the Front Desk remembered you by name even if he had only seen you once. The one Night Audit man was wonderful and always had a smile. If you are wanting to leave your bags talk to the Front desk, they are mostly accommodating. Breakfast was basic but still good. The breakfast attendants were not friendly. Housekeeping could clean a bit better, hairs on the beds etc. The Aircon does not work in some rooms or they just provide a fan, which was appreciated!If you are staying for a week make sure you tell them at the beginning if your stay they will not offer a discount if you do not book all the nights together.

I've stayed twice at this hostel because it takes just a few minutes to walk to the beach, and it's been a great place to meet people. Add on top the free breakfast (peanut butter/jam + toast) that's the only reasons I've stayed here.I will not be returning to this hostel for a few reasons. There seems to be no maintenance (care) for the property. The rooms I've stayed in are in pretty bad shape; chipped paint in the rooms, and blinds missing from the curtains. I'm a light-sleeper so the sun coming through the, many, missing blinds didn't help me sleep very well.Their bunk-beds are the squeakiest I have ever heard! I was on the top bunk, both times, and they make so much noise I had to apologize to the person below me many times! During my last stay at this hostel I was required to pay for them to hold my luggage. I have worked at hotel's in Canada and Australia and I have never had to have a guest pay for us to hold their luggage.

A place for travelers from all around the world. I absolutely love it. Great location and friendly staff. The owners are relaxed and integrate Peace, Loving Kindness, and Harmony throughout the hostel. It's truly the place to be in Waikiki.

I've stayed in hostels in New Zealand and Japan. This one was a let down. I'll start with the good.Great location (walk to most hot spots). Ease of check in (front desk manned 24hr).Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Big fridge. That's it. That's all the positives. Negatives. Tired rooms (old and need a refresh). Not well cleaned (long hairs and stained pillows).Air con doesn't really do much and it's noisy. Sheets not changed once the whole week. *you are given sheets when you check in and have to make your own bed.Kitchen has minimal utensils. Lots of plates though. Breakfast is very basic. Coffee was terrible and no milk was supplied. Stay here if you want as I can't say it's the worst in Waikiki as I haven't stayed anywhere else in Hawaii but I won't be returning.

waikiki beachside hostel is a reasonable priced hostel. i stayed for 1 week in a 2 bed dorm it had a full kitchen in it. everything worked and clean. the location of the hostel was perfect around the corner from waikiki beach,shop's, restaurant's and the bus line. most everything was walking distance. they even have a outside common area to hang out at it does get a little loud out there at night, so make sure you bring ear plugs to get some sleep. it's a true surfer's hostel.

Coos Bay, Oregon, United States

review_body: No expections when we arrived, we where pleasently surpised. Very nice location next to beach and shops. People staying at hostel Was super friendly and we had a great time here! Would recommend it to younger people as it can get a bit loud during evening.

Best thing about this place is the location - 5 min walk to the beach and close to the bus stop to get anywhere in Waikiki.I also love that the room had its own bathroom and kitchen.Staff were helpful too.Only downside was that they didn't manage guests who were making a lot of noise late at night while drinking (not good when you've got an early start the next day!)

We stayed in a semi private room - it's a room that locks inside a hotel room that has extra beds in the kitchen/dining area, shared bathroom. While it's not a fancy or modern place it had everything we needed. The beds were comfy, the place was clean, there was breakfast included from 9am to 10am, and they have free/cheap beach gear, surfboard and snorkel rentals. The rentals are handy because the hostel is located just one street back from the beach. It's also within walking distance of several attractions including the Honolulu Zoo and various shops and restaurants. Also close to bus stops.

Me and a good mate stayed in a private room for 8 days. The room has two single beds and can be locked. The room is attched to a main room with an additional two single beds for other people. It also has a shared bathroom and kitchen area with fridge and stove. Apartment was neat and clean, also private room was airconed.Staff are 24h and extremely helpful and friendly. Downstairs common area are full of friendly travelers willing to have a cold beer and chat. They offer free breakfast and is only one block from beach. A certainty for anyone traveling on a budget or with mates. Extremely happy to recommend! Cheers to the staff for a great experience!

Staff are friendly and helpful. Location is great, bus stops at either side of the street, a block from the beach and same great restaurants. You really don't have to go to far to find what your looking for.

I stayed in a 8 people shared bedroom. Includes kitchen, and a bathroom. As you are sharing with 7 other people do not expect a super clean bathroom, but it was not bad at all. They have a 4 bedroom units as well and I'll try it next time.Super friendly staff, people from all around the world and free breakfast included ( PBJ and coffee makes a good start for your day )

This place is scruffy and the room was dirty. I did not recognise it from the photos ! There is free wifi and it works well . I booked. Through flight centre and had asked for an all female dorm. I was in two bed room with a young man who was a real gentleman but. I think he was quite shocked by my presence !The lounge area is just an outside area with some chairs and tables and again scruffy and dirty.The night receptionist was helpful and he made it bearable. His name " Janni". He phoned the shuttle service twice when it failed to turn up. It was still 30 minutes later.

If your looking for a cheap low key, quite place for you to toss your stuff while you hit the beach. . . this may not be the place for you. With that being said if you're looking for a good time with easy going people and are ready to party, look no further. When I stayed I can't say I was really expecting either or but I know now that if I want to relax I should invest in a hotel. The staff were fantastic and so accommodating, myself and my friend were actually booked to stay at a hostel down the street but when we arrived they didn't have a room for us. Beachside welcomed us with open arms and even gave us a discount so that we could stay without blowing our budget! The rooms are dirty, but equipped with a kitchen and lockers (coin operated). No air conditioning but you do get a giant fan so it does help a lot. Keep in mind there is no elevator, which is fine, but when its blazing hot and you've already climbed to the top floor 6 times in one day its a little daunting.  The other guests in the hostel were so friendly they welcomed us with open arms like family, but they like to party. It may have just been a wild crowd when we stayed but they partied till the sun came up, would crash for a few hours and were hammered by 11 am again. Management did a great job at keeping everyone in line to a certain extent, but I would not recommend this to a mature couple. College students? Bohemian travellers? This is deffs the spot for you! The big question is, would I stay again? Yes. But only if I was geared up for a crazy and exhausting time. . . well worth it for the life experience though.

The outdoor common area is not especially great and closes at 10pm. Lockers take a quarter EVERY TIME you open it and want to lock it again - WHAT?! No option for own lock. Rooms were very basic, no soap and noisy fan. Mix of adults and young people, had a fun night. Late 1 hour breakfast from 9-10. Only stayed for one night, but it was a disappointment that a Hawaiian hostel was so lame.

We stayed here for five nights over new years 2015/2016. The hostel doesn't really have any rules and we had some very rude roommates for the first couple of nights who would turn the light on when they came in at 1am and refuse to turn it off for hours.The hostel is not very well cleaned with former guests rubbish left in the room the whole time we were there. The staff were helpful but not the friendliest we have experienced.The hostel is very close to the beach (about one block) but right down one end of Waikiki. After five nights we moved to the Seaside hostel which I would definitely recommend over this one.

The hostel is clean. I met alot of awesome and fun people here. The atmosphere (depending on what day/s you go, can be very lively. As far as staff friendliness goes, everyone was pretty nice except for the one, she wasn't friendly at all. This hostel doesn't have a curfew (not including the common area) so if you are looking for a quite hostel and a good nights sleep, go somewhere else. If you are looking for a fun party type vibe then this is your hostel. Over all, I enjoyed my experience here and would stay again.

4 bed female dorm with microwave + fridge/freezer => just perfect. Very good location: a 2-minute walk from the beach. Only one major drawback: I booked in June for my Christmas break and they put me in the noisiest room I have ever stayed in!!! Room 301 looks onto the very noisy street! Bring ear plugs or you'll wake up at 5 every morning!!!! But cheap place with free breakfast!

This was my first experience being in a Hostel. Although, I checked in at the end of the day , weary from the long flight, I was energized by the smiling friendly faces who greeted me at the registration desk. The instructions (house rules) were easy to understand and my questions were answered in that same friendly manner. I shared rooms with 4 other adults. we had a refrigerator and a microwave. We had daily room service. Coffee toast, etc were offered every morning,The location was perfect for me, only 4 blocks to the venue. The beach is only one block away, and was accessible before and after my meetings. About 6:00 am the trucks came to make their deliveries and that created some noise. Most of the time I slept right through it.

My husband and I were in Waikiki for a workshop. The venue hotel was $299 pre-tax per night for small rooms without a refrigerator or microwave. We stayed in 2 large rooms with 2 other friends with a full bathroom at a fraction of the price. We had a full sized refrigerator and microwave. This meant we could buy local produce and prepare food during workshop breaks. We could eat late at night when restaurants were closed. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Coffee and toast at 9:00 a.m. come with the room and the laundry area is easily accessible. It was clean and housekeeping staff came in daily. This is may be a no frills stay, but it is well worth the daily rate and perks. It is only a couple of short blocks from the beach. (Just bring your ear plugs if you are sensitive to early morning urban noise.) In just a few minutes walk and you'll be at the beach, shops (if that's your interest), restaurants, and public transportation is easy here. We would recommend this hostel.

I have stayed here twice in the past because I think it's such a great hostel. I stayed in an 8 bed mixed dorm both times. The 8 bed dorms are split into 2 rooms with 2 sets of bunks in each. It is well priced for a great location (5 min walk to the beach), the rooms are neat and tidy and cleaned every day. You get a waterproof wristband which is your key so you never have to worry about forgetting or losing it! There is a deposit for this but you get it back when you return the key. It is also close to bus stops to get to Diamond Head or Pearl Harbor. Walking distance to convenience stores and supermarket. I really enjoyed my stay here. The front desk staff were really helpful and cheerful. Linen is included in the proce and is clean and pressed. Lockers are 25 cents per use. There are plenty of social activities and free breakfast every morning! They also do surfboard hire and have a bunch of floaty rings and beds for the beach. There is also a scooter/moped rental place next door. The rooms I stayed in had a kitchen but I also know there are some without. If you are a light sleeper I would recommend earplugs and an eye mask because of the noise and sometimes there are trucks on the street early in the morning. If you rent a car there is on site parking but spaces are limited and there is a fee. There are a lot of stairs if you are on one of the higher levels so pack light!

I didn't have high expections coming to this hostel after reading several other reviews. My friend and I stayed in a shared room with 2 other travellers (we had a semi-private). I would never book at this hostel again just because it was quite dirty and not maintained at all. No one came to clean the rooms and by the time we got there, other travellers have left the room and the bathroom as it was. We were given our own sheets to make our bed and then return it once we left.Even with the semi-private room, we had to walk across the living room where there were two other beds for the two backpackers who were quite friendly and cool. We ended up hanging out with them! This place is great for meeting other travellers, but definitely not if you want to properly sleep or feel clean...We also got to see the dorms and met other travellers- I was so lucky that I didn't book a dorm because it seemed horrendously gross! Backpackers' stuff everywhere on the floor; I don't know how no one would be worried about their belongings. The dorm smelled and was just like a bunch of college students' afterparty. Not the hostel's fault, but seems like they don't really enforce any rules or look after their rooms as much. The staff didn't really do much - check in and check out was simple, fast, and easy. The BEST thing about this hostel was the perfect and central location! It was just a step away from the beach and we went out several nights and walked back home around 3am/4am and was all fine. Everything was at a wonderful distance to go and explore. Even catching a LYFT/UBER, or the bus to Ala Moana was cheap. If you want to save money (even though this place is really expensive for the quality!!! BUT everywhere in Waikiki will be exorbitant, even the horrible ones), meet other travellers, party, this is the place for you. But it you want somewhere clean, a bit more trustworthy, then best to look elsewhere.

Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: We tried this hostel as a different way to experience Waikiki and traveling. We booked a semi private room, so we had AC and a balcony. But the beds had stains, we flipped them. The sliding door to the balcony didn't open very well, and didn't even shut the whole way. The bathroom was rough, not very well maintained. I guess if the other two in the room would have looked at us and maybe tried to say hi, we would have felt like more comfortable. For $10 more dollars each we got a great hotel room down the street...with a pool!!!

Amazing hostel. The people were extremely friendly and resourceful. Awesome location, everything is within walking distance. I always felt safe. The room was clean, had a great kitchen in it. Nothing but good things to say

The room was poorly maintained. The beds were stained and extra squeaky. If you are staying here I would certainly recommend ear plugs and an eye mask. Cleaning staff are nice but have little regard for personal items and space. I don't expect hotel conditions when staying at a hostel, but I have stayed at many hostels and this comes close to the bottom of all that I have stayed at. The front desk workers were welcoming and inviting, but overall I'd suggest other places to stay if they are available as this is not worth the cost.

I stayed there for 4 nights during my solo trip to Hawaii, and then switched to a nice hotel for the last 2 nights using my credit card points. The stay in hostel was overall a good experience, especially for the price and location. I booked a bed in the 4-bed female dorm. 2 beds are in the semi-private room which has access to a small balcony. The private room doesn't seem to have a door. My bed is one of the two beds outside in the kitchen area. My roommates were quiet and considerate, besides, none of us cooked so it was quiet enough to sleep at night...well, most nights. The last night there was a fight/argument in the other building, and the noise lasted hours in the early morning, until after someone pulled the fire alarm. It was my last night there so I didn't even bother to complain. I just wanted to sleep for as much as I can and leave the next morning. I don't remember the room having A/C, or maybe I didn't pay attention. I traveled in mid-late April and the temperature was perfect. I didn't find the need for A/C. pros: - Great location, close to everything. 5 minute walk from Waikiki Beach and bus stops, surrounded by plenty of restaurants, bars, and of course the famous ABC convenient stores. The area seems to be safe. - Price: You just can't beat that price for a location like this. - The fun - I became friends with two of my roommates. We did some exploration and activities together in Hawaii. One of them even came visit me in my city a few months after the Hawaii trip!- Staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful. - My room was on the second floor, above the reception area, and wifi was strongCons: - Cleanliness. When I arrived the first night, I found huge (I mean huge) brown stains on both of my pillowcases. I was grossed out, but since it was my first experience staying at a hostel, I wasn't sure if this is considered "common", and I was very tired after a long flight, so I slept on it that night. The next day I bumped into the cleaning lady and asked for a clean pair. She looked apologetic when she saw the dirty pillowcases. I am not sure if they have just forgotten to change my sheets before I arrived or what. - No place to hang clothes or towels. There are 1-2 hooks behind the bathroom door, but outside the bathroom there are no place for guests to hang their damp towel or clothes. Even tough I kinda came "prepared" and brought two clothes hangers, there was no where to hang them. I eventually hung them on the metal bar on my bed. I found this very inconvenient. I mean, no one wants to put wet towels and bikinis on their beds. And how much does it cost to put some some plastic or metal hooks on the wall? Like 2 dollars? This is a cheap and quick improvement the management could have done, and it would have provided so much more comfort and convenience to their guests.- Leak problem in the shower. In our room whenever someone showered, the water would leak from somewhere on the bottom of the tub and the floor would be all wet and slippery. The one tiny towel on the bathroom floor isn't enough to soak up that much water, so we have wet slippery floor all the time. It's dirty and could be dangerous. My tips for staying at this hostel: 1. Bring two towels, or buy two at the front desk. One for the shower and another for the beach. 2. Bring 1-2 clothes hangers. You'll need it to hang your wet towel or bikini, but good luck finding a place to hang them. 3. The in-room locker cost 25 cents per use -- every time you take out someone from the locker, you'll need to pay again to lock it. If you want to save a few bucks, only lock the valuables that you don't use during your stay, such as your passport, extra cash, etc. During my stay I put these in the locker in my first night and retrieved them the day I left. 4. If you are a female, it's worth paying a little bit more for the 4-bed female dorm. The beds in the kitchen don't cost that much more anyway. You'll feel safer and more relaxed compared with staying in a mixed dorm with 6-8 other people. 5. If you rent a car, which I did for one day, you can park at one of their two on-site parking lots. But be sure to reserve a space at the front desk in advance, since there are only a few spaces. The cost is approximately $10/day (can't remember exactly). The conclusion: If I travel solo again to Honolulu, I'd consider staying at this hostel again. If I travel with someone else, it may be better to stay at a lower end hotel and split the cost.

Location was great! We booked a private room but for a week but had to stay in the all female dorm the first night because the private wasn't available. The all female dorm was horrible, but mainly because the bathroom was filled with hundreds of old shampoo from probably past guests that were never thrown away and it was just gross from all the dirt accumulation. I was so happy because the semi private was clean and the AC in our room was heaven. We stayed on the 4th floor so WIFI didnt catch in our room. Luckily we stayed with two other guys who were clean and so I would recommend to get the private! Front desk people were AWESOME

That is a good and affordable hostel. To Waikiki, it is interesting to meet new people and get some fun conversation. There are several places near to eat fastfood, markets and hotel with shoppings so you won't miss too much time to reach them besides it is a walking distance to the beach. I think it's expensive for the service offered but it is the most affordable in that area.

I feel I must state this at the beginning of all my hostel reviews after seeing so many other's Hostel reviews. Hostels are budgets accommodations, if you want 4 star or 3 or even 2 star service book a 2,3,4, star hotel and pay the price. Or call and ask questions before booking.Also I am writing this 6 month after stay Mar 2015 so I am focusing on most basics that shouldn't have changed. Staff was ok though they may have changed. The locations is ok for Beach, zoo, but you'll need bus or car to get to most other attractions. Fortunately bus stop 1 -2 blocks away. There is also a strange small car rental next door.There are 3 ABC Stores nearby for quick food and souvenir items and 3 blocks of shopping mostly major chains with some independent types, also same with restaurants.I will say this is the first hostel I stayed in that had a full size fridge and 4 burner stove in the room. I don't know if all have this so ask. but that is why room got above average. It was an 8 bunk mixed dorm booking but two rooms with 4 bunk in each made it less crowded. 1 full bath for all 8 bunks, but wasn't a problem.neat wristband key made I a little less likely to lose.Breakfast was simple with peanut butter and jelly no juice or milk so if this is important to you ask if it's changed. It was also out side in the common room area, there is also a reading room across from the common room.I also stayed at the hostel two building down and rate that one slightly below this one. see review.

Good things to say: Close to the beach, friendly staffNot-so-good things to say: Pricey for a hostel. I've stayed at much cheaper hostels where I'm even given free FOOD and a drink ticket for my first night! I paid so much and received so little. The maid never came and cleaned.. our bathroom was gross. I also discovered I was charged more money then some of my other fellow hostel pals... which seemed very strange and sketchy to me.

Pro: Each dorm room has its own bathroom. Con: The dorm rooms (rooms, bathrooms, etc.) and the hostel itself isn't all that clean.Pro: Breakfast is included.Con: Breakfast only includes coffee, bread, peanut butter, and jelly.Con: Beds aren't assigned. First come first serve. If you are on the top bunk, good luck finding an outlet to charge up on. Con: No AC and no fan in room. Tip: Make sure your windows are open.Pro: Free Wifi.Con: Checking in took forever. They require a deposit for parking and room key.Pro: Onsite parking.Con: Parking onsite is not included in room fee and is not free.Overall: I have experienced much better.

We stayed in a private 4 bed dorm. It was clean, close to the beach and suited our purposes, since we were mainly looking for a place to sleep, shower, and keep our stuff while we were out exploring the island. The room did get hot, but it's hard to say if that was typical or because Oahu was having unseasonably hot weather when we were there.This place is no frills, but the staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and secure - they have wristband keys, which is much less likely to get lost than a key card. So if you want a cheap place to stay in Waikiki, the Beachside Hostel fits the bill.

The location of the hostel is perfect, just 2 min. to go to the waikiki beach! The staff is very friendly. I arrived a bit earlier before check in, but I was allowed to put my baggage in a locked room. The staff could me answer every question I had. You can rent e.g boogie boards, snorkels, etc for FREE! I stayed in a locked double room with A.C. And I suggest everyone to take this kind of room, because it can be very hot in the night. The next time I would choose the same place!

The best hostel were I was. Free breakfast. Nice staff. Hostel was located in city center, very close to the beach. I spend there 3 nights. Room clean. No problem at all. Highly recommend for students as price was very low per night (about $ 25-30)

We stayed at the Polynesian, Waikiki boutique and Waikiki beachside and this was the best of the 3 in all areas, staff, security, cleanliness, value for money. We had a double room with shared bathroom and a/c for a fraction of the price. Security was a different level also with coded bands

Great place, all facilities needed In a great location. Friendliest staffHad a great time, would go backAny time, near bars restaurantsClose to the beach, inexpensiveCar parking if needed. GuestsFrom all over the world, everyoneJust having fun

Its 2min walk from the beach, $30/night and its clean!! This is perfect for any backpacker looking for a nice, cheap place to stay, and its open all hours of the night for late check-in. I don't have anything to complain about after staying here for 3 nights.

Don't really have a right to complain about anything when you're spending $30 a night in an area that usually costs at least $200. I'm thankful for the hostel since I wouldn't have been able to afford to stay in Honolulu otherwise. Good Location. Only thing I missed about staying in a regular hotel were the fresh towels, but they do have laundry facilities on site too.

Perfectly adequate hostel, showing it's age and a little grimy but you get that with a place so close to the beach! (legit one street back!)Stayed in a 2 bed semi private and cannot reccomend enough, if you've got two of you travelling together it works out at a similar price to 2 dorm beds, without having to sweat it out with 6 others. Regardless the price is a bit steep for a hostel, but the location makes up for it. Despite its size this hostel was surprisingly quiet, a bonus when you've had a huge day exploring. Free breakfast was pretty standard for a hostel so no complaints.The keys are an awesome idea, no need to stress about losing them if its on your wrist 24/7!Tl;dr: this place isn't the nicest to look at, but as a place to crash it works just fine.

Spent a few nights here while I checked out Oahu on my way home to NZ from Maui. I spent little time in the room aside from sleeping and showering, which was good as there wasn't much else to do there. Lots of young travelers up for a chat, which is a great vibe to be a part of. Really good location close to some great restaurants at good prices, and very close to the beach. Found this hostel by searching for the cheapest accommodation in Waikiki, and got pretty much what I expected. No frills, but easy and cheap place. Great for a few days as a young traveler.

We had a semi private room with 2 other people sleeping in the common area of our room. Access to our room was via a key provided. Works well as do the wrist bands. Very basic rooms but it's a hostel. Beds are hard, so don't expect much else. Luckily we had an air conditioner in our bedroom, the other two in our room didn't. Cleanliness was an issue. The floors are putrid. Your feet will be black underneath if you don't wear shoes inside. The bathrooms could do with a once over, and I won't mention what our friend experienced in his bathroom next door. Wifi was good. Shame reception didn't have towels. It's also pricey for a hostel if you stay in a semi private room. It's about the same as a normal/average motel room in a city other than Waikiki which has exorbitant accommodation prices. No bar, and common area is outside. It's fine if you are accustomed to average hostels. Don't expect more.

Had a great experience. It was just one night, and in this city, one spends as much time as possible out on the beach/town so didn't do much in the room besides sleep. Room was decent. Bed and bedding fine. Location was excellent. Its a $40 taxi ride from the airport though, so you're better off taking the SpeediShuttle service or better yet arrange with the hostel for the shuttle service. That cost about $13. All around, I would do it again if by myself or another budget traveller. Will I do it when I bring my family? Maybe, depends on whether they will give a break on two rooms and whether there is a fridge/microwave available. There is a common area, but I'm not sure what they provide there. They were kind in providing a baggage storage for me so I didn't have to lug my stuff up four flights of stairs. There was no A/C in my room, but it wasn't needed. The scooters available to rent looked great but I didn't need that this time around.

Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: Great location. Rooms are fairly clean. I was in a 4 girl dorm. It was good because all the beds where singles. No bunk beds in these dorms. The bathroom is small. No bench space to put makeup or other things. Beds are pretty close together (only a couple of feet apart).I was on the side of the reception area. This side was potentially noisier as the complex next door often had people outside playing loud music or loud TV until late. From what I could tell it was a hostel for older people, or for homeless people (they seemed a bit dodgy looking). So I would recommend staying on side B (I think its B) - the side opposite the reception area.There is a communal area which is outside, downstairs. Great place to meet people. But they do close it early around 10 or 11pm (we where just getting started then!)I have found this to be the most social and friendly hostel I have stayed in. I went with 1 friend. And ended up with a group of 15 close mates. Very cool.

The room I was in was really dirty. The windows where all broken so there was no point in locking the door. People stayed up drinking till all hours and the dumpsters are right outside the window. If your looking for somewhere to drink or pass out after a long day of drinking this is your place.
