New York City, New York

review_body: Very helpful staff, I was in a mixed dorm which didn't work out (I was in the only girl in the mixed dorm!) so I was moved to a single sex dorm which was much better and cleaner as you can imagine with a group of girls. Good value for money. Excellent location bring very central as well as a 3 min walk to the beach. I stayed whilst I was at a uni conference but wish I'd booked a few days extra go enjoy Honolulu properly afterwards. The staff made excellent suggestions for activities on my last day.

Stayed there for 1 night, the room and bathroom was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was a hot night but the breeze was still able to cool down the room (semi private, no aircon). Wasn't an issue but it's pretty noisy outside from the delivery trucks that delivery to the bigger hotels. Easy food nearby and SUPER close to the beach. I found the north end of Waikiki to be way better. Free wifi but didn't work too well for me. Probably depends on room location. Would stay there again

I stayed there for 10 days. It was really good. It is really close to the beach, perfect to go take a walk, however you can't see the beach from there because of other buildings. They don't allow to smoke in the room which is good. And they rent stuff to bring to the beach like surf boards, body bords and even snorkel. The rooms have six beds and we were in 5 so there was always a person that we don't know there which was good because we could get to know new people but if you don't feel safe they have lockers inside the room. The key to get in the room is a wristband that can get wet, so very convenient since you can't lose it, it is always on you. You get a kit of bed sheets upon your arival and they dont change until you get out of there, if you want they have a laundry there to wash it for some coins. We could park the car there too for some bucks but I don't remember how much was it. And to finish, it was a really good experience, you don't need to care much for a room in Hawaii you stay all day out of it visiting the beaches so this hostel was a cheaper choice.

I have nothing bad to say about this hostel. We stayed in a four bed dorm however the other two beds were in a semi private room so we felt like we were staying on our own for the week. Staff were fantastic, room was cleaned well daily, sheets were clean. Sooooo close to beach, zoo, aquarium, diamond head, food etc! A ten minute to ala moana which is the big shopping area- this is good because your street isn't constantly flooded with shopping tourists but you can easily access big shops like H&M etc. Stay here!!! Loved it

We stayed in a semi-private room, shared our bathroom and kitchen with 2 other occupants. Very clean and friendly staff. 1min walk to the waikiki beach. Worth the price, as everything else is a lot more expensive in waikiki!

I travelled solo to Hawaii and stayed in Waikiki Beachside Hostel the entire time I was in Oahu. I think the place generally just attracts amazing people. I was always with great company during my stay. The staff were very friendly too, and helped out lots with figuring out directions. Cleanliness was an issue, wear flipflops in the bathrooms- especially if you choose to stay in the dorms.. While I was there, I was able to get decently portioned suppers for like $5 and socialize at the same time. INSTANT PARTY. Stayed in the all female dorm rooms. Would visit again. Made life long friends in this place. :)

Great Location, minutes to the beach and Waikiki. You can do a lot of things in walking distance. Busses around the corner to reach all points of the isle.Waikiki Beachside is a hostel I can recommend. Stayed in room with 4 beds, 2 beds are seperated by a wall with a door. 2 beds are in the main room with kitchen.Shower available and ok. Staff at the Lobby and in the breakfast area are friendly.Breakfast with coffee and toast is served every morning.You can take the bus arround the corner and drive to Kapahulu Ave/Paliuli Street and you have a safeway super market.

The location of Beachside is amazing! 5 min walk to the zoo, 5 min walk to the gorgeous beach, 2 min walk to the Main Street. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were decent. Only down fall is that we had to wait 5 days to receive clean towels that and that the hostel is very loud if you're in the first building. I will be returning to this hostel and recommending it to others

This is the best hostel I have ever been too I got the 4 dorm room and it was amazing promise me I'm in military and can be picky but it was actually very very nice when I come back to Hawaii I will purposely stay at this hostel I promise you if u stay here it's perfect Dnt listen to stupid people that put bad stuff about this place

Reviewing a hostel is always difficult because the expectations can be quite a bit different than a hotel. So instead of trying to compare it, I'll go over what to expect.I stayed in a 4 bed room, along with 3 roommates. The place was extremely bare, with only the minimum furniture, although it did have a mini kitchen. There were almost no amenities - no soap, no towels, etc. In fact, they were even out of the towels that they sell at the front desk. At check in, I was given some pillows that I had to carry to my room. There is activity in the main area 24/7, so expect a good amount of noise throughout the night. The bottom line is that you are getting a lot less than a hotel, but for only $30ish a night, that trade off was well worth it. Just don't go in expecting something better and it will be a fine place to crash.

This is an apartment style hostel with small communal kitchens within the dorm rooms. I was pleasantly surprised by this hostel. Staff are extremely welcoming, fun and friendly and even helped me take my suitcase up the stairs. But yes this hostel is load and walls are thin but people don't stay here for a good nights sleep. You get to know everyone by sitting in the party area and chatting! Also the location is supreme and minutes walk from everything. This is one of the top budget hostels I've been to and I would definitely recommend it.

This is a well located hostel with pretty nice rooms, staff, etc. The one issue is cleanliness - I stayed for two weeks and did not see the cleaners clean the toilet or shower and only topical cleaning of the rest (aka - just for show).As an experiment, I left a tube of shampoo on the floor of the shower to see if it was ever cleaned - after a week and a half, I picked it up myself - no one ever touched the floor. You'd better wear flip flops everywhere and cover the toilet seat with TP. Considering the amount of travelers that pass through there - that is downright scary. Waikiki Beach Hostel staff - please fix this.
user_name:
Joe A
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Travelled to homily with a group of 50. We stayed at Waikiki beachside hotel in May.Rooms are neat and clean.Staff friendly and helpful.Great spot just one block back from Waikiki beach.Excellent value for money and we had a great visit. Highly recommend if you are traveling on a tight budget or with a large group of teenagers
user_name:
Paullj66
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hostel for four nights while on the island of Oahu. We enjoyed the location because we could walk one block and be on the famous beautiful beach. Shops and delicious food were only a short walk away. The room was what we expected for the price. There was a kitchen and after asking the front desk, we had cooking utensils also so we were able to save a little money by cooking in our own kitchen.

this is the hostel you wanna hit if you want to meet with fellow travelers coming from all around. you cant beat the location. it is just next to Waikkii beach - nightly rate is just about right. plenty of restaurants and coffee shops close by. ABC stores are all around. the Diamond Head is within walking distance. if you have rental-car, consider exploring southeast of Oahu: just to name few, Hanauma bay, Halona Blowhole, Koko crater, Makapu'U point. you think you are a good hiker? I dare you to try Olomana (three-peak) and Manana (longer) trails. if you are seeking a quite place, this might not be a best fit for you. this is kinda place where you get a six pack-beer to socialize, if you know what I am sayin' ;) cheers,

My sister and I stayed for 4 days here and got the room with the 4 beds, two of which were in a private room. We arrived was before check-in time but we were able to leave our things in the hostel so we could have breakfast. The hostel was near all the convenient stores and location.Pros:- spacious room- comfortable beds- Own kitchen- safe locker- Walking distance from the city's center- safe neighborhood Cons:- Can be a bit noisy since the beds were right outside the hallway (it is a hostel, expect drunk teenagers every night) - Can get a bit chilly at night- Staff wasn't that helpful (we were asking for directions but he just said to go online)

I've stayed at a lot of hostels and this is by far the best one I've stayed at. It was only a short stay of 3 nights - a quick stopover to break up a flight - but I was very sad to leave! I booked a large mixed dorm and though it was a bit uncomfortable at first (seeing as those in my room had been there for some time and I was a newcomer), it didn't take me long to feel comfortable. The room and bathroom itself wasn't that flash but you get for what you pay for. Location was excellent and very close to the beach. The best part about the hostel was the common area where it was so easy to meet fellow travelers. One night, we managed to get everyone there to join in drinking games, seriously it was like 30+ people! I traveled on my own but was never on my own for the entire trip because of the friends I made at the hostel. Definitely recommend this place if you're a solo traveler. Oh, and you get a waterproof bracelet key which is brilliant for visits to the beach!

This was my first hostel experience and it was one to remember, in a great way. If you're a bit iffy about sharing a room with strangers, I hope this eases your mind a bit. it's true, you cant pick who your roomates are, but everyone I met was super friendly and had amazing stories to tell. my friend and I shared a full up co-ed 8 bedroom dorm. if you have an open dialogue with your roommates there's no reason why it cant be a pleasant experience. the hostel is a three minute walk away from the beach, right across from the zoo, so many shops and restaurants close by, and an ABC right beside it. definintely worth the price. if you're not a super germaphobe than it'll suit you just fine. for a hostel, it's definitely clean and not a filthy hotbed of disease; more or less what you'd expect. you go to a hostel for the experience, and to meet the people, not for a five star hotel bed and shower. But I did sleep totally great in my bunk. GO TO THE COMMON AREA. every night people will be sharing drinks, games, and stories down there; just go introduce yourself. it is SO worth it

Good prices. Rooms were good, had an 8 bed dorm, divided in two rooms of four. Bathroom was nice, cleaned daily. Balcony was nice. Shout out to the night shift guy who put on Liverpool - Man Utd about 3 am for me. Located close to the beach and the major bus stops.

Great hostel with great staff, right on waikiki beach. There's a big roof deck that's open til 10pm, and the staff are very helpful and constantly organizing events. When I was there, they had several cheap tours for guests, as well as free barbecues and pizza nights. Rooms only have four or five guests each, with working AC. Would definitely recommend it

Stayed here with a friend and we had an amazing time. The hostel itself isn't that fabulous but it is the location and the staff who make the place, especially Yianni who works nightshifts there, we instantly became friends. The road the hostel is placed on is known to be a bit dodgy (which it was) but the location is so close to the beach that one doesn't think about it all too much. The key for the room is genius, one will never loose it! We first stayed in an all female dorm but that got a bit boring when most women were in their 40's and we were young travellers still in our teenage years so we switched later to a mixed dorm. The beds and amenities weren't that great overall but we only stayed at the hostel for the location and good price (in comparison to all the hotels in Waikiki this was a bargain!) Every night we went out drinking with others from the hostel and went on roadtrips and other activities during the day with people we met there. Don't hesitate to stay if you want to experience Hawaii but save money at the same time!!

I stayed here for a week in March in one of the semi private rooms. It was both my first time traveling overseas and my first time in a hostel so I wasn't too sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. The staff are very friendly and great to have a chat to or ask questions. The room itself was more like a small flat - there are two beds in the main body of the place and another room in the back and you share the kitchenette and bathroom with the people in the front room. Cleaners came through daily so the place was tidy. The only downside I think is that the hostel next door is very rowdy and would often start partying around 8:00pm and carry on well into the wee hours of the morning, so if you're a light sleeper, I would highly recommend earplugs. All in all, it's about as good as you can expect for staying in a hostel and if you're looking to travel on a budget, this is definitely a place you should check out.

This hostel was so much better than expected! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were big and cleaned daily, and had their own bathrooms (and in some cases kitchenettes). Would recommend for any budget traveler making their way to Waikiki

I stayed here just one night. The hostel was very busy when I checked in at 10pm on a Monday. Crowds of people in the lounge on the ground floor. Staff were friendly and efficient. I was booked in a 8 bed female dorm room. I stayed in room 201 which is above the office/reception. Not recommended. It was the noisiest place ive ever slept. There were people outside talking, laughing and yelling until 4:30am. I'm sure other rooms would be better but I think you would still hear some noise anyway. In the morning the staff were again really efficient, friendly and helpful. I liked the electronic room keys. They are like a rubber bracelet apparently waterproof. You do pay a $20 refundable deposit for them. Not the best place to stay if you are a light sleeper.

we just came back to KL from Hawaii... Beautiful Hawaii Aloha !!! So nice, Oaahu island ... and at Maui.. island... we stay at a 2 room apartment .. so lovely landlady ..remember to eat at the Giovanni moving truck shrimps !! eat the BBQ Ribs at Maui will go again next time... Aloha !!!

The staff is warm and efficient . The place is clean , quiet hours are enforced. Free coffee and toast in the morning . Book early because it is fast becoming well known as the best hostel in Waikiki!

3rd time in Waikiki but 1st time staying in a hostel. I have no regret for chosen this hostel and in fact I would definitely wanna stay here again on my next visit. I booked a room with 4 (semi-private) - non bunk bed shared room for a week. There is a room inside the dorm , and I basically shared the entire space with another person and the kitchen with everyone. Bathroom comes in good size and they clean the room and change the floor mat in the bathroom everyday, so it's absolutely clean. The hostel provide simple but free breakfast from 9am to 10am, although just coffee , tea , toast bread with butter and jam, that's good enough though. Lots of friendly people, hostel has a good mix of all ages. From 18 to 70. Staff are friendly and helpful. As for the location, it's more than perfect! Everything is within 10 second to 1 minute away. I don't think anyone who'd stay here would ever complain about the place.

I was originally staying here for 3 days, ended up staying 2 weeks. Location is close to the beach and bus stops but down an alley which has multiple dumpsters on it making the hostel smell like garbage at times. I found the staff nice and helpful, 24/hr reception is nice. Free breakfast and WiFi is good. Rooms pretty hot so try to pick a bed near the air conditioner.

Staying at the hostel for one week, we really enjoyed the great location. The Hostel is very close to the beach ( about 3 min foot walk) and an abc store is on the next corner. Our room was cleaned every day, and we even had a clothesline for our beach towels at the balcony :) Compared to other hostels, the breakfast wasn't the best one, but anyways, we got coffee, toast, jelly and peanutbutter for free! Unfortunatelly I cant just say good things about the hostel: Starting at about 6am in the morning, a lot of garbage trucks...drove along the street to pick up the garbage from the hotels, deliver the food for the day etc. As the windows are for normal always opened, you can be sure to wake up. We also expected a bit more of the kitchen in our room: Instead of a full equipped kitchen, we just found two small rusty pans, not even a pot. When I asked the reception if the may have one, I was told to get one on the next day. This didn't happen, so i asked again, and after two more days I finally got a pot wich the guy just picked up from another room.

This hostel is probably one of the lesser quality places I have stayed in my trip around the States. The location is great, one street away form the beach but it is very noisy with trucks and cars going past late at night and very early in the morning as well as the neighbouring hostels having loud TVs on all night. The windows don't really shut properly so there is no sound barrier either.The staff were always lovely although everything seems to cost around there! If you want to lock your valuables away it costs 25c every time you open your locker and if you want to store you luggage after you check out its $5 to put them in a little back room. Compared to all the other hostels I stayed in that included these things for free, it was a bit off a shock and rather annoying.Another thing is that they provided linen but no towel, you can also purchase that for an additional fee, I just got s souvenir beach towel from the store next door which turned out cheaper and doubled as a nice take home gift for myself.Breakfast is included but only for 1 hour in the morning and consists of toast and some coffee, which is fine but compared to the other hostels I stayed in that provided full continental buffets or cooked meals, this was once again a bit of a shock.The beds are comfortable but th top bunks have no railing and the rooms are small with not much room to put luggage for everyone.If I had stayed here first I probably wouldn't have minded so much but compared to the other similarly priced hostels on the mainland, this place was a bit of a disappointed overall.On the postiive, I always felt safe and my roommates were all young travellers like myself and th social atmosphere is great anytime of the week!

Starting with the positives, you can’t beat the price, PB&J in the morning was much appreciated and the location was awesome – you are a block away from the beach and on a more quiet side of the main Waikiki strip. I would say the hostel was clean but starting to look worn down, like a cheap motel. My partner and I stayed in a semi private room, which meant that we had a closed off room from a 2 bedroom dorm that was also the kitchen, making cooking meals a bit awkward since we were basically in their bedroom. We had good access to wi fi and a TV in our own bedroom. The four of us shared a bathroom, which is pretty good for a communal hostel where usually there are a lot more people sharing bathrooms. Although the staff was friendly, I was disappointed in the lack of recommendations of things to do from the staff – they really didn't seem to know what was going on in town and suggested instead that I look online. They do not plan events for the guests, which for a hostel, seemed very odd to me to not provide opportunities to get to know the city/other travellers. Lastly, the room we stayed in basically backed on to a halfway house or as it was described to me “a hostel for locals and residents”, which sometimes was loud. Doubtful we would return here when this was more like a cheap motel than a hostel and there are reasonable airbnbs nearby..

Stayed here for 17 nights while visiting family. A great location, right at the hearth of things at the beachfront. It is a hostel, and not a hotel, and you do get what you pay for. However, rooms were regularly cleaned and front desk were both efficient and informative. A special word of thanks to Chris and Yonni on the front desk. Chris for assisting my booking, and Yonni for his genuine friendship during my stay, and invaluable advice on dealing with jet lag. Met some great people there, and we went on a number of excursions together including Stand Up Paddle Boarding ( SUP). I stayed in the four room dorm, with two single beds in the front room, and two in the private room. Not suitable for everyone, and a lot depends on your roommates. In my case, I was lucky with a great disparate group from Switzerland, Michigan, Montreal, Calgary, Japan and England. I plan on returning next year.

Stayed here for 2 weeks in January. Its a hostel so my expectations were not high, but it exceeded my expectations. Lots of people might complain of the cleanliness and the noise, but what can you expect with a shared living space. I saw it as a gathering place of travelers, explorers and adventurers. It is a great place to meet people from all over the world coming together in a very special place of Hawaii. I used the hostel as a place to crash at night and a chance to meet new people and people to go on adventures with. If you are looking to stay at the hostel the entire time you are in Hawaii than its probably not for you.

The location was great! It was central to Waikiki. We walked over to crater and it was close to bus system. There was three of us traveling and the dorms were split into two. We got one room to ourselves, which was very nice. The washrooms were clean and beds comfortable. The one draw back was it was loud. Lots of people talking all hours of the night. Also there was no kitchen and breakfast was served 9-11. We were always gone by that time.

just moments from the beach and shops waikiki beachside hostel is a great place to stay if your into the backpacking sceen. friendly and helpful staff and from my experince great people staying there too. Rooms arent fancy, which you shouldnt be expecting staying at a backpackers. they are clean and tidy with gated buildings and your own room key (which is a wrist band thats waterproof, which i thought was very helpful as im a champion at misplacing keys). i stayed in an 8 bed mixed dorm which was fine, it was two bigs room with two bunks in each, private bathroom with shower,bath,toilet etc. each room has its own veranda and plenty of power points. free breakfast and wifi included in your stay and i believe its well priced accomodation.

Obviously you get what you pay for so this was far from 5 star. But as far as hostels go, this is one of the best i have stayed in. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable, location simply unbeatable (especially for the price!) staff: friendly, accommodating and tolerant. They we're certainly there to supervise but tried to avoid intervening in fun being had unless it was impeding on the pleasure and quality of stay of other guests. "Breakfast" certainly left a lot to be desired but the adjoining take away cafe had very reasonably priced alternative food options available. Certainly the most fun I've had at a hostel, with a great group of new friends made in the process.

I have stayed in numerous hostels worldwide and this was, by far, the worst hostel experience ever. I booked my stay months in advance and anticipated the usual community experience of staying in a hostel. My first interaction was with a self-absorbed, young woman at the front desk. I learned that the parking was not guaranteed (something not mentioned when booking), so I had a rental car and nowhere to park it. Little did I know my visions of driving around all night for lack of parking would be better than the actual room. The room was semi-private, meaning we had to walk through a cesspool of filth to get to the locked door. Once in the room, I was reluctant to touch the beds or pillows. The sliding door to the lanai was broken, so there was no way to close or lock it. I never slept that night because people were playing loud music outside all night and the two people sharing our semi-private room partied loudly until about 5am. Unlike other hostels, there was never a place or opportunity for meeting other travelers. I left after the first night and stayed in a hotel that was clean, quiet, and very affordable.

I was amazed at the hotel room costs in Hawaii and after camping on Kauai, a few nights at turtle bay, I was looking for something to balance out my budget. I was given the two sheets and pillow case that others discuss, but you should realize this is Hawaii, the only night I got a bit chilly is when one of my roommates cranked the AC. I didn't experience any bugs, and they have secured parking for only $10 a day. The only downside I saw was my garage door remote didn't work so I would have to ask someone at the front desk to pop open the gate. They are there 24/7 so it was never an issue. The only other issue I had was a douchey roommate I had stole my bed and I had to pick my sheets up off the floor and find another bed. My room (401) was an all male dorm with two rooms and only two beds in each room. It was a bit noisy but no less so than other places I have stayed in cities. I'm not sure I would spend a month here, but you are close to most things in Waikiki and there are a couple other hostels next door, but this seemed the most updated.

This hostel lacks the social vibe in which to meet other travellers. As the kitchens are located in the bedrooms there is not as much opportunity to get to know the other guests as in normal hostels. Everyone staying for the most part only seemed interested in partying, the common area is centrally located and very noisy. The quiet hours are not enforced by the staff making it near impossible to sleep some nights. The kitchen in the bedroom creates an unsanitary environment, and is ridiculously under stocked for 8 people. Our microwave did not work and the hostel does not even provide tea towels to clean up with. Plumbing in bathroom is broken, shower does not drain, meaning you had to stand in dirty water to shower, toilet does not flush properly, management is aware however no move was made to fix it during the week I stayed. No towels, no blankets, no fans, dirty, noisy, definitely the worst hostel I've ever been in.

Awesome location. Not just in Waikiki, but the best part of Waikiki. Quick walk to the gorgeous, balmy, palm tree swaying tropical Pacific beaches. Quick walk to restaurants, etc... I've been to many hostels, this one was not particular pretty or outstanding. But it served it's need & location is supreme. The service at the front desk was outstanding and organized. The rooms and bathroom were worn and old. I would go there again.

No towels and a room left wide open by those already there. Stay far away. eek. Scarily inhabited by young and cluemess it seemed. I left and already paid for room.2013 Summer.No way, ever, stay far away.Use Air BNB.

I am sorry that i have to stay in this hostel .it was awfull. My leg was eaten by bed bugs it was all red and itchy! And stuff give me 5$ for medicine !thats all they done! Also big brown bugs cockroachs walking everywhere and i was sooo scared of them. Only good thing is location is excellant

Beach Side Hostel on Lemon Street in WaikikiBefore booking this establishment it will be valuable to know the following: Upon check in the clerk gives you a key (armband kind) 2 sheets and 1 pillow case. $20 deposit for the key and the sheets to be returned upon check out. The rooms are mostly small one bed room apartments from back of 1960 and have a small kitchen in the first room, the second room has a small balcony with a sliding door. One bad room with shower and toilet is located right off the kitchen and in the first room. Each of the 2 rooms have 4 beds (2x2) 2 upper and 2 lower beds and are covered with a dirty base sheet. There are no blankets and no towels included. You will find the rooms very small and noisy, especially the ones facing Lemon Street. Not to mention the noise coming from people snoring, partying far later then the time permitted and from people taking long showers - one can hear the water running from other adjoining apartments at the complex. The rooms are co-Ed and the is only 1 bathroom for 8 people. There are a few lockers in the kitchen that require constant feeding of quarters to open and close. The condition was so horrifying for me that I left the following morning after a sleepless night and I am still wondering how these people have a permit from the authorities in Honolulu to operate this Hostel. Over crowded, dirty, unsanitary and insufficient bathroom facilities, the lack of towels and blankets, insufficient space to store personal belongings (should you have a car you may not be able to park there either - they refer you to park at Kapiolani Park, about a 10 minute or more walk) - I visited many hostels in the US, Europe and Mexico, this is definitely the worst one ever.

The staff was excellent , super friendly and accommodating, however, the noise was unbelievable. It didn't quit until 4 a.m! I've been staying in hostels the last 7 months and this is the first that did not have a curfew. Rooms were clean butt the AC didn't work and after 3 reminders at the office....it still didn't work. The rooms are also spacious and the windows open, however, the noise comes in with the breeze. Breakfast is toast with peanut butter and jam, as well as coffee and tea. Would I stay here again.... no way. Wifi was excellent and free and in the rooms . Not all rooms have kitchen facilities... I had no fridge or anything like that and no access to it. It's a 2 minute walk to the beach so that's excellent and there is an ABC on every corner. The Polynesian down the street was recommended so......

It all depends what kind of person you are. as long as you're willing to start conversations making friends is easy and you'll have the time of your life. if youre looking for a 5 star hotel and all that then this wont be the piece of pie youre looking for, but it's hawaii you shouldnt be spending your time indoors, the lights out thing does blow but i understand why they do that. besides that be friendly and you'll find yourself getting to know people from all over the world.
user_name:
Diego A
Potomac Falls, Virginia, United States

review_body: Hostel is close to Waikiki beach and the bus stop. Rooms have kitchen with fridge but not all are fully equipped - mine had no knives and no cups ;) Breakfast from 9-10 is ok. Cleanliness depends on roommates ;) Staff was great and you can get beach stuff for free, boards for small money... free Wifi was great. Supermarket (small) is around the corner, bigger one 10min walk. Beach is 200m away. All in all ok but only because others are worse or even more expensive.

Front desk service was fantastic, thank you so much for making our stay as easy and enjoyable as possible! We utilised the info guides and advice from the staff and had a ball in Waikiki over New Years this year! Rooms were generally good, mostly clean however it was pretty noisy at night which made it hard to sleep. But the professionalism and friendliness of the staff overshadowed this and after all, it was New Years! Would recommend.

My sister and I stayed here a few nights while travelling all over Oahu. The staff were friendly, giving us directions and help with the buses, rooms were clean and we had our own bathroom and kitchenette (in 8 person dorm) plus the price was amazingly cheap! The downstairs chill-out area can be pretty loud at night but the staff do try and shut everyone up at a reasonable hour. The location is perfect, right on Waikiki beach, surrounded by good cheap eats and bus stops to everywhere else you might need to go. Also your room key is a bendy rubber bracelet and damn near impossible to loose!

Booked in for a 3 night stay..... Stayed 15 nights. Excellent spot for the solo traveller, very social and relaxed environment. So close to the beach and restaurants. Accommodation is fairly basic, but clean and secure and at bargain prices what more can you ask for! Will definitely be coming back. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Wy wife and I (27 and 28)had never stayed at a Hostel at before. We had 3 days in Oahu before heading to Kauai to stay with family so were on our own for this island. Wanted to stay cheap within reason so booked here. Staff was nice, had a semi private room in A building. Was hesitant at first but ended up being just fine for us because we were out all day sightseeing. Basic room had 2 beds, table, kitchen and fan with full bathroom. Our semi private room was through this first room and had air conditioning, desks, mirror and 2 single beds (we just obviously pushed them together). Our roommates were very nice and polite. Would recommend but your experience might depend on your roommates as well

HMMM. Well I would say this hostel was what I expected. I was just staying one night before I flew out of Honolulu the next day. Atmosphere was chill and relaxed - a lot of people hanging out and drinking in the common area, which was nice. But trying to sleep was a nightmare. Guys in our room were drunk jerks, singing at the top of their lungs at 2am, shining flashlights on those of us sleeping. To be fair, I guess it wasn't the hostel's fault - but the crowd it attracts is a little young for me (I'm 26).

I stayed here for 2 nights + another 3 nights after I come back from my stay in the north shore. At both times we stayed at the semi private room B304. In the first 2 nights, there is a TV in our room, but in the next occasion the TV is gone. They say they are taking out the TVs because they just realised people are not using them and some of them are broken anyway. This is disappointing as the room is advertised to include TV. The toilet works fine in the first stay but on my second stay we had issues with sometimes the toilet does not flush. It's quite noisy at night too, you can't sleep with the doors open as people are still being noisy even though it's past 10pm. Internet doesn't work in my room (because apparently signal is bad in 3rd floor..) overall I am quite disappointed with my stay, but I guess that's what you get for $70 per night for 2 person. For my next stay I think I will just spend a bit more for an actual hotel than stay here.

I had my doubts about this hostel as there are also some bad reviews, but it was better than I expected. The atmosphere is good and the location is great. Mattresses are equipped with plastic covers, bathrooms are ok (you get ok showers), there is a kitchen in the room. I saw one cockroach during my visit which was much less than in the previous place. The room B 201 seemed much more spacious than the room B 202, even though both of them are 8-bed female dorms. I found this out when I was searching for an available bed, as they don't assign beds, only room. There are lockers that work with quarters. There are only four lockers in 8-bed dorm, so I was lucky to get one. Wifi could have worked better.Despite of some downsides, if I went to Waikiki again, I would consider staying here again.

Had a bed in a dorm right in front of the exhaust of the aircon. As a result I had a servere cough while on Hawaii. Furthermore the breakfast-times are 9am to 10am. ridiculous! THERE ARE SEVERAL BACKPACKER RIGHT NEXT DOOR - MOVE - I DID SO AND YOU SHOULD DO SO, TOO!

perfect location. beach is down the block. all touristy venues around the corner. ABC shop at corner and another down the street. average facility, excellent staff! on our stay we had to cancel our last days due to a spontaneous change of plans and they were very understanding and we had no problems.

journata
New York City, New York

review_body: Would recommend this hostel to anyone travelling to Waikiki. Rodney the guy with dreads was super helpful, even on the first night I ended up in the wrong place so he helped me find my friend and the hostel I was actually booked into. Rooms and bathrooms where new and very clean in the C wing where we crashed. No cooking facilities for guest but the takeaway was pretty reasonable and the food was yum. only thing was the stairs, bloody hostels and stairs, try get on the lower floor.

I've stayed at a few great hostels, others not so much, but Waikiki Beachside totally exceeded my expectations. I've already recommended it to others and I can't wait to return!!! :)Check-in was good/straightforward, all of the staff at the front desk were so helpful & friendly! :) I particularly liked that the room/entry key is a light blue silicone wristband, it worked great, it is waterproof & was so comfy to wear - I never took it off for my entire stay. SO much better/cooler option than keys &/or cards!I reserved/stayed 4 nights in a Female 4 bed Dorm and I LOVED the option to have a single bed instead of a bunk. I seriously wish every hostel had this option!!!Our dorm had 2 'rooms' & a bathroom (with shower). The first room when you enter (which I stayed in) had 2 single beds. Note: both my bed & pillow were comfortable. I dislike carpet so I liked that we had tile floors. There was a ceiling fan above the beds (which did a remarkably good job circulating the air, it was so comfortable at night with just a sheet) and also there was a spare fan stashed above the fridge too. Between the 2 beds was a night stand w/a lamp. There was a basic, clean open kitchen along one wall with a fridge/stove/sink/microwave/lots of cupboard space, a small round table & 2 chairs. One bed was next to a long dresser below the wall/window(beside the door/entry) the other bed was along a wall that divided the 2nd bedroom which had the other 2 beds dresser and patiodoors (which led to a small lanai). There was also a closet by the washroom that has 4 small-med coin lockers (25cents per use) I roughly estimate they'd hold approx an average school backpack.The rooms were cleaned every afternoon and I was REALLY impressed with the housekeeping staff who did such a great job! NO bugs & it was by far the cleanest hostel of the 4 hostels I've stayed at in Oahu!!! Also, kudos to my roomies who were all friendly, thoughtful & conscientious - which really added to the experience! :)On the ground floor there is a open area with vending machines, a tv & seating where hostellers can hang out and the hostel provides comp coffee, bread/toast with pb&j every morning between 9-10am. The hostel staff are diligent at politely making an announcement reminding guests to be aware/considerate of quiet time (usually at around 10pm). Note: I've stayed in a variety of hotels & hostels all over Waikiki and it's a fairly noisy city (I've found that there is a lot of traffic noise, late night party-ers and early morning delivery/garbage truck noise to be expected anywhere in Waikiki) but our room was substantially quieter than I'd anticipated.Around the corner from that common space is a coin laundry area.WISHLIST: To make this place even better I might recommend:1-some shelving &/or towel rack + hooks in the bathroom or closet-y area... because there was nowhere to hang towels (or swimwear) and its Waikiki so almost everybody has been at the beach! (Also, FYI not a huge issue for me but on the topic of towels, the website mentioned towels sold at front desk but I got the impression that they are are not typically available...so if you didn't pack one, they are $12-25-ish range at any ABC or a little cheaper yet at a Ross or Walmart. (Or if you spend $75 @ rip curl I've found they often have promo towels for $15.))2- ok this is me being kinda OCD/nit-picky (because our room really was great) but there was an odd amount of pily dusty linty stuff all over the ceiling in our room (around/above the ceiling fan) i'm thinking a swiffer(floor thingy) might take care of that easy peasy?Just outside of/beside the entrance there is a lil cafe attached which has breakfast, lunch & dinner items for super reasonable prices. (There was a flyer on our fridge which was super helpful - thanks!)There also is a bike/scooter rental place (I never used) but if you need one its super handy.PS: If you've never been to Hawaii there are incredibly convenient "ABC stores" on atleast EVERY BLOCK in Waikiki - they have pretty decent prices for almost everything you might need in a pinch - from bottled water(typical 99cent deal for 1.5L is pretty standard) sunblock, cold meds, towels, postcards, souvenirs, snacks, juice/pop/beer/wine/liquor. (If you save your receipts they offer a promo deal your cashier can tell you about.) If you think ABC is too pricey or want bigger selection there is a Safeway on Kapahulu a Ross on Seaside or a Longs Drugs in the awesome AlaMoana Center(my fav mall ever) and a few blocks from that a Walmart & Sam's Club and another Ross. Oahu also has more than one Costco.Also, around the corner from the hostel on Kapahulu there is a restaurant I think is called Teddy's burgers - I've heard from several ppl that it was good. And there is a Starbucks on corner of Kapahulu & Kalakaua, next to it along Kalakaua is a Jamba juice & subway and a lot of other easy dining options in & around any of the nearby hotels!

Location , Location ,Location ! Nice find 1 block to the Beach ! This place is spotless dorms and bathrooms kitchen nice to see a clean Hostel . The staff was outstanding very helpful , Yianni on the desk at night was the best of the best had a party at his home that is what a great staff is all about they made us feel at home a must stay

Very nice location, just a couple of blocks from the beach. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The 8 bed dorm though, is a bit too small, feels very crowdy. But it has its own kitchen and bathroom. But it is expensive, but the same as a lot of the other places in Waikiki.

Really great place for backpackers, budget-friendly. Its spacious and clean. Liked the common sitting area where you can connect with people all around the world. Could watch TV and use wireless internet connection.Unfortunately the AC in the rooms were not working, so had to sleep with balcony door open but there was lot of noise coming in from streets. But after few night can get used to it.

I stayed in a semi-private room (twin beds) which I had all to myself. These rooms are better than the main dorm as they have a lockable door and aircon. There's even a TV, not that I watched it! It was nice having the option of being able to lock my own door or leave it open and chat to the guys in the other dorm. We all shared one bathroom which was fine and there were lockers in the room-you just need a quarter to operate them. Towels were available very cheaply indeed! They give you your sheets at reception to make your own bed so you know it's been freshly made up. Full kitchen facilities in the room were a bonus! When I needed to check out and leave my bags, they had a very secure system for this. The only downside was for the guys in the main room having no aircon-it got very hot in there and was also quite noisy but I was happy in my room, especially at that price. The location was great too-Lemon Road, extremely close to everything. Very good value for money and nice friendly staff!

I stayed here for just one night in June 2014 in a semi private room. It was quite spacious, opening to two single beds and a kitchen, and then a room in the back with bathroom and hanging space with 4 lockers. The back bedroom did not have a door so it wasnt too intrusive having to walk through to the bathroom/lockers.I would stay here again. It was my first hostel experience and it was a good place to start. Had a big communal area down stairs with tv, chairs, tables, breakfast etc... Reception area stored my bag for free when i arrived, but charged me to store again after i had checked out.Felt pretty safe here, they close the big gate at a certain time each night so have to go through reception to get in...The kitchen was a full kitchen from memory. As i only stayed one night i didnt use it. I think first impressions when i walked into the room was the tiled floor was dirty but it wasnt anything too bad. I don't think the ceiling fan worked once the light was turned out which made the room a bit stuffy.Id definitely stay here again i think. Reception staff were pretty cruisy and laid back.Waterproof entry bracelets are a good idea so can always wear your key.

I chose to stay in this hostel because I was heading to Hawaii for two nights to attend the Arashi concert. To put it in plain language, I basically spent most of my money on the air tickets (from Indiana) and concert tickets (2 nights). Hence, when I was looking for a lodging, I was hoping for something cheap and decent enough.Price wise, this is not too bad in terms of value for money. I chose the option of having a semi-private room. Semi-private in the sense that it is a room (with a locked door) within a room and the bathroom is shared with the other occupants in the room. The semi-private room is not sorted by gender so I have two male room-mates who shared the main room while I have my private room. The room: Two beds, a large screen TV and air-conditioner (thank goodness!). The mattress are not really in the best condition but I figured for the price I paid, what do I expect. In addition, once I made the bed with the fresh sheets provided, it is good enough. The air-conditioner is a great help in combating the Hawaii heat. The bathroom: This is my biggest sore point. It is clean but just barely. The water pressure is weak and thus difficult to take a shower. At least there is hot water, the saving grace for the bathroom situation. Location: This is a strength of the hostel. The location is great! walking distance to the beach, with plenty of shops and food places nearby. Overall: Will I stay there again? Most likely not unless I am heading to Hawaii again on a super limited budget.

A friend and I (22, female) stayed at the hostel for seven nights. Overall - great first experience in Hawaii. Met some really great people. We paid $330 (together!) for the 8-bedroom dorm, which is super cheap considering the location.DORMS - we stayed at the 8-bedroom girls' dorms. It's divided into sort of two rooms with no door, and we stayed at the room with the AC set to 60 degrees (like 15 degrees C). It still got hot, especially in the other room.There's a kitchen in every room, but not extremely well equipped (brand new stove + fridge and such, but not much silverware and plates etc).The dorms are not cleaned daily I believe, not super duper clean but not too horrible.STAFF - super friendly, super helpful! We loved talking to them and getting to know more about the island. The staff is the best asset of the hostel.LOCATION - 3 minute walk from the beach and all the restaurants. Take in consideration Waikiki is SUPER touristy - it's not the "real" Hawaiian experience. However, there are bus stops very close to the hostel which will take you anywhere on the island (including trails, hikes, beaches, etc). Kinda safe to walk at night. Very close to all the bars and clubs around the Waikiki strip. MISC - free "breakfast" is toast, PB&J and coffee. There's a sort of a lounge/hang out place downstairs where you can meet people and drink and chill. There was a lot of noise coming from the building next door, which too us wasn't a bother but it might be for some people. WiFi connection is good, especially in the lounge. ***Don't bother getting on any sort of tour. Everyone overcharges!! Just find out what you want to do and see and go there by bus/car. If we'd to come back to Waikiki, we'd defiantly stay at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel again :)

Stayed here for 1 night with a friend in a semi private room, which was a room within another room that shared a bathroom and kitchenette with 2 other people in the other room. There was a lock on our door and the room had air con which was a life saver. The other room only had fans and it was so hot when we were there I would recommend the semi private room. Only thing is the windows don't block out the morning light but it was clean, the bathroom was fine with a big shower. They had tea, coffee and toast in morning. Staff were friendly. It is right next to the beach, this beach is a bit quieter than some of the others in Waikiki and the shops close by. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay for a few nights in Waikiki then this is it. Oh and you could store you bags before check in for free then after check out for $5 and they can book you a shuttle to airport for $12.

Not a bad place. The manager knows how things can go wrong and she has the knowledge and aloha spirt. I would steal her to run my place. Hint girl! ;) The worst part if you dont do the semi private is no a/c. During summer june to oct you want a/c its humid.

Salem, Oregon, United States

review_body: I had a great time at this hostel. I stayed in the semi-private room, which was a lockable room within another room, that had a shared bathroom and kitchenette. The bathroom was a little old-fashioned, but cleaned daily and the shower was hot. There was air conditioning in the private room. There is a free breakfast every morning until 10am and endless opportunities to make friends. You can rent out surfboards for $10 for 4 hours. The location is superb, with a convenience store right around the corner and the beach a few seconds away. The staff were great and super friendly and helpful. As I had a late check in, they let me leave my luggage and go to the beach. The staff really went out of their way to help.The only con I had was the last night the neighbours in the next building watched TV extremely loud, which meant I couldn’t sleep until 2am. It can get quite noisy. And also the bathrooms do need updating. I would stay here again with friends, but I’d definitely get a room in block A (the new building). It’s a good place to stay for a few nights.

I've stayed in a few hostels, and I have to say this is the best one so far. The atmosphere is great, there are young and old and almost everyone you meet is happy and friendly. The rooms were nice and fairly clean. There are lockers to keep valuables in, even though I didn't think it was necessary. I felt so safe here. My only complaint is the rooms get a little hot and the air conditioning doesn't work very well. If I ever come back to Oahu I will definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for one week in a 4-bed dorm. The room was better than I expected due to there being no bunk beds as only single beds were present. Seeing a bathroom in the room was a nice touch and definitely better than other hostels that I've stayed at. I heard that the larger dorm rooms have a kitchen in the room which would have been nice.The communal lounge downstairs was a great way to meet some people! There is a lot of open space and a fine opportunity to have some drinks with new acquaintances. They also offer wireless internet mostly in the lounge which I found to be pretty good although it's limited to a certain range. Sometimes it does get quite loud at night but they try to enforce a curfew at 10:30 PM. Being a hostel it doesn't always work out - though it's great to see that they try to make an effort.Location is one of the biggest upsides to staying here. The ABC Store is right next door which is very convenient to buy food and drinks. Also the location is quite good for Waikiki with it being walking distances to the beach and many restaurants/shops

had a semi private room, you are in the middle of everything, The staff is really cool, you have the bus, the shops, the restaurants, the beach, the mop rentals, the little snackbar down the stairs for a ridiculous price. my stay on Oahu was perfect.

I really enjoyed my stay here. I am travelling solo so stayed in a 4 bed female dorm. The dorm was 2 rooms so didnt really feel like staying in a dorm and also had small kitchen facilities. And no bunks! The dorms were reasonably clean. They are old so the bathroom isnt the greatest but the housekeeping staff do a good job. The beds were comfy and sheets were clean. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. Cant beat the location 1 block from the beach and ABC store 50m away for anything you need and safeway is about 15 mins walk. The street can be a little seedy at night and even in the day byt i never felt unsafe as there are lots of people around and 24 hour staff if you should need anything. The breakfast is just toast so nothing exciting. Some fruit would be a nice option. Overall loved my stay here. Thanks :)

Great location, and friendly staff. However I booked a shuttle to the airport with the hostel and a staff member made an error and my bus was not booked for me. I ended up having to rush to the airport and fork out Extra for a taxi. Was not happy.

Excellent location with a lot of things to do nearby and just some blocks from the beach. The staff is really friendly, efficient and helpful. There is a very good area to socialize with the others guests and make friends.

The hostel is very well located one square from Waikiki beach, there are a lot of restaurants, pubs and markets near it, you can rent towel for a good price, it does not have elevators until the 4th floor, refrigerator and all that you need to do your dishes are in your bedroom! You can rent bicycles and scooters just in the side of the hostel. The prices between bikes and scooters are almost the same. Breakfast is included in a common area. The cleanliness is not so good but is acceptable, they could improve it! Nice staff every time!!! Take a shuttle from the Honolulu airport!!! 15 bucks!!! The name is speedishuttle strongly recommended!!!

I stayed at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel for a week, and it was amazing! I was in an 8 person dorm room, and had no issues whatsoever. The staff were really courteous, fun, and helpful! Checkout was at noon, but since my flight didn't leave until 9pm, so they let me store my luggage there for $5 so I didn't have to drag it around the beach. You can't argue with the location, and they also offer great information about shuttles, rentals, and more! Absolutely recommend!

I stayed here for around 3 weeks in September last year and changed rooms several times. Its literally a 2 minute walk from the beach and about 10/15 minutes walk from the main shopping area. Out of the hostels that were down the same road i definitely say this one was the better choice. My favourite things about staying here are that if you chose a small dorm there would only be 4 people in the room and you get a single bed and if your lucky you will be in the other half of a semi private room. The shower and bathroom facilities are good and there is a small kitchen with an oven, stove and fridge. I ended up in an 8 bed dorm and hated it only because the girls that were in the dorm were messy and left the bathroom in a state. However i complained and i was moved to a 4 bed dorm for slightly more money but it was definitely worth it. Downstairs there is parking and also a large communal area.My biggest criticism is that the rooms get very hot and that there should be air con in each room, i would even go as far as paying extra to stay here just for air con. The rooms had fans but it just wasn't enough and some nights sleep was uncomfortable. Despite this the staff are very helpful and are more than happy to try and swap rooms around etc.

I am a 55 yo male and I stayed for 2 weeks. While I have stayed at many of the hotels on Waikiki beach over the years and I can honestly say that my stay at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel was absolutely the best experience I've ever had! The front desk staff are friendly, professional, knowledgeable about the area, and were always helpful in answering questions about restaurant recommendations, things to do and see, etc. I would like to say mahalo to Rebecca, Olivia, and the rest of the staff for the spirit of aloha that they personify. The rooms were clean and the toast and peanut butter breakfast was a great way to start the morning (after the daily climb up Diamond Head.) The location wrt everything is fantastic and I had the opportunity to meet and became friends with people from all over the world. I cannot recommend the Waikiki Beachside Hostel enough so ditch your hotel plans and experience the true sense of the word ohana at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel.

I haven't traveled overseas in 7 years and think I have finally got too old for hostels. But in saying that there were definitely some positives and negatives re the hostel. Always best to start with the positives. The staff were really helpful and friendly so that was great start to my stay and the location of hostel was very central which is a great thing.The room itself was exactly as specified in the description, 4 bed female room. The main room with 2 single beds, the kitchenette and a table & chair. The second bedroom had 2 single beds. The bathroom was very compact and average in its cleanliness - but this wasn't an issue, I had my thongs/flip flops for the shower (so all good).The major negative was there wasn't an air-conditioner in my room. Two fans that circulated the hot/humid air, which was way too much for me to deal with and I had booked in for a 4 night stay and had to cut this down to 2 nights and changed to a hotel.I must finish with another positive. My room mate was a lovely gal from Canada and we hit it off straight away so it made the stay enjoyable.

pros-Location! : only one min.walk to the Beach!!-Price : totally Affordable considering the location!-Staff : they were friendly and really helpful for me-Locker : each room has locker to keep your valuables safe.-Atmosphere : very nice to make some good friends! cons-Cleanness its hostel so Its okay if its not super-shiny-clean, but at least it should be, well, clean...one day I was staying in the dorm all day, and I saw Cleaning lady just swiped the floor and changed the bath mat and left - was that all? This hostel definitely need some supervisor or double-check system. no offence, it was not very dirty. but it wasn't acceptable for me either.notes..-Breakfast is available between 9AM-10AM, jam,butter,toast,coffee and icy water. (Free)-Location (Lemon rd) is okay, not dangerous but just beware of weird people at night time.another note..-some old review says, sheets were dirty, beds were making squeeky noise all the time... but not anymore. I found the bed had some rubber damper and sheets were quite clean. They mustve fix those problems somehow recently.I really enjoyed and had great time at this hostel :)I was going to give it Five stars however due to these reason, Four stars.

Just spent a week at this hostel and they were great. Especially Rebecca. She was always helpful and actually acted like she wanted to help. Although I am a senior citizen I never felt out of place. I will go back!!

It's a typical American hostel. The room I was in had disgusting marks on the wall, fridge was disgusting. I would not recommend this hostel to anyone but you get what you pay for! It is in a great location, right near the beach. You can rent umbrellas and chairs on the beach, but the hostel has these you can borrow for free! Buying these at the abc around the corner is much much cheaper than renting as well. The area feels safe. The staff are excellent especially Yanni! Check out condo rentals in the area, it can actually work out to the same price of this place per night..... This place really needs a good clean and paint job. It would make a huge difference.

We recently stayed there April 28, 2014 and were bitten by an infestation of bed bugs! The people at the front desk were not very apologetic almost as if it happens all the time! We didn't expect much going into the hostel, we are young travellers and know the risks involved with staying at hostels! including the risk of BED BUGS! but this absolutely ruined our holiday with massive welts and bites covering our bodies DO NOT STAY HERE, DON'T TAKE THE RISK. We also had to wash and dry our clothes twice which costed around $30 and again more precautions when arriving back home to ensure we did not carry them with us. The hostel is close to waikiki beach but the location is slightly sketchy with some odd characters hanging out in the back lane behind the hostel. We weren't there long enough to even gauge the amenities and other things about the hostel

The location of the hostel is great, the staff is very friendly and fun, nice vibes from the lounge area - always with people getting together, drinking, enjoying the music and having a good time. The bedrooms are clean and with small kitchens inside which make them perfect. The breakfast is good as well. Loved it every minute spent there! -- Cheers from Brazil!

Definitely a good-value place for what you would pay which is like maybe five times less (!) than what you would pay for the Marriott or other big hotels nearby right on the Waikiki beachfront. The Waikiki beach is totally in the walking distance, and that beachfront road, Kalakaua Ave., is totally alive at night with tons of shops, places to eat, torches lit with flames dancing in the wind (especially very nice ones flanking the Duke statue). If you're looking for nice and cheap fast food, go to McDonald's on Kalakaua not far at all from the hostel, but not Burger King nearby which charged a lot more for the similar food. There are also quite a few ABC grocery stores near the hostel where you can get everything from toiletries to bananas to postcards for souvenir.If you're doing an early morning tour of Pearl Harbor, Queen Kapiolani Hotel is where you would want to wait at for your Discovery or something tour bus, and that big hotel is just at the end of the back lane of the hostel and on the left. The bus stops to and from the Airport are also in the walking distance from the hostel (I dragged my suitcase from the arriving bus stop to the hostel and then back to the departing bus stop to the Airport).The Wi-Fi was excellent. The only thing maybe they could improve on was providing towels and small bars of soap and shampoo even at a price. I actually bought a towel from them for a dollar or two, but I had to go to an ABC store for soap.It is definitely recommended for budget travellers who can do shared accommodation and without a TV but you will get to enjoy all that Waikiki beachfront has to offer for a fraction of what people at big hotels pay. Last but not least, the staff were very friendly as well, the gentleman at check-in had a friendly smile and the gentleman at check-out very kindly helped me with storing my bags at their storage since I could not take them with me on a Pearl Harbor tour before leaving the Island.

Definitely recommend. Counter staff are incredible helpful. Located one block back from the beach. We were in the semi private room (sort of a room within a room) which was great (shared bathroom with the two others who stay in the room outside yours). Breakfast each day was great. We were even offered it when we got there early on our first day. Free bag check if you arrive early. Loved our time here.

Great location just a block away from Waikiki Beach with a huge party atmosphere most nights. Free breakfast every morning is good as well. Not the cleanest hostel though, especially the showers so I would recommend bringing a pair of thongs.

This was our transitional lodging (meaning we couldn't check into my conference hotel until two days later). Waikiki Beachside Hostel was a pleasant surprise. It was inexpensive, but clean. Decor is dated and dingy which makes you think it's dirty. However, upon closer inspection it's not. My two travel companions and I shared a 4 person dorm room. The young lady from Hungary who shared our space was hardly there, was quiet and did her own thing. No conflicts or weird vibes. I think this hostel is a perfect solution for short-term, budget-conscious travelers/visitors to Waikiki. Oh, did I mention the free wi-fi and all-you-can-eat toast? High-end hotel I'm staying at now doesn't offer either (daily wi-fi charges and no breakfast of any kind unless purchased in hoidy-toidy restaurant).This seems quirky, but breakfast under the building's overhang was quite relaxing and delightful. I had fun making pbj sandwiches or filling up on toast and jam before heading out for the day. If I return to HONOLULU I will definitely stay there again. A two-minute walk to central beach area and shops is by far the greatest part of this place. I concur with R00m402's reviewVictoriaDenver, CO

Maybe we got unlucky however this was the noisiest hosteling experience my girlfriend and I have ever had. Our room was right on Lemon Street. We got the street noise, the street lights, the scooter shop noise, the garbage truck and all the drunk people talking loudly on the street. All up I think we had 2 hours sleep over the 2 night stay. We seriously couldn't wait to leave and at one point considered abandoning ship and just blowing our budget on a big old mainstream hotel.Also surely they could offer something else other than peanut butter and jelly sandwiches for breaky.

The Waikiki Beachside Hostel is a Ritz-Carlton in the rough. What a WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE! The Waikiki Beachside Hostel is just one road back from the beach and right beside a beautiful park, the zoo (no odors) and the aquarium. Diamond Head is in plain view as you walk out the hostel's front door, and a very affordable restaurant ($3-$4 for breakfast or lunch or dinner) is right beside the hostel. What more could you ask for at such a reasonable price in Honolulu! This was my 5th trip to Honolulu but my first time at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel. My travel mate and I rented two single beds in the front half of the hotel room - just inside the front door - while two other folks rented the private bedroom in the back half of the room. Our hostel room had a full sized kitchen - 4 burner free-standing stove/oven, microwave, full sized refrigerator, sink w/disposal unit, art work on walls, telephone in room w/no charge for local calls, huge shower, sink, and bathroom mirror outlined in lights! Guess what...EVERYTHING WORKED and all of what I just mentioned is in EVERY ROOM, regardless of what type of room you're renting!! Room was cleaned everyday. Huge screen tv on ground level common area w/complimentary toast/coffee/peanut butter & jelly everyday from 9a-10a. EXTREMELY helpful staff and at SUCH A LOW PRICE in HONOLULU!! Very "ALOHA" experience. But here's the BEST news: Three of my previous 5 stays I spent at the other Lemon Rd. hostel just a few doors down from Waikiki Beachside Hostel - that hostel has the word "Polynesian" in it's title. You know what I got when I stayed at their place for the SAME PRICE?? A barren/empty room with two sets of bunk beds in it and NOTHING else - no furniture in room...no private kitchen in room...no art work in the room...no telephone in the room. A light bulb hanging from an electrical wire from the ceiling. A shower stall with dead bugs in the shower EVERY DAY! Broken/burnt out light bulbs in the bathroom that were never replaced. So do the math. For the SAME PRICE, why stay in a dump like the Polynesian Youth Hostel when you can stay at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel which is so much nicer, cleaner, safer and comfortable. Thank you to the staff of the Waikiki Beachside Hostel for making my 5th trip to Honolulu a very pleasant and memorable experience. Aloha!!

We only stayed 2 nights, but we could have stayed all week. The Staff is soooo helpful and friendly, all area are clean, the room was spacious, we got a private 2 bedroom, with kitchen (oven, microwave, frige) and bathroom. The price was good, great location, close to Starbucks, ABC store, restaurants, bars, bus stop.. I definitely recommend this Hostel to everyone!!! They have 24/7 front desk, they rent towels by the way!I can't wait to return to Waikiki!!

Waikiki Beachside Hostel is a GREAT value in a GREAT location. I could hardly believe that I was 1 block from the beach in famous Waikiki with a reasonably priced hostel. The staff is AWESOME! Very helpful and friendly. The room was not spotless (can't expect too much with 8 girls in a dorm room!) but it was certainly clean and comfortable. Nice to have a bathroom and kitchen in the dorm room with us! I was pleasantly surprised to find this great hostel!

The location was prefect. The beach was 2 minutes away. The bus stop were right down the street and the front desk has a list of what buses to take and where. Shuttles were mostly either right in front or around the corner. I felt completely safe. There was a good amount of homeless people but they don't bother anyone and if you are going to be homeless its the prefect place to be. I shared a room in a large female room and didn't have any problems. Everyone was was so nice there. Hawaii the people were very calm and helpful where ever I went. Diamond Head was a good hike up but the view was the best. I went para-sailing and that was so fun I want to do it again. They have a culture center there. Well worth the time to go see especially the evening show. There is a farmers marker in the evening for a few days of the week. Excellent local food.Front desk people were so friendly and helpful and they can tell you about anything local if you ask. A few nights in the lounge area there was one or two people that got loud but did last all night. The last couple nights I was there it was very quiet. Food was expensive to me to eat but there was a store of the corner that had daily salads for about $4. But ask the front desk people and they will tell yo where to go. If I come back to Hawaii I would stay here again Best location and best staff and you meet people from all over the world.

It was a great experience for the first time being in this place. It was always very helpful to have someone to give great customer service. i would like to thank Nathan for all his great customer service that he provided. i will make sure to return and recommend to everyone to stay at Waikiki Beachside Hostel when in Honolulu. Thank you!! Att: Oscar

I was travelling solo and got there on March 3rd. I was a bit worried after reading a couple reviews about bedbugs. Despite the daily cleaning I got attacked by a bedbug in the 1st night. I had to switch rooms.. TWICE ! That was the only downside of this whole experience.The hostel overall is great. Let me separate into small topics so it's easier to follow. LOCATION - Perfect (the street is a bit dirty and ugly cause it's the backside of the hotels and stuff), great for anyone who is just gonna walk around town, ride a bike (recommend you BUYING a bycicle at WALMART to really get to know the place around) or a car. Bought a bike for $ 85 and sold it for $ 40 a week later when I left.STAFF - Really good. They are all helpful and friendly ready to solve your questions about the main activities and places.ROOMS - Really good as well. I would suggest paying $5 extra dollars and getting the small dorm (only 2people + 2people from semi-private room) instead of paying $ 28 for the possible packed 8 dorm. I stayed in both rooms (both good) cause the 8dorm had only 4 people in it. VALUE - Best deal you can find. The 7th night is free, which is a really good deal that other hostels don't have (as far as I remember). So this is by far the best option for the price. Rooms are good, clean + free breakfast (bread + butter + peanut butter + coffe) + free wi-fi. OBSERVATIONS:- Hawaii isn't a place to party. I thought the crowd staying at the hostel really quiet and some of them seemed really boring. Lot of people just using their computers in the common area in the middle of a sunny afternoon. Stay home next time, nerds.- There are plenty of places to go in the Island. Try to look for: North shore (Pipeline/Waimea Bay/Sunset Beach), Lanikai/Kailua, Haiku stairs, Diamond head, Ala Moana Beach Park, Koolina Lagoons, Makaha, Pali Lookout, Army Museum, Turtle bay resort beach, Hanauma Bay.... these are just a few good ones to visit.- BUY A BYCICLE. Best way to get around and optimize your time. It takes from 15-20min to walk the whole Waikiki Area. If you ride a bike you can go all the way trough Ala Moana and beyond. Tourists don't go that far cause walking/taking the bus is the only option they see. Take a bus to Ala Moana and look for a Walmart Store (behind the mall).- Rent Surfboards at the Maku surfstore. It is located on the street where there is a Billabong store on the corner at Kalakaua av. They have the best deals and boards.- Enjoy as much as you can the daylight. Wake up early and go running and exploring places. Nightlife is good to go out for dinner and nothing else. You will get tired of walking pass stores at night in Waikiki.Had a great time in Hawaii once again. Hope to get back soon.Regards from Brazil !Tks
