review_body: The best thing about Waikiki Beachside Hostel (besides being located in Hawaii) is Zack who works at the Front Desk. Zack truly made the "impossible" happen (I won't bore anyone with the details); and, I was able to get a reservation (other hostels were fully booked; and, hotels (low-end, medium-end and high-end were also fully booked, etc.). Zack literally worked for hours so that I could get a reservation. I spoke numerous times with Zack over the phone; and, each time I found him to be pleasant, friendly, courteous and extremely knowledgeable. Zack not only did his job ... but ... he went the extra mile (or in my case ... 10 miles!!). FYI: If you're expecting the hostel to look like The Hilton Hawaiian, Outrigger, etc., you will be disappointed (maybe even a little shocked!!). If you, however, want to spend the very minimum on lodging ($33+ per night) for a "shared" dorm; and, spend the rest of your hard-earned dollars on luas, water activities, island-hopping, buffets, tours, shopping, souvenirs, etc., then I highly recommend Waikiki Beach Hostel. Waikiki Beachside Hostel cleans the dorms daily. No, one should NOT expect to eat off the floors ... but it is cleaned daily. There were eight (8) females in my dorm. I met two (2) Marine Biologists, a Physicist, two (2) "almost" dentists from Chile; and, students from Japan, Korea, etc. Lots and lots of interesting people.The best part?? You are just one (1) street away from Waikiki Beach!! All for $33+ per night.Almost forgot ... Getting around Honolulu is easy. Oahu's public transportation is second (2nd) to none. If you don't buy a bus pass or a 4-Day Visitor's Pass, ALWAYS remember to ask for a transfer when boarding the bus (not de-boarding!!). You can buy the 4-Day Visitor's Pass at any ABC shop.Zack, I will never be able to express my sincere gratitude for all you did for me. Again, you truly went ten (10) extra miles for me. I am so thankful. You are my super-hero!!Zack is an outstanding employee and is definitely an asset to the Waikiki Beachside Hostel.

I came to Hawaii to go to The University here and stayed at the hostel for a week until I could move into my dorm. I was a annoying customer. I wasn't sure of my move in date at the university so every day I went to the front desk and asked for a extra night. The staff were awesome! Understandably, I had to move around rooms a couple times but they were so good about it!Definitely made my first week in Hawaii better and easier since I was having trouble with my dorm.They have a great out 'hang out' area for young travelers to meet each other and talk about where they are from, where they are heading.Great, cheap, easy, reliable place to stay if you are a young traveller looking for somewhere to crash that's super close to the beach, airport and all important shops.Thanks so much, I'll be back!

Very nice hostel. It was like a hotel to me, coming from the right next to it that was terrible.The bedroom was big and the bathrom and kitchen (inside the bedroom) very good.The cleaning wasn't great, but not too bad. It is very close to the beach, but not exactly in the best place.The staff very friendly and helpful, but the street.... The worst street in Waikiki. Full of drug dealers. The locker inside the bedroom (4 of them where I stayed) didn't work very well (2 of them broken) but they offer you a storage if you want to leave bigger staff, but, of course, paying $5 a day.In general I think is a good place, but they definetly need to do something with the location. That street.... if you're traveling alone, maybe you're scared to leave the hostel during the night, as I felt one night coming back from a walk on the beach....Anyway, in my opinion, one of the best hostel in Waikiki.

How can I begin to explain how my stay at this hostel was. Let's start with the good stuff. Staff if very helpful and friendly. They gave me the wrong room at start but changed quickly to a female dorm as I reserved. Had to carry my heavy bags up and down stairs...but it's okay. I stayed one week, so I can tell you - the cleaning of the rooms is horrific!! The dirtiest hostel I've ever stayed in. Poor poor management that does not instruct or supervise their cleaning staff. The location is not bad in terms of getting to the beach. It's only one block - but - Lemon Road is full of drug-dealers and crazy people. You will notice right away. My last night there someone from the neighborhood got stabbed, they closed the street, there where eleven police cars outside and I gotta say...I was not surprised. I acctually heard from my room this guy being stabbed - not the only thing I heard. Every morning, really freakin early, the trashtruck comes by and wakes you up. It's like hell. I am used to hostel, been in so many - my expectations are never high but this hostel is just too bad, sorry. And the impressive nice wristband keys for the room...had to reprogram them about 4 times during my stay.

love this place came in 2004,2005 and 2014 and it has never changed still a fab placeI have only ever stayed in the semi private rooms or the co-ed small dorm (which is 2 beds in the front room) and the semi private in the back.this stay we were in the front room it had a massive fridge and 2 gas burners to cook apparently some rooms have a full oven.no air con but we didn't need it as the weather wasn't very hot but it had a celing fan and a portable fan.very clean and the bathrooms were clean and we were only sharing with 2 others which wasn't too bad.matresses had protectors on and were very clean underneath that- we always check for bed bugs everywhere we go and here was immaculate.reception is a little slow but very helpful.breakfast is free and also so is the wifi which is good.I would definitely recommend it here it is always full so close to the beach bus stops the zoo is across the road!cant fault this place except for one thing.... the front rooms are sooo noisy you can hear the reception air con rattling all night also the rowdy people downstairs and on the street so ear plugs are a must!

Had the best time at this hostel, stayed from the 3rd feb for a week. It was clean and all the workers were so helpful. Always happy to give advice and a hand when needed. The location is one street from the beautiful beach and walking distance around the main parts of Waikiki. Great prices also, only paid I think about $38 a night and ended up getting my last for free. Would stay here again for sure and can't wait to go back!

great hostel, great service good location friendly staff, breakfast was well priced and tasty. we didnt book we just flew here blind hoping to find somewhere to sleep and this place popped up. motorbike hire next door was also fantastic service, broke one of the bikes and left it the other side of the island but they didnt care!

Clean rooms, good environment, cheap rates, very friendly and helpful staff on the daytime and night time, good free internet, free phone to book whatever u need. I highly recommend! Best location in Waikiki. Book your bed or semi private room in advance because it is very busy at this time.

The desk clerk Maggie was extraordinarily good at her job. Super hospitable and very friendly. Not to mention absolutely gorgeous (no contest with my wife, love u babe), with a big smile and positive attitude. The room was clean, cool bracelet style keys, and amazing roommates from all over the world. Made lots of new friends and enjoyed hanging out with them just a block from the beach. Everyone was super friendly and interested in eachother since we were all from other countries. Met people from about 10 different places around the world. IT IS NOT A BROTHEL! There is a funny story behind that, maybe I'll share with you if I ever meet you in a hostel. Great experience overall. I was pretty much stranded and couldn't afford the high prices of hotels. Missed my flight and the staff made me feel right at home. Especially Maggie, thanks for easing my burden and getting me to a place where I could contact my wife and 4 little girls so far from home to let them know I was delayed. Not for families with young kids or even teenagers. Good for singles and couples. A party environment that can be loud at times.

I was pleasantly surprised with the size and quality of this hostel, I've been to more than a few in my time, and this was definitely one of the best. Of course, you have to take into consideration the fact that when you're sharing a room with other people, there will likely be someone who is bothersome or inconsiderate. If you can deal with that...you're golden. It's probably not a place for a princess who has to have everything perfect and her way all the time (as it's obviously an older establishment and could use a few cosmetic repairs, but nothing major or completely necessary), but for those of us who are out to have a good time and need a place to leave our stuff, shower and sleep (which is about all I use accommodation for anywhere I travel to)...then this is perfect, and actually more than you bargain for. The kitchen is complete, so being able to cook is nice, since everything else in Waikiki can get expensive. Breakfast is a nice option, but a little monotonous. I wasn't bothered by that, at least there was SOMETHING to start my day off with (pb&j on toast).

Great staff, wonderful location, and friendly people. The room are 4 or 8 girls to a room, but the people that stay here are friendly and i made many new friends. The rooms were clean and well cared for, and the staff had a lot of information for tourists who needed to know more about the island. My stay was extended, 20 day, but i enjoyed everyday here. The moments here were unforgettable and i enjoyed myself.

Waikiki beachside hostel. I spent 10 nights here. A great hostel. We stayed in a semi private room and shared a bathroom with two others. The front office staff were all fantastic always very helpful , happy and nothing was ever to much. Zack David Maggie are just a few to mention can't remember them all are a great asset to the hostel. Everyone in housekeeping were always helpful. The facilities such as the laundry was always clean. Overall I would in a heartbeat stay at Wakiki beachside hostel. Thank you for having us !!! Aloha.

Great location, efficient staff and affordable rates make this place remarkable. Stayed 3 nights in a semi-private room. Front desk and housekeeping are superb and extremely cooperative. Complimentary toast and coffee each morning are greatly appreciated.

I'm a 33 year old professional, and was a bit skeptical of staying in a hostel when my buddy booked our room there. However, it was clean and quiet, and the staff were great. The hostel is in a great location, 2 minutes to the beach. The staff is phenomenal, and went out of their way to ensure we had a great stay. There is a nice common area on the ground floor and it was easy to meet lots of other young people. Had a great time and would definitely repeat if I'm back in Hawaii. Personally, I'd love if they had memory foam mattress toppers on the beds, but that's likely just a personal preference.

I stayed in this hostel for aprox 4 months in october/november and had a great experience. The staff was really professional and always helpful in their behavior. They were interested in what we were up to every single day, so they might improve our experience or give us some advice. If there was something, of some reason, you didnt think was allright, they were never offended by your critics, just happy to improve themselves. I was always met with a smile and i really appreciated staying here. The rooms were great, and the common area made it easy to get to know new people. If you're going to Waikiki, and want the best place to stay, even though you're looking for good price, party or experiences and adventure; this is definitely the place to be. It was a hard place to leave!

Waikiki is a really busy touristic place, but this hostel can be a very good option for a budget or solo traveler. Rooms are a bit old but in good conditions. There is a kitchen for every room, that can be good point for people that wanna cook but also keep the room messy. Good crowd, ideal to make friends.

I stayed here for 1.5 weeks during October 2013 and stayed in an 8 bed mixed dorm. I met Canadian, American, German, Norwegian, and English travelers in my life room. The room was pretty clean and there were no bugs. Bathroom was acceptable but the water still dripped even though we shut off the faucet completely. The room came with a kitchen, fridge, dishwasher, and microwave so it was a nice surprise. There was even a balcony with a clothes line so you could wash by machine and dry by hanging. Perfect if you wanna take off for the beach and not bother wasting time with machine drying. I also had a rental car so I parked in one of the 5 parking sports just inside the hostel gates which was a little difficult at first. It was easier to parking backwards so you could leave with ease. There is a large dining/seating area on street level with a big screen. This hostel also offers free breakfast which consisted of coffee, tea, bread, peanut butter, and jelly. There is also free use of snorkel equipment if available, just ask the friendly front desk. I had a pleasant stay here and would stay again.

Confortable Hostel to meet a lot of people from all over the world. The people who work there is too cool, I felt very well. Highly recommended for social people. Always the room was clean and you can drink and meet new friends without the problems. The hostel is a 5 minutes of the beach. I dont have any bad to say about this hostel. Mahalo friends from Waikiki beachside!

I stayed here in a semi private for 3 nights. This place is a bit more of a party spot but if you are looking to meet great people to hang out with, this spot is great. The room I stayed in was pretty hot and the noise made it challenging to sleep a few of the nights (even with earlplugs). The rooms could have been a bit cleaner but were bearable. The location is great, right by the beach.

It was almost 9pm when I got in the hostel and I was greeted by the lady in the front desk. She was warm and very pleasant. When I went up in the room, I wasn't expecting that the room would be that clean because I know that I am sharing the room with four other female guests, but yes, it was all neat. The sheets are clean and the air-con is working. In the bathroom, the shower is working, water lines aren't leaking, but the mirror is obviously stained and old, but I don't think that's a major problem. The kitchen inside the room is small, but complete. It gave me the perfect excuse to just buy vegetables, meat and other seasonings in the nearby grocery store and cook my own food. They also have free local calls and free WiFi (password will be provided as soon as you check-in). Safety deposit boxes are located inside the room, and you can use it for 25 cents per use. I could say that you get more than enough for what you pay for. They also have the perfect location. This hostel is really close to the beach. It's actually just behind the Aston Waikiki. Room service personnel are very friendly and in my 5-day stay, they never missed cleaning our room. Nice! The only thing that I wasn't completely happy about, is their breakfast. Although they serve free coffee and tea, they also CONSISTENTLY serve toasts, butter, peanut butter, and jam. It would have been nice if they have an alternative to this. Parties are frequent, headed by the visitors, of course and they stay up and loud until 10pm. If you feel this will affect your sleep, then you can move to the beds inside their twin sharing with air-con. In general, putting my disappointment with their breakfast aside, my stay in this hostel is one of the best. I love the place. I like the staff and it's close to everything you need. If you're a Roman Catholic, church is just a block away. If I'll be given the chance to visit Honolulu again, I would REALLY stay in this hostel and ask for the same room again. :)

Do not stay in this dump. I was there last week and was stunned by the filthiness of the walls and the floors. The extremely gross bathroom looked like it had not been cleaned in months. The owners of this place do not even care enough to put a hook on the bathroom walls, so you have no place to put your clothes in the bathroom, except the floors. I was supposed to be able to rent a towel for $4 to take a shower, but the hostel completely ran out of towels. I was told I could buy one at the ABC store down the block, but the cheapest one I could find was $14. The hostel refused to reimburse me the difference, even though I was forced to buy a towel because they ran out. The place is also extremely noisy, so you can forget about getting a good night's sleep here. I had to purchase ear plugs to drown out the noise. I would not wish this dump on my worst enemy.

Awesome hostel, 3 minutes from the beach, shops, dining and everything you need.. Stayed here Oct 4th - Oct 12th.. Every room has a kitchen and is cleaned every day. All of the staff were awesome, especially Paul and Maggie who checked me in and made me feel very welcome as soon as I stepped in. The hangout area downstairs ist pretty cool, I met lots of awesome people from all over the world and made many good friends. Definitely would stay here again!!

I have stayed in hostels in the past and it's usually a good way to travel alone and meet others. This particular trip to the beachside was really cool. Great people, great staff, great food at the lil restaurant on the property. Its location alone, a block and a half from Waikiki beach, makes this place great. As for me, all I wanted was a place to crash, and a costly hotel would have double the cost of my trip. I would strongly hesitate staying with the neighboring hostels tho, they didn't seem to be run as well as this one. This place also offered the use of beach toys, boogie boards ect....for free..! I opted for the semi private room both times I went. Hostel, car and flight for 10 days was about a thousand bucks. I just recently booked again.

We have been in Hawaii for two Months spent time on four Island , and the Beach side is one of our favorite Hostels / Great location 1 block to the beach , loved running down to the ocean for a dip before coffee / The staff was awesome and very helpful , took us out to Kelly s love that place nice rooms we stayed in a 8 bed door clean as can be / nice kitchen and a big big screen T V / little food shop up front that has great hot dog s a must a lunch time ....

I have been in Hawaii for almost 3 months and the Waikiki Beachside Hostel was my base for this time while I was travelling to other Islands. I stayed in semi private rooms, Girl dorms and mixed dorms. You get what you pay for - it is easy. Honolulu is a very expensive place and the beachside hostel is good for Budget travellers. They clean the room every day but when your roommates are pigs then they could clean every hour...the beachside hostel is located just behind the waikiki beach and next to the zoo. They offer free toast with butter and jam every morning which is ok for a few days but not for 3 months :) we had great parties here and the staff is really friendly!Its a pity that one has to pay for the luggage store...if they would do it for free, i would give 5 Stars!!!

i went with a friend. cool staff, excellent location, nice price. if u have limited budget and are used to hostels this is the place!if the room is dirty it is because ur room mates are. we stayed at a semi private room. perfect for us! the bathroom and the kitchen were shared, but we never used the kitchen.i would totally recomend it, u just need to know that u are staying at a hostel, not at a five start hotel!!ENJOY!!

A few blocks from the beach, you can get free coffee and peanut butter and jelly sandwich between 9-10am. There is a cafe in the lobby and always get a meal for around $4-5US. They have some free chairs, snorkels, masks and boogie boards if you ask. I met some great people this trip also from California, Spain, UK, Denmark, Japan, Perth Aus. DO your research most happy hours are between 3-5pm. Lulus is a block away and a nice hangout. Or get a 12 pack and play cards. Always clean, staff is friendly and helpful.

The location was excellent. Only a few blocks away from the beach, restaurants, shops etc. Reception staff were friendly and accomodating. The hostel is very noisy, particulary in the evenings. They do have an 11:30pm curfew for those in the courtyard (common room), but it takes a while for everyone to quieten down and move on. So be prepared to be kept up late, from people talking out loud, music, doors slaming etc. The rooms are also hot. There is a ceiling fan, which looks like it's about to come apart. Beds were ok, not very comfortable and little support. The bathroom was tiny, unclean and in poor shape. The whole place could do with a renovation. It's not the place where you want to come back from a day out and relax in your room for a bit. There is no privacy and the room is too small to and uncomfortable to take some time out. The hostel definitely has a party atmosphere, particuarly if you are with a group of friends. Most people liked to hang about the courtyard at night, drinking and talking. Breakfast was ok. I've had better complimentary breakfasts at other hostels. I ended up going to a cafe instead. The location was my highlight for this hostel. If you are on a tight budget, then this place is ideal.

The staff at the hostel are really kind and accommodating. I stayed in an 8 person dorm and immediately felt a bit uncomfortable. They do seem to have some long-term, live-in residents. Everyone seemed nice enough but it did feel like I was invading on someone's space (especially the one who took the entire dresser to themselves). It was hard to sleep at times because a lot of the others would stay up with the lights on all night and sleep late into the morning. The bathrooms didn't feel clean at all I've definitely felt more comfortable in other hostels. That being said, my main concern was having a place to rest my head at night and it DID serve that purpose. The location is very close to the beach and near major bus routes.

coming from the Polynesian hostel, it was easy to see an improvement. We got a nice semi-private room in the A building quite spacious with an useless big flatTV and the share bathroom was OK....then on the second trip we got a semi in the B building it was noisy, hot (AC probably date from the 80's and was like 100 decibels) and the bathroom was dirty and in poor shape. The ceiling was falling off with a possible leak from the toilets upstairs.Staff, well not the friendliest, warmest people (kind of don't bother me attitude), apart from the smiling lady at the front desk....Breakfast : bread and jam and coffee.Common area is nice, quite a good atmosphere. Location one block from the beach, supermarkets (though everything is closed to an ABC store) and bus stops. Fair price. Next time I will Airbnb myself fro the same price...

I'm not sure what kind of billing system they're using but they messed up and made it extremely complicated when my friend and I asked to switch rooms to a semi private with AC. Trust me AC is mandatory, we didn't sleep at all the first night with all the noise and heat with minimal circulation. Pay the couple extra bucks and get into a semi private room with AC. The breakfast, on par for hostels. PB&J sandwiches. The front staff, very willing to help, very friendly, but again they screwed up the billing and I feel like I was shorted about $40.If you're going with friends or more than one person, just spring the extra money and get a hotel, we found a great one for $100/night and were able to split it 3 ways for the latter half of our trip. The good thing about this hostel is the location, it's close to everything. They do also have free....yet broken...boogie boards to borrow.

As I said its a good option for limited budget. The location is GREAT! Only a few blocks from waikiki beach. Really close to supermarkets, bars, shops etc.Recepcionist are always willing to help. Breakfast could be a little better. Good memories!

Very good for it´s value. Excelent location and very good environment created by the hostel itself, the people working there, and the people who stay there. There is a very cool common place where people hang out, eat and play games which is great!

Want a terrifying experience...the Beachside has dropped to the Bates Motel...the newspaper wrote about the guest who needed to pay his room fee and found a way to steal the money from a victim. Used to be a relaxed place to stay for a few days between here & there.  No more...Debbie is running a tight slave ship...checking ID's & kicking people out. Guests are being bounced around from room to room because of the booking system. Floor was very sticky like glue and dirt. No thrills in hiking up to the third floor rooms. Funny they hired more housekeepers and the rooms are not any cleaner. Want free entertainment...watch hungover Al do his job at the front desk. And shallow Hal is still there now wearing a beard. No Swedish blondes, just desperate guys looking for a free pickup. Free wi-fi only in lounge is very limited.Street people come into share the wi-fi & to try the pbj sandwiches in the morning. The atmosphere and attitude is very different before the newspaper incident.You can stay elsewhere for a few dollars more. Even charge $ 3 per towel ( ratty old ones ).We stayed elsewhere after one night and the second place was 500% better.

This is an excellent choice if you are on a budget. I stayed here with my partner for 4 nights and we had our own room but shared kitchen/bathroom with jazzy wall art! There was another couple who had beds in the kitchen but this was not a problem to us as they were very friendly. The bathroom has defiantly seen better days but it is still very clean. It can get quite noisy and the dorm bedrooms looked quite cramped so we were glad as a couple we had our own room for once when travelling. Reception staff were very helpful as we needed to navigate round the island on public transport. Great location on a few minutes walk to beach and the into town and there are lots of restaurants, we ate at Wolfgang Puck most nights as its great food but not too expensive. Waikiki beach can get very crowded so we recommend going to the other beaches in the north, it does take a while on the bus (about 2 hours in traffic) but if you plan to make a day of it is well worth it as the beach is stunning. Hawaii is well worth the trip and I would recommend this hostel for those on a budget.

I had severwl hostels in waikiki and this one is the best. Cooking facilities, lounges and a easy to use roomkey were the things i like. Plus the staff. They did an excellent job. Thry are very friendly and anlways helpful. Drawbacks were that the room wasnt very clean. It was very hot and the one fan availible couldnt keep up cooling 8 people. Free breakfast is a nice idea but only one hour is very short and creates jams an the counter. Overall very good quality hostel.

Had the best time here. Such helpful staff and fun atmosphere! The best rooms to stay in are the four people rooms. More space and perfect fit! Super close to the beach and fun stuff all around to do. Can't wait to go back!

Stayed in a semi private with my best friend, was extremely economical, great location, front desk was great, no view, could have been cleaner, but was way better than spending 200 a night at the hilton, probably couldnt have done the 8 bed dorm though. Would go back for a non romantic vacation again!

Where to begin!  I stayed at this place on my first solo travel ever and it was the best place to take my solo travel virginity! I stayed in an all girls room with 4 beds and a kitchenette. In my room were two australian girls and a girl from germany. I ended up becoming great friends with them and we exchanged many ideas for places to visit. Downstairs they have a chef come in every night to cook a wonderful homemade meal for cheap!Down there, there is a great place to meet fellow travellers and talk about highlights in town. The front desk guys were wonderful, and I can say, made my stay even more enjoyable! the location is great, so close to the beach and right off the main strip!Next door is a scooter rental place with amazing rates and they even give you a hostelling rate. I highly suggest this place to any family and friends wanted to stay in honolulu. why pay an arm and a leg when you can stay at a place with lots of other interesting travellers from all over and make some lifetime friends!Got to say, this place is the start of a very ambitious travel bug! Definitely a must to stay!

We checked out within the first 24hours. The website doesn't paint a true picture of the rooms and what ur actually booking. We booked a semi private room not realizing that we had to walk through strangers mess to get to/from our room, the bathroom and kitchenette. The room wasn't clean when we checked in and I don't think the bathroom had been cleaned in weeks. It was disgusting. They gave me ripped sheets and had no towels left for us to purchase (they had been out of stock for weeks apparently) so we had to use our sandy beach towels to try ourselves off after our shower. We ended up finding a much much much better budget hotel for a similar if not cheaper price, better location, and all the perks of a hotel - ie clean rooms, maid, pool, towels, sheets, big rooms, hanging space, friendly staff etc etc. If you want to have a good time in Hawaii, do yourself a favour a stay in a hotel not this backpackers!

Location is brilliant and staff helpful. Stayed in 8 bed female dorm 2hich was great. Females from across the world together having fun. Room was fine, cleaned every day and could change sheets whenever rewuired. Good free wifi.Could get noisy in the evening but usually calmed down byb11pm...when the kids hit the town!?Travelled alone and over 60....this was the safest place place I have stayed in.Recommend to all as a cheap option for enjoying an expensive resort.

The biggest draw of this hostel is the location. It is approximately 1 minute away from the most beautiful beach I've ever been to. It is also no more than 30 seconds away from numerous convenience stores, and restaurants, and about one minute away from the Honolulu zoo.I stayed in the small co-ed dorm (8 beds), which was comfortable enough. The room had a large bathroom with a great shower, and toilet. It also had a full size fridge, and full kitchen. It also had a full balcony on the back. The hostel also had free wi-fi, which wasn't that great in the rooms themselves but great in the lounge area.The bunk beds we're standard for a hostel, and nothing spectacular. Overall I'd recommend the hostel.

Very nice hostel! We went also at the waikiki backpackers hostel and the beachside hostel was far better!The employees were friendly and very useful!We were in a 8-bedrooms dorm, it was clean and comfy. There are lockers in the room! The ac didn't work well and it was noisy but we opened the doors and it was ok.Great location! Wifi in the room. It was cheaper than waikiki backpackers hostel, worth the price!Great experience overall!

I booked last minute and new girl (Maggie!) was very efficient, even though it was her first day!From airport it's a $12 shuttle and takes 20-30 mins. On arrival I had an enthusiastic, friendly and helpful check-in. Outside looks ghetto and the hostels next door (between this place and the Polynesian) have some dodgy looking residents, but it's a well lit, location and very safe at all times of day and night (even for a 250lb/113kg Englishman!) Shared a room on 2nd floor with Tony from Santa Cruz and there was a private room off of this. Fans in the room and relaxing atmosphere. Free WifI and even though downstairs is effectively a car park there was a great atmosphere from the young, travelling cats who were all very friendly. Last time I stayed here was at the youth hostel down the road, which was rubbish with a geezer who had some sort of superiority complex, early curfew and you had to vacate during daytime!Only complaint is the snotty nose twit on reception who wouldn't let me store my bag for the day (Monday 24th June) but I wasn't staying there! The Polynesian provided this service for $5 and were very helpful.A hui hou

staying a month here was a good choice. Staff is OK, cleanliness not so good. Tho, is close to the beach is located in the "guetto" of waikiki so be kinda careful around there. you get to meet people from all over the word and can hangout in the bar are as long as you want.

I really liked it! Not perfect, but definitely a good choice! I really enjoyed the environment, and organization. The bathrooms were probably the lowest point. Though I think this is a 'room thing' ... some rooms have really good ones.

I had a lot of fun during my stay in this hostel. The rooms were okay, not too big, but I didn't spend a lot of time in my room. The rooms were clean and the hostel is really close to the beach. (about 5 minutes) The staff was were nice and willing to help. There was a common room and a little snackbar. At the corner of the street is a ABC-store.

My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the semi-private rooms for one night after getting in on a late flight and before heading to the other side of the island for the rest of our trip. Despite the fact that we'd read lots of reviews of the setup, we were still kind of amused by the layout - basically you walk into a motel-style room with twin beds and a kitchen area with dining room. At the back are two doors - one to the bathroom then another into the semi-private room, which is just more twin beds albeit behind a locked door. The other guests in the main bit were a mother and daughter and I think it's safe to say that both parties were quite relieved not to be sharing with some all-night partiers... We felt perfectly safe with them and had a good chat.Both rooms were clean, if not anything special, but the bathroom was pretty grim. As we were only there for one night I skipped the shower - it was filthy, full of other past guests' stuff and had a dirty towel in place of a bath mat...On the plus side, the staff were all friendly and helpful, the location was great and I liked the hangout area/bar downstairs. If you only need somewhere to crash and want to be in the heart of Waikiki beach, this is a good choice. That said, we have stayed in hostels all over the world in some pretty prime locations which have been cheaper and much cleaner and smarter... All this place needs to up its ratings is a really deep clean and bit of a spruce up - it gets everything else right!

We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2013 and found the accommodation clean and tidy. The beds aren't the most luxurious or comfortable but they do the job! Very friendly and helpful staff, make sure you ask them about shuttles, they know the best companies!Highly recommended for any young/young at heart travellers. We met so many great people here, everyone was very friendly and keen to have a good time! Pity the noise restrictions require the hostel party to shutdown at 10.30!Would definitely stay again

My first time staying in a hostel and i absolutely loved this place. I stayed here for 3 weeks and had nothing to complain about. Keep in mind I am 21 and partied here a lot, if your looking for somewhere quiet I would look elsewhere. The staff was amazing and I met so many amazing people here. Definitely recommend for people travelling alone looking to meet people or if you really like to party ;)

The staff was nice but kind of lazy and the noise was rediculous. It's a hostel not a freshman college dorm room-not everyone is here to just party and drink in the main area. The staff did nothing to regulate this.Also in general the hostel has nothing to offer. Just a few picnic tables and a vending machine. No ice, barely any outlets in the rooms or common area, and the front desk knew nothing about what was going on around town.

Stayed for 6 nights and had a ball. Position is one of the best you can get for the money with only a 5 minute walk to the beach. The only thing I would mark down on is the noise after hours but you kind of expect that in a hostel...just no way to escape it.

A block away from the beach, friendly staff, very good for the price. It's close to almost everything. Also the staff can help you looking for good deals on tours. I stayed at a 4-beds female room which was just perfect! Definitively I would stay there again.

Having stayed at another hostel 4 blocks away I would not recommend here. There's a good atmosphere but the rooms are disgusting. In 4 nights our dorm wasn't cleaned once. The shower was revolting and the kitchen area, right next to the beds, was crawling in ants. There was lots of gone off food- I don't know when it was last cleaned properly. The bedding was clean though and the beds reasonably comfortable although it was noisy at night. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location wise it's 2 mins from the beach which is a bit quieter than other parts but the swimming is either in a shallow lagoon type area or over rocks. It's only about 5 minute walk to the other bit of beach and the shops and restaurants. If atmosphere is your main concern this might be the hostel for you but dot stay here if cleanliness is important- there are better hostels close by.

I luckily only stayed 1 night here in a 8 bed dorm. The room would be good, it's actually two rooms with 4 beds in each room. But it was so dirty!!! On the empty beds was sand, the floor was dirty (i would not like to walk around barefoot), but the worst was the kitchen: Cockroaches everywhere. And for this bad quality I paid 32$/night. They really need to invest in cleaning!!!

It was an great hotel. I enjoyed my stay emensly with all round great service with the exception of the night watch at the desk. The man's name was chad, he was unprofessional in his conduct around the guest. The guests were told we could smoke at the smoke area in front of the hostel buildng where there was a smoke can where people could put cigar buds and the guests were told we could smoke there by the people during the day. But during the night the guests tried to smoke and chad told us/guests to move away from the smoke area that had already been designated fo guests. Chad too had too come to a guests room and told them that either shut up or they would get kicked off the premisis untill 3:00 am. The guests in this designated room were not even causing a disterbance or being loud. Chad was highly unprofessional in his conduct with his guests. New management for the night shift is highly recommended for the hostel hotel. Other than this discrepency it was a very enjoyable experance.

Stayed at this hostel for three nights at the end of March 2013 and found it to be pretty clean and comfortable. Great location in the heart of Waikiki so can walk all around. Only a block from the beach but on a side street where its quieter.

I brought my sister here for a weeks stay and the price was $222. It's on a little old time street 1/2 a block from the beach or the zoo. There is a wide range of ages staying there not just young although they are the majority. She stayed in a four bed dorm, there are also eight bed dorms, semi private, meaning a locked door with two other beds sharing a kitchen or private if you book all three beds. I was very surprised to find any place in Waikiki this inexpensive and close to everything. There was a comment about loudness my sister said she used earplugs and there wasn't any loudness problems for her. They have places for vehicles extra and storage $5 QD a large screen TV in the enclosed common area and a cafe next door and an ABC,the endemic 7-11, of Waikiki, at the end of the street. This is one great deal for friends visiting me from the mainland and I will for sure be using it again when my friends are here. It could even be a place to run away to if I wasn't so much in love.

review_body: Well the hostel wasn't very friendly at the desk. They were not helpful at all.. Also the rooms were very dirty and the bugs were everywhere. The location was great, 5mins away from the beach. So I wouldn't recommend this hostel.

Wow! You just can't beat free wifi, continental breakfast and maid service at a hostel! If all your looking for is a cheap place to crash, a kitchen and a shower, then hostels are the way to go! I traveled by myself and stayed in an 8 female dorm room for two weeks! Everyone was courteous and respectful and pretty much gone the entire time. Gated community open 24/7, coed or male/female dorms right next to the beach! They have a large activity area with snack bar and vending machines. Scooter and bike rental right out front. Located in the heart of Waikiki, you won't be searching for things to do! Just take the speedy shuttle from the Honolulu airport and it's only 12 bucks! There's a Safeway down the road so u can save money and cook in your room. Hit up the Diamond Head National Park or learn to surf a few feet away from your room! This place is a must! Check out their website and watch the video. Mahalo!

We stayed a total of two weeks at this hoste. The staff is awesome, very friendly, helpful and professional. The dorms that we stayed in were clean. The vibe of the hostel is relaxed and at night people usually meet at the lounge for a beer and a good time. We also got superb help when we were running late for our flight back home, thanks to the staff we managed to catch the flight. This is the place to stay in Waikiki, thanks for having us!

This place was bloody awful. We stayed for 3 nights at the start of march in and 8 bed shared dorm. 4 of the beds are in the kitchen, which doesn't make for an sleep at all when you have hardcore partiers in your room bringing all their mates back for pre drinks at 1am and then rolling in at 5am deciding to cook food because they have the drunken munchies. The rooms are barely clean, even though a cleaner comes in everyday, there are hardly any plug sockets to charge various electrical items, and the places in full of crack heads. Everyone here is a hard core partier. If you want a decent nights kip get a private room. The breakfast and communal areas are the parking lot underneath the hotel... Which isn't exactly welcoming. The location is great, your a two minute walk from the beach and about 10 minutes from the main shops etc, but that's about all this place has going for it. I would never stay here again, go to Polynesian beach 2 doors down.

ALOHA! Keep in mind this is a HOSTEL not a HOTEL. I got in really early from my flight (8am) and although check-in is not until 12 they checked me in right away. I got a night for free as I stayed a week which was a good surprise. The staff are lovely and willing to help wherever possible. A stones throw to the beach, Zoo and aquarium along with the main shopping stretch. Yes the rooms are old and could do with being closed for a day and properly clean but I think if you have done enough backpacking you come to accept a bit of dirt. My room included 4 single beds, a kitchen with microwave, huge fridge and stove, it's own ensuite and a private balcony. Overall loved my stay. It can be very noisy at night but they try to shut that down between 10-11pm. Bed was very comfy too but the air con sounded like a piece of heavy machinery, best left off in 204b. Mahalo WBH!

Keep in mind that I report on my room only and my experience.The Good: Great location near the beach, good lounge area and breakfast/snack bar ($2 burgers) The Bad: filthy, no, make that FILTHY! Sticky floors, grimey shower, dust balls, old clothing from travelers long gone laying in the corners of the room. In three days no one came to clean the room. No one could use the kitchen unless they washed all the dishes that my inconsiderate room mates left piled in the sink for days. These were young people who had not been housetrained properly. They arrived in the room after midnight and wanted to party all night. Although the "rules" require that guests keep the kitchen area clean and a "quiet time" between certain hours, the staff refused to address the problem and had a "good luck with that" attitude. The "Ugly American" arose from my sleeping body on the second night to quell the disturbance.The Ugly: The young male staff was very attentive to young female guests, but I witnesed very rude behavior to an older woman who was struggling to communicate with english.

This hostel is a converted motel about half a block inland from the east end of Waikiki Beach. WBH is the largest and definitely has the most fun and social vibe out of the three hostels on the same street, but has a professional staff that still makes sure everything runs smoothly. It is larger than average (2 buildings facing each other with 4 floors each).Rooms are cleaned daily, the front desk is manned 24/7 (and by actual staff, not down on their luck backpackers), and the rooms are locked by magnetic wristbands that are waterproof and practically indestructible (I took it to 100 feet scuba diving and went surfing with it). Each dorm room is equipped with a kitchen, fridge, coin lockers, and bathroom. However, there is no restroom on the ground floor which is a little inconvenient if you've been drinking beers all night and live on the 4th floor. There is a large and airy lounge on the ground floor where people tend to congregate and drink after dinner and before breakfast. It's fairly easy to meet people just hanging out there. I remember earlier during my stay there was a large group that stuck to themselves, but it got easier as more people traveling along or in smaller groups of 2~4 showed up. The lounge shuts down at 10 and everyone left gets kicked out so the party people walk out to the pier or to the rest of Waikiki and everyone else can get some sleep. Now downsides: The free breakfast is just toast, but the internet cafe in the base of the eastern building serves decent breakfast food and local island food. The hostel is located at the very end of the beach so it is about a longish 20~30 minute walk to the center of Waikiki if you want to explore some other bars or take advantage of the backpacker specials on Lewers street. Some reviews talk about creepy long term guests. There were more older (35+) guests staying at this hostel (1~2 in my 8 pax dorm rooms) than I had encountered traveling in Australia or SE Asia, but the only long term guest I met was a 20 something who had been living there with his wife for a month. There were some awkward guys so if I was a girl I would try to stay in one of the girl dorms. But regardless, I would probably stay here again if I came back to Waikiki since it is close to the beach and social. Another hostel I would consider in Waikiki is the Seaside that is more centrally located, but smaller and slightly further from the beach.

This hostel made our trip an incredible one! The staff were very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. They went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and happy. It was a great place to meet people and have a fun time. I'd highly recommend it for anyone travelling alone, or in a group. Probably the best hostel on the island! I'd definintely go back :)

As a lone traveller, I didn't find it easy to meet new people here. It didn't help that I was in a room with 2 couples (and one of those couples made a goadawful racket at 12 midnight and 5am when they'd come and go every day!) They location is amazing, only a couple of blocks from the beach, and also from buses to take you elsewhere on the island. I found it strange that there were cooking facilities in the room, especially as people were supposed to sleep there. Cleaners came every day.

Paying less than 30$ for a night in Hawaii is simply perfect! You are 5 minutes far from the touristic Waikiki beach and from alot of shops and ABC Stores (Corner store).There are 3 hostels on Lemon Rd and from talking with other people, this is THE best one, no doubt. Rooms were not the cleanest though but they were still fine. Having a refrigerator, a kitchen stove and a microwave in our room is really sweet for what we pay... Daily basic breakfast is also a cool thing that the hostel offers.If you wanna party a little, you can't stay in the lounge after 10pm though because it gets too noisy. Bad or not? Depends if you wanna sleep early or not.One little advice - Get out of Waikiki if you can, it's less touristic :)!

I was booked into a semi-private room for nine nights in total. The hostel itself is clean and well looked after, albeit a little dated in places (but it's a hostel, I've yet to stay in one that isn't in places!). However, the staff are excellent, and it felt very safe. It can get a little noisy in the courtyard most of the rooms look onto, but by ~10.30pm, it gets quiet enough to sleep as people are asked to leave. Overall, you get extremely good value for money (particularly given its location) and a safe and friendly hostelling experience.

I sort of booked a ticket to Honolulu on a whim because flights were cheap. I looked into a few hostels and decided on this one because of the location and the social atmosphere. This was my first hostel experience plus traveling alone so I didn't know what to expect. But the staff were friendly and super helpful. And I met so many awesome people. My two room mates from South America are now my best friends! Yaaaay!The location is superb, you are right by restaurants, coffee shops such as Starbucks, Coffee Bean, etc., and the everything seems to in walking distance. I booked a few random things via Groupon and had no trouble hopping on the bus for a $2 fare ride.FYI: There is a shuttle offered from the airport and from the hostel at the price of $12 each way. Or you have the option of hopping on the bus for $2 but that takes a about an hour.Room: I stayed in a four twin bed room, there were two twins in a private room and two twins in the public space where the kitchen is. It was spacious enough, there were drawers, you get a pillow and a sheet (I brought my own!), fridge, microwave, stove, and oven. The rooms get cleaned out everyday which was cool. If you aren't planning on staying in your room very much like a hermit crab and going out exploring most of the time than this is PERRRRFECT.

I just got back from Waikiki and wanted to share what a great hostel this was. Best suited for single people who want to go out. I was in a 4 bed girls room and then a private room. the 8 bedroom rooms looked a bit much for me and I didn't want to share with men. The beds were comfortable, the girls super friendly, the staff outgoing. Best to book early as the hostels fill up fast. Mahalo!

It is one of limited offers of cheap accommodation close to Waikiki beach. the cleanliness of dormitories is up to the guests and the rest of the building was generally clean. I like the idea of breakfast that is included, it is simple but it starts the day nicely. Front office runs professionaly and the rules of the house are reasonable. Recommend for those who want to have fun, need some bed and shower and spend most of the time outside.

I decided to go to Honolulu for the first time right after turning 21, as a present to myself. Hotel prices in Hawaii are really high due to the large number of visitors, especially those coming for cold places this time of the year, like mainland US, Japan and Korea, so I decided to save some money staying at the Waikiki Beachside Hotel, in a small dormitory room (2 bedrooms, 4 beds, 1 bathroom).Many youth hostels reviews said that these places are so noisy and full of party-goes that is it really difficult to sleep, but actually there´s an ordinance that people stay quiet after 10 pm in the Waikiki area. Even on weekend nights, the Waikiki Beachside Hostel was pretty much silent after 10:30 pm, so unless you plan to go to bed at 8 or 9 pm (which you shouldn't), there is nothing to worry!Each room has its own shared bathroom and 0.25 USD lockers, which can come in handy for storaging your valuables.Locaiton is great. Waikiki beach is only a couple of minutes walk away. Since I was traveling solo, I would leave my valuables (passport, wallet) in my room and go to Waikiki Beach with my towel, sunscreen and swimming clothes only. The area is very safe even at night and there is an ABC Mart 15 seconds away on foot.Also, this hostel has a very easy access. Buses #19 and #20 take you from the airport to Waikiki and drops you off only 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beachside Hostel. Public buses going to Pearl Harbor, Ala Moana Mall, Downtown Honolulu, Diamond Head and more and trolleys going everywhere stop very close, too!Reception is open 24 hours a day and they're friendly and helpful. They have a storage service too.I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Honolulu on a budget. Oh, as for the free breakfast, it is very, very simple, but I actually had it everyday. Many guests gather there, so it's a nice time to share advice with them.

Loved this hostel! Very friendly staff-- even before I met them, they were helpful. Drew helped me with reservations-- and was so friendly and helpful, I was really surprised in a good way. The other staff members were also very helpful and nice! You can tell they love their job.Location- awesome!Cleanliness-- super clean and well maintained!!Only negative was that the wifii was not too good. Free breakfast-- awesome!!Five Stars to this one!Had an awesome new year here!!!

Staff is very friendly and professional. They are available 24/7. Will arrange cabs, give recommendations and even make reservations for you. The food from the grill is the best value in the area. Two minutes to the beach. Free wifi.Free coffee, toast

I was suppose to stay 2 weeks..ended up staying three! This is a hostel, so lots of young travelers all for the same reason - sun and surf! I came with 3 other girls and we all enjoyed our stay. I stayed in a dorm which was fine - all rooms had kitchens and fridge which was helpful as there were times we just made dinner at home with the new friends we made!. Its right across from the zoo and a couple blocks from the beach. The hostel lounge common area is a great place to meet people whether you're travelling alone or with others. It CAN get loud as the common area closes around 1000pm so most people head out to the bars or down to the beach for drinks or just to hang out and people do tend to come back and continue the merriment across the balconies.For cheap eats check out the cafe right next door..great food...simple and good prices! The hostel also offers rentals for the day which is pretty good..staff are nice and helpful. I made some real good friends here and really enjoyed my time!

I went to honolulu alone to get a truly unique experience. Even though I have friends who live in honolulu I decided to stay in the hostel to meet some new people. I had a great time, most of the staff was very friendly and a lot of the people staying in the hostel are eager to meet new people. There were plenty of people here just to relax and it was easy to find people who wanted to go out and party too. Doug is my favorite staffer he's very nice and has a ton of great stories/insight to share. If I didn't stay here my trip would have only been half as good.
