review_body: Let me tel you, people:If you travel through Hawaii islands and staying in Honolulu - Waikiki Beachside Hostel is the place to spend at least a few days or weeks. I am absolutely serious about that. Put it this way: Are you willing to spend $100/night for the hotel if you save money for something important? Why to pay so much if you need a room only to take a shower, to have a snack and some rest? That's my point! On Hawaiian islands you are basically outdoor. Hostel like this - best way to save $$$ and to meet really great people in a lounge hall. I have staid in hostels only 3 times in my life: in Arizona, Nevada and here - in Hawaii. I can tell you straight up: I fell in love with this hostel. I've spent here 1 month. Perfect place for the open-minded travelers. Rooms are clean. Staff are AWESOME - always nice and helpful. Just don't mess with basic rules, don't get drunk too much after 10 P.M. and they will treat you like V.I.P. There are only 6 guys and girls working in Waikiki Beachside Hostel - personally to me they were super nice. Appreciated to all of you, STAFF: TARYN, DOUG, DAVIS, ZACK and REBECCA.By the way: their choice of music is great! Nice beats & strings, guys. Aloha! And the only complain (the only one): the Internet could be a little faster, my friends. This is the only negative thing I could say.

I recently stayed at this hostel for just under 3 weeks and it provided everything we could possibly want in a hostel at a very reasonable price!it's easy to find, fantastic location, secure, friendly & helpful staff, rooms cleaned daily, brand new mattresses, free wifi and breakfast every morning!I'd definitely recommend this hostel and ill definitely be back here soon :)

Stayed here for just under 3 weeks and they provided everything with daily cleaning.Breakfast (toast) is provided each morning and met alot of new people from all over the world. location is great close to the ocean (2 min walk) and major shopping centres via a quick bus trip.This hostel is easy to find and the service is more than excellent, would highly recommend this place :)

This place was great, cheap, JUST off the strip and a block from the beach! A great value. Also a wicked place to meet people and just hang out. Doug really made my time there special. He was super helpful and charming. When I walked in he found handsome men to help me with my bags, as an extra bonus for me. ;)Not the cleanest hostel I've stayed in, but also not the worst! Totally acceptable, and nothing super gross but don't expect fine white porcelain and shiny floors. I also found it pretty loud at night, but if your looking for a great party, this is the spot! I only warn about those last two things so you know what to expect. They didn't bother me at all, but this wasn't my first rodeo. I don't necessarily recommend this as a first hostel experience, as it might be a bit much to deal with if you aren't used to hostel living, but I loved this place! It was super warm and friendly; I had a really great time here. I would have stayed longer if I didn't have other plans. I would also go back here if I had to spend more time in Waikiki, which says a lot I think. I would recommend this place to friends, with the above disclaimer. :) you'll love it! Find Doug. He's le best.

I stayed at the Beachside hostel for 1 night in April 2012.I had seen all the advertisment for this hostel everywhere and thought it was the place to be, according to the reviews. We arrived around 6 pm, and the hostel was easy to find. The people working there were also very nice and friendly.My first impression was that it is a party hostel. Mostly young people (around 18-28 y.o.) that are there to meet people and have a good time. My boyfriend and I were staying in a private room and the price was very decent.The room was ok, but the thing I thought was a little weird is that you had to go through someone else's room to access yours. In the frist room, there was a kitchen with a table, fridge, stove, etc. which was nice. But we felt a little bad using it because the people in that room were always there sleeping. Anyways. The room itself was ok, but nothing more. It was clean-ish, but my overall opinion of this place is that it has potential, but it needs a little love! The paint is cracked everywhere, the mirrors and bathtub are stained, the floor is white ceramic but the cracks in between are really black (like dirty).. You know, they should fix the broken stuff just to make it a notch nicer. Apart from that, bathroom is OK; not dirty but not clean.Everything just has an old feel and that it hasn't been taken care of. The paintings on the walls are really cool though, and the patio area outside is nice, wi-fi is ok (a little slow.)We ended up looking for another place the next day, and so we decided to stay at the H.I. Waikiki, which, honestly, was much better in my opinion.

I recently stayed at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel and I have nothing but good things to say. The room itself (4-person Female Dorm) was clean and has everything you need including a kitchen. The staff were all extremely nice and helpful as well. I had the best time staying here and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in Waikiki
user_name:
Brittany E
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Great location. Only a few minutes away from Waikiki beach. I absolutely loved the location, but the rooms were not that nice. Dirty beds. I was so afraid of bed bugs, even though we didn't get any. The staff were friendly and helped us with any questions.

We initially stayed at Waikiki Beachside Hostel because it was really cheap, had free breakfast and wifi and was raved about on all the websites as the best hostel in the area and we were not disappointed. The facilities were great for what we needed (a bed, a shower and a place to keep our bags) and the location was next to perfect. The beach is just down the road and there's food and other shops to suit all of your needs within walking distance.The staff were super friendly and helpful! Would definitely return next time I'm in Hawaii!

this hostel is placed right next to the beach, with surfing rentals about a 5 minute walk away. the rooms were basic, but they did the job. my only issues were with having to pay for the lockers. but it was only .25c so not really bank busting. now.... where did they do well? for starters, the staff - dougie bear and trav especially were AWESOME!! i can't remember the others names, but they were all good. i wanted to know something - out came the computer, brochures, etc. they sorted so much out for me, and for that i am very grateful. the people staying at the hostel were cool. there was a very varied crowed - if you wanted to chill out on the beach with a guitar, there were people for that. want to go party until 4am? theres a crowed for that. i would also suggest, if visiting from england (and have an interest in this) to do your diving in hawaii. it is much cheaper.... and it is hawaii..... but thanks for a great time guys. my liver hates you, but my heart loves ya' :D

Clean,great location,very secure.Would sugest visiting in the " off season" for a first class stay in Waikiki Beachside Hostel. This place gets very busy in the winter for the simple fact the words out!!! HIGHLY recommand this facility.

The staff were extremely helpful with my travel plans, my stay, and just in general! They were fun and caring. With a common area, the social vibe is great and there are usually people around to meet all the time. I had a great stay and would go back to Honolulu and stay here in a heart beat.-Audrey

I stayed 4 nights at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel at the end of September 2012 and 2 nights 2 weeks later. The hostel is situated at 2 minutes of the beach by foot. There are several shops and restaurants at the same distance. The staff is very friendly and there's a breakfast included every morning (toast, tea, coffee). I was in a 8 females dorms and the first time it wasn't really clean. But when I came back 2 weeks later, I noted that the guests were the problem, not the staff. It's nice because it's like little appartment where you share the kitchen and the bathroom with only the people of your dorm.

the price might not be the lowest in honolulu. Its starts from USD27 but the location is strategic which is at Lemon Road, one street away from the Waikiki beach. the staff there are friendly and helpful at all times. internet might not be very fast at times but hey! spend more time at the beach. facilities are good enough and there are houseperson who cleans the room every morning. breakfast are provided every 9 to 10 am.

This was the start of my trip.. and the first hostel I'd ever stayed in... at the time I didn't think much about it.. but looking back on it.. it was a really great hostel.It was clean, safe, comfy beds, spacious rooms and great air con!We had a semi-private room which consisted of a two bedded (not bunk) room that had its own lock.. that you had to walk through another room to get to... the first room had two more beds, a kitchenette, bathroom and dining table. Super spacious and great set up for a hostel with everything in your room!Free breakfast was good too!Nice relaxed attitude at the hostel.Just had a brief visit so didn't use many of the hostels facilities.... but when I come back.. would defo stay there again!!!!!

I've been to Paris, London, Vegas, Mexico and yes, I have been to Hawaii before. But this place... I don't really know how to describe it. Let's start with the bad things. The beds are bunkbeds and are very shakey. Not like you are going to fall off, but you fell bad for the other person. And that's it for bad. And it's not even that big of a deal.The Good: Location is prime, right next to the Waikiki Marriot, 1.5 blocks from the beach. The staff is extreamly helpful and nice. There is 1 really surfboard for rent ($10/ 4 hours) and rest are softtops. Snorkel gear is free and there is PB&J toast for free at 9am. Next door, there is a moeped rental that gives a 10% discount if you stay.The Great: Nothing beats staying in a hostel. They have a requirement that you show you will be leaving to make sure homeless people don't just crash there (which is what 1 down the street looks like). The people who stay there are some of the greatest I've ever met in my life. We played drinking games at night, surfed (I taught) during the day. It was so insane that many of the people I met will be meeting up in each of our host cities. Life long friends are made here.From now until the day I die, I will always stay at the Beachside Hostel. I'll even bring the kids there (Just have to make sure they sleep in the back). kent, Daniel, Kerstin, Kyle and Josh will always have a debt of gratitude to this place for helping us meet each other. Can't wait to come back.

I loved this place, Doug was the first to greet me and he was fantastic, very welcoming and friendly. All the reception staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. It is a basic hostel but it is so close to the beach. Never had any problems apart from the lightbulb went out in the shower and I went to reception and they fixed it straight away! Also if you have no problem with the usual city noise throughout the night you'll sleep fine here! So impressed guys!! Definitely coming back to Hawaii and will be staying at the Beachside again, miss it so much already!

I sayed here for a week and a half at the end of August and really enjoyed it. Stayed in an 8 bed dorm, not very spacious but clean and ideal if you just need a place to sleep and shower! Perfect location, less than a minutes walk from the gorgeous beach, shops nearby, bars within 5 minute walk and plenty of places to eat too. Communal area good, everyone kicks off their evening there but shuts at 10pm, a bit too early but something to do with noise apparently. Would reccomend!!

Hal (fake name) is the one who is the wet blanket, never smiles. the other staff is friendly & helpful. Have previous stays, some of the stuff is upgraded, like the generic pb & j to name brand.Have more staff in the morning to clean. have kept out some of the drunken party animals (good) who used to make late night entries. the social is good, a melting pot usually only seen in DC.Lockers in room is new, as is the security camera in the Lounge area. Location is good.Need a supermarket close by not an ABC store, fast food gets old fast. location location, location.one block walk to beach, & all night fast food. bike rental is next door.Go out & meet the world !!

I stayed here for 3 weeks, and I loved it! They had a discount going, book 6 days get the 7th free, so I got 3 free nights! If I had any questions, the front desk was super helpful. There was dinner every night in the lounge, and it was always great. There was a little wifi cafe (that it took me forever to notice!) that sold a cheap, delicious breakfast and lunch every day.I had a few sets of roommates that I spent a lot of time with, and everyone was SO friendly; guests and staff alike. They have women's only dorms, but I stayed in a COED, because I didn't care (and why take the women's only room if I was indifferent?). They were so accommodating.Great for younger travelers, in groups or solo. Definitely recommend staying here.

I loved this hostel from the moment I set foot in the place. Just the way it is set-up makes for a great common area where meeting people becomes second nature. I highly recommend this hostel if you are planning on meeting some new friends. Also clean, good priced and friendly staff!
user_name:
Michael L
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: Hostel was exactly as expected for $30 a night. Basic but very clean, with kitchenette and plenty of extras like free breakfast and local phone calls. Doug was great and went out of his way to help, as was the other guy on reception. Unfortunately the same couldnt be said of the ladies - they just werent as keen to help. So if you are looking to book tours or need help on what to see I'd say ask the guys. It was quite a noisy hostel but that didnt bother me. I almost didnt stay here due to other reviews about bed bugs - but glad I did as we had no problems. Maholo.

If you are looking for a cheap place with a lot of (young) people ready to make party- it's defintively the place to be! The hostel is very well situated ( 3-5 min to waikiki beach). I was in a 8 dorms (2 benk beds per room). My room was noisy and the confort was basic, but there is a kitchen, a microwave and hot water, So if you are not afraid by the noise, it's really a good deal.

I stayed in the Waikiki beachside hostel in March 2010 and although I did enjoy parts of my trip with a good value-for-money bbq and surfboard rental, the stay was ruined by my hostel room being infested with bedbugs. I moved bed twice and everytime I went to sleep, I ended up being bitten. I counted over 90 bites on my body in the shower at one point. It made the stay very unpleasant, as it meant that you dreaded going to sleep every night and that is not something that you want from a hostel whose main purpose is to give you a bed for the night.

Was there for three nights I Stayed in a room that faced the street, there were only partial window dressings that we're broken. there was no privacy for changing and the street light shone straight in. With no air con or fans the option was to leave window open unfortunately the smokers sat under the window so the room copped the smokeThere was a lot of left over junk in the room from previous visitors making it messy and unclean Breakfast was provided 9-10am I was always gone by then so can't comment on it.Staff were very friendly and great ambassadors for the area.

After almost 3 weeks travelling in Hawaii, my sister and I decided to spend the last 3 days at Waikiki. A huge contrast. From laidback islands to a big city. We stayed at this hostel and it was just perfect. It's just one minute walk from the beach, the staff is very friendly, 24/7 open, location PERFECT, good hygiene, clean, and a very good atmosphere. Nothing then only positive words for this hostel. We payed $ 75,- a night for a semi-private room and it is well worth it!Keep in mind that every bar, club, etc at Waikiki close at night around 3.30 AM. So there is a lot of noise. It didn't bother me.

Firstly, I'd like to say a massive thank you to Travis and the guys at the hostel. They were all very informative and made me feel completely at ease. Travis showed us some really nice beaches and party spots. The hostel was clean. Andy, the chief cooked yummy meals for $8 every night and is lovely. The location is great. Two minute walk to the beach, zoo and shops. I met Rebecca (manager) once and she looked like she didn't want to be there. She needs to put a smile on her dial! Special thanks to Travis, Doug, Tim, Buddy and Andy. Without the five of you, my stay wouldn't of been the same!! Would come back for sure!!!

Beachside hostel is located 1 block behind waikiki beach front, only 1 min walk to the beach, 3 min walk to the market and 20second walk to ABC store (small supermarket). Staff are so friendly, willing to help any one out and are available 24/7.best key system over, not keys, not key card, just a rubber band around ur arm to unlock ur door, means no loosing your keys, not getting locked out which has happened in past hostels.Rooms were clean and kitchens had all the equipment to cook anything, great while been on a budget.

I stayed in this hostel for 5 nights in Honolulu. The location is excellent and right next to the beach in Waikiki and across the street from the Honolulu Zoo. The employees are not really helpful and when you ask them questions you feel like you are bothering them. We stayed in a 4 bed/semi-private female dorm and it was pretty quiet after 10pm. For breakfast they have toast, coffee, tea and peanut butter and jelly. The mattresses are kind of yellow and as are the pillows but there are no bed bugs. We found roaches in the kitchen but they have maids that come around and clean every night. Instead of having a room key they give you a bracelet that you use to access your room/dorm which is kind of cool. Bring your smart phone or own laptop because they charge a LOT to use their computers.

Just returned from a 10 day visit to Waikiki and tghe beachside was the BEST. The front desk staff are friendly and accomodating; available 24 hours a day and NEVER made me feel that i was bothersome. Andy and Leon at the cafe were knowledgeable about the island and attractions and the food they served was delicious. I would recommend this hostel to ANYONE and plan to return there in May. This was my first hostel experience and certainly a very pleasant one. I can't think of one negative comment to print about this hostel. Tim at the front desk made the shuttle reservations for my two day trip to maui.. was quite helpful with anything that I asked of him. The prices were excellent, the rooms were clean and the atmosphere was ALOHA........Kudos to all the staff....

I've been an ardent backpacker & globetrotter for 20yrs,not only in staying at hundreds of hostels,but also in having been a Hostel Mgr for 5yrs.I must say how lovely my 2wk stay @ The Waikiki Beachside Hostel was.Erik,Davis,Doug,Rebecca & Tim on the desk,as well as Gabla & the cleaning staff, kept the Aloha spirit high.The hostel has fantastic facilities,thick mattresses,is cleaned daily & accommodates to all ages (min.18yrs+).They're tight on guest security,but layed-back,easy,breezy..Great wickedly strong coffee @ breakfast.The wristband door keys are cool!.This Hostel creates respect & harmony & is more than just friendly...choose it & you have chosen wisely...Location top notch!!!Advice: if you're a light sleeper bring earplugs (neighbouring building can be rowdy & there are early morning truck deliveries to adjacent hotels)Suggestion for this hostel: Breakfast would be nicer @ 8-9am,rather than 9-10am.Less hanging around & more "get us out & about earlier" & out of your hair...

I stayed at this place for 2 nights in June 2011 before heading off to Kauai. I'll be brief about this this place, it's buzzing with young people, it's generally clean (also depends on your roommates I guess), staff is professional and helpful, it's just a block from the beach in Waikiki and more important it's cheap.If you're on a budget and want some good food look up "Rainbow drive in waikiki" on google. When leaving the hostel take a left and keep walking up the street, it i'll be on you're right at a crossing next to a gas station after 5 to 10 minutes of walking. All the locals go there and a meal varies from 4 to 8 bucks and tastes great (did I mention there's hardly any waiting around for your food as they serve almost immediately). And if you also want some cheap breakfast, continue walking up this street you'll eventually see a Safeway supermarket on your left. For all non-americans, make sure you get a members card, it can save you as much as half on your bill.

This is a well organized hostel operation just around the corner from Waikiki beach. It has a nice main sitting area and little touches like music in the evenings (sometimes live) and toast with peanut butter and jelly in the mornings. The pillows were really yellow and gross and the shower could have used a good cleaning. The sitting areas and kitchens were kept really clean. The rooms felt pretty packed for the space.There were alot of drugged up guests in this place. Some of them just came and set up camp for weeks and were generally incomprehensible. But to end on a good note: great locationand very helpful nice staff.

I miss this place!!!I stayed here for 7 nights with 2 girlfriends, I'll be honest, we weren't exactly thrilled with our 4 bed female dorm when we opened the door...the mattresses/pillows were a bit grotty (we were given clean sheets and pillow case thank goodness) and the bathroom a little gross. (the rooms are cleaned daily) BUT, we had the most amazing time at the hostel. The staff were great, super helpful & friendly - special mention to Travis, Tim & Davis :) awww!Good value for money. Despite being in a bit of a dodgy street & having a few dodgy people hanging around out the front of the hostel on the street at night we felt safe as anything!The location is great, there are convenice stores less than 30 seconds walk away, the beach is only 1 minute walk away as is the main street with shopping, food, bars etc.We met some great people staying at the hostel and have some very funny memories - if I get a chance to go back to Hawaii & choose to stay in a hostel, I would choose The Waikiki Beachside hostel again without a doubt :)

I had a great time staying at The Waikiki Beachside Hostel and would recommend it to anyone! I was traveling solo, so location was key- a bus from the airport( the bus stop is around the corner) and the beach and park are a block away.I wasn't disappointed. I got pretty lucky with my roomates, stayed in a female 8-bed dorm room( its actually two rooms connected) and the girls were very nice,friendly and kept it clean. We had a kitchenette,the grocery stores are not too far and there is also food downstairs + complimentary peanut jelly toast for breakfast. Staff were very cool and helpful, It's in a safe tourist area, but it could get loud- bring earplugs;)

It's an adequate hostel, but I would only stay here again if I were with a group of at least 4 friends and thus, be able to take up an entire room. Because there were 3 different groups of people sharing the room I was in, security was a pretty big issue. No one had anything turn up missing, but it would be extremely easy for a thief to make off with a big haul at this place. That said, it's a great location and there's a bar scene on the main floor. Very young crowd, lots of Europeans and island-hopping students around.
user_name:
bFly11
New York City, New York

review_body: Waikiki Beachside Hostel is a great place to stay, less than a block to the beach and a couple of minutes walk to pubs/clubs. Travis, Tim & Davis at the front desk are always their very approachable/ if ever had any questions will certainly be able to help you out. The hostel is very clean and is a warm friendly atmosphere and is a great place to meet new friends/ have a great time in Hawaii.. Thanks Guys for a great time.

Well-maintained Hostel in a great location. They have a free breakfast of toast and jelly with coffee and they offer affordable dinner as well. All of my fellow guests seemed laid back and easy going and the price was great!I only have two main complaints. Firstly, don't plan on getting to much sleep until after midnight. Lot's of partying going on and people coming and going. Secondly, while the coin operated lockers are secure, it is annoying to have to feed money just to keep your stuff secured. I would prefer they either let me use my own lock, or just give me a key for my stay.

Great place to stay when travelling alone and on a budget. A mere block away from Waikiki Beach (just as its name suggests) which makes it extremely value for money. Besides one unfriendly staff, everyone else working there was great. It could get a tad noisy at night depending on the crowd living there, but the staff were firm with getting them out of the lounge area to keep the noise level down.Rooms were generally clean and furnished with a kitchen area. Obviously not a luxury space, so do expect only basic cleanliness and comforts. That said, it isn't too shabby. I was rather unhappy with the haphazard wifi when I was there, but I believe they got that fixed. They do have a 24hr internet cafe, but note that they charge for it. I was most impressed by the staffs' alertness and concern for guests' safety. There were dodgy guys trying to sell passes to a pub crawl, but the staff were rather quick in getting them off the vicinity and warning guests against them.Overall, it has been a good experience, and friendships fostered in my one week stay was absolutely priceless.

Pros: the staff were all super helpful, all female dorms, and just a two minute walk from the beachCons: the dorm rooms were not cleaned daily, they don't provide or even rent towels, and the dump trucks or construciton noise or something starts very early in the am

Great little homey hostel right by the beach at Waikiki. Perfect location.The staff were exceptionally helpful and it was a great place to be at a busy time of the year. Atmosphere was great, fantastic music coming from a huge TV inbetween two vending machines. Lots of Peanut Butter and jelly. What more could a traveller want?
user_name:
rlangley07
Coogee, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I recently stayed 3 nights in this hostel. It has a great location and very helpful staff!!! Seriously, thanks Travis!!!!!!!! I visited other hotels in the area and none were as nice or as fiendly as this. With surfing, snorkeling, grill, social area and free boogie boards this place is highly recommended! I will only stay in this hostel when visiting Waikiki beach.

Travis, Eric and Doug are the best! The service at this hostel is exceptional. Its clean and has nice hot showers. The Fun is off the charts! The staff makes sure everyone socializes its so easy to meet travelers from all over the world. I have been to Waikiki many times, but because of the Waikiki Beachside Hostel, this trip has been by far the most epic!

I concur with Carl's review, Top hostel, had a awesome time, and meet a ton of cool people and was a good base of operations to explore Oahu, would stay again definately, thanks to the hostel staff Rebecca, Eric, Doug and Travis the Travinator, keep up the good work.

This is an absolutely awesome place to stay, everyone staying there is friendly and they're all there for the same reason: to have the best experience that Oahu has to offer! Rates are cheap, but the staff certainly don't reflect that! It is definately a place to stay if you want to have fun and meet heaps of people from all over the world. Rebecca & Eric and the other staff are super friendly and will go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. A special shout out to Travis who will personally show you everything that Waikiki has to offer at night - this guy is going 200% all the time! He'll show you all the best clubs, and some other places to go that aren't in the tourist guides...If you're after a good safe place to stay (staff are excellent with keeping the place secure, especially at night) and if you don't mind sharing your room with some other people then this is definately the place to stay. It's 1 block from the beach and everything in Waikiki is within walking distance.I would definitely stay there again!Stayed for 7 nights.

I stayed there for three weeks in Sept to Oct 2011. I have stayed at several luxury hotels on Waikiki Beach but, this time tried something different. It allowed me to extend my vacation while getting the most out of my visit. It's one block from the beach and what a great location to all the hot spots. The staff was amazing and super friendly. The manager Rebecca was incredible. She was so friendly and helpful. Leon and Andy cooked a full meal each night for $6. Good home cooking. The room was clean and it consisted of 2 single beds in the common area with a full kitchen, bathroom and a private room with two single beds. I rarely had roommates but when I did they were all friendly. They rent lockers to keep your personal belongings in your room. They offer a complimentary snack type of breakfast or a cafe inside had small breakfast options for $2 to $4. I would recommend this place to any person looking to get a great deal on a budget but wants a nice clean and safe place. It's also a great way to meet people from different parts of the world.
user_name:
David V
Florence, Kentucky, United States

review_body: I stayed at Waikiki Beachside on my own in May of 2011 on an impromptu trip to Hawaii. My plane was several hours late, and I didn't arrive at the hostel until 1:00AM. The desk attendants were very kind and accommodating. They pointed me in the right direction for a car rental and suggested a couple day trips. This place is quite literally ONE BLOCK from Waikiki beach, where I people watched and indulged in reading 600 pages/day. The joys of travelling solo! Waikiki itself is a little tacky, but that's to be expected! There's an ABC store around the corner for your exorbitantly-priced-island-convenience-needs. The SUPER EXPENSIVE grocery store is about a 15 minute walk. I stayed nourished by partaking in the hotel breakfast, then getting a Subway footlong meal (around $9) - half for lunch, half for dinner. The hostel also serves dinner for $5. I stayed in an 8 bed female dorm. Only 5 beds were ever filled at a time. There were 2 rooms: a living area with full kitchen, small table, and 2 bunk beds, plus an extra bedroom with an additional 2 bunk beds, as well as an ensuite bath.The A/C was a bit loud in my room and the beds aren't the most comfortable, but I exhausted myself during the days and fell asleep swiftly nonetheless. Twice I noticed some teeny bugs scurrying around on the counter, but I can't say for sure what they were.The free breakfast consisted of toast, peanut butter, Nutella, and tea or coffee. For the price, I'd recommend it for budget travellers.

First of all I want to point out that this hostel is located directly between Polynesian beach club and Seaside Hawaiian Hostel, so don't debate between the three based on location (as I did). The location is great though, very close to the beach/shops etc. Staff go above and beyond to make your stay great. Cheap dinners are a great chance to mingle with other travelers. HOWEVER, at night the place is VERY noisy. If you have a 5am flight to catch this might not be the best choice. Noise carries (a) from the common area that is located in the center of the motel-style rooms and (b) from the moped rental station that it is situated right beside. Again, YOU WILL NOT GET A GOOD NIGHT'S SLEEP HERE, but if it's fun you're looking for, stay and make friends for sure! Last note on the rooms - "Private rooms" have to walk through dorm-style rooms, so they're not completely private, but they are much quieter and very nice. Overall this hostel was very clean.

The location is great. The free breakfast and wifi is great. The rooms are not so great. This place could really do with a good clean and a new coat of paint. Broken blinds and dodgy aircon could easily be fixed if they'd just spend a little money on the place. I guess they don't feel the need to fix things, why would you spend money on it when the beds are all full every night anyway?

I stayed here twice on my recent holiday; at the start and at the end. I met some great people both times and really enjoyed myself. When there at the start of my holiday it was a little quieter but on my last few nights there was a good crowd of people who wanted to get to know each other - there was always someone to talk to around. I stayed in a semi-private room both times and was lucky enough to have great people in the rooms I was in. My room seemed safe and clean enough and I appreciated the air conditioning at times. If you like a peaceful place to stay though, the hostel might not be good for you as there can be quite a bit of noise at times.The staff were always really welcoming and helpful and have lots of ideas of things to do and see if you need some help. I absolutely loved it there, even as someone a little older than the general crowd and would go back there anytime I was in Hawaii.

we had a wail of a time here! it was just amazing. it was close to everything you wanted to be. gave great information to explore the island more eg bus routes. the reception staff were brilliant not to mention davis the legend on reception who no matter how many questions we asked him he always answered them and even booked us a limo back to the airport! leon and andy cooked dinner everynight which was $5 and everynight it was different and delicious- youve got to try andys ranch sauce dressing, they were so welcoming and it was sad to leave them. we made some great friends and memories here. it was our last stop before the painful flight home to england and it lived up to expectations! by FAR the best and coolest place to stay in Waikiki!

I have been to Hawaii 4 times and everytime I come I make sure I stay at this hostel!!! The accommodations are well worth the $25 dollars a night, they keep a good crowd present , cheap good food in the lounge at night, and the best thing about the place is it is located less than a 5 minute walk to waikiki beach! Over the 4 years that i've been staying here I've seen a lot of changes happen here and it seems like they're always trying to improve this establishment. They are always adding new things around the hostel to brighten up the place and make it more appealing to the guest! From the free wi-fi, surfboard rentals, scooter rentals next door, or the lounge for everyone to hangout in, this place is definately becoming one of the best hostels i've stayed at. They've almost caught up to the quality of the hostels in Europe that charge almost double the price! Only negative things i'd have to say about the place is the staff at the front desk at night can be a little rude, but i guess who wouldnt be dealing with a bunch of drunk kids at 4am when you're an elderly man. On the same subject, the street the hostel is on is kinda dodgy, and me being a single young female, knowing that my only protection is an elderly gentleman that couldnt outrun a turtle, it does make you think twice about going on a stroll to the beach by yourself. But that's a big city for you! The only other thing Ive seen change that I really didn't like was when I visited in 2008 and 2009 the staff seemed to be wayyyy more involved. There was a guy and girl that worked at the front desk during evening shifts, named Travis and Sara, both of which always came out into the lounge to interact with the guest. It seemed like even on their days off both of the workers could still be seen around the hostel socializing and befriending anyone in the lounge. Sara used to hold different theme parties in the lounge, and on big holidays would hold huge parties for the guest. Travis on the other hand would always be willing to give guest directions to local sites around the island and take people on free pubcrawls just for the sake of entertaining the guest and showing them a good time. The atmosphere they created there always brought a smile to the guest faces and I have talked to many of guest that have stayed repeatedly at this hostel solely on the fact of how good the staff made them feel welcome. This hostel does need to get the staff more involved like they used to be and Im sure they'll have more repeat guest. Kudo's tho to Chris Davis, everytime i'm there I see him and he's always there to welcome you back with a big hug and a smile! Overall this is by far the best hostel in Hawaii to stay at; Cheap, fun, and an all-around great place to stay!!!!! Thanks WBH for the 4 years of memories!!

I stayed here just expecting a cheap hostel but I found so much more then that. The people that worked in the hostel were lovely. The rooms were very spacious. I was in a strictly all girls room. It consisted of two rooms connected, both with two single beds in each. There was a bathroom for the four of us and a full kitchen! There was also a balcony. It was clean (a little grotty but clean).Because it is such a holiday destination I found that a lot of people had travelled there alone. There was a great buzz about the place with a social area in the court yard below. People could have a full dinner at the hostel for a small charge and they could also drink and listen to music in the out door area until 10ish. This meant that everyone got speaking to each other and you were never really alone. I stayed for two nights in the hostel before moving onto a hotel. I spent all my time in the hotel wishing I was in the hostel.

This was my first time staying at a hostel. I really enjoyed the experience. The staff was friendly and could not have been more helpful. They recommended a great, cheap place to book tours and also gave advice on public transportation and a nature hike, all of which worked out great. The main perk of this place is the location right off of Waikiki beach. This location is in walking distance to so many attractions. The people that stayed there were laid back and friendly and I was able to make some great friends. The price is very cheap

this is a backpackers style hostal, great if you are under 25 y.o. and into party mode. Do not spect ritz carlton paying us$20. You can travel alone and have new friends. Rooms are cleaned everyday so if you need to use the toilet and shower in the big bedroom, do it right after it has been cleaned. A/C was noisy. Close to the beach of waikiki.

This is a great hostel, only one block to the beach and shopping areas. Rooms are clean and have lots of space. Reception are pleasant and informative . The only negative was the key locks tend to play up abit but I found if you bend the key slightly up the door should open.

Ive stayed at the Waikiki beachside hostel 4 times now and every single time I go something is new and better with the place. The very first time i went about 2 years ago I thought i was awesome. Since I first came they have added a cafe with cheap eats, and completely redone the lobby area. They clearly are putting money back into the investment. I am continuously impressed with the staff that is so helpful. My suggestion is if you are a girl stay in an all-girls dormitory because (shhhh) I think they are larger and if you can afford the extra $5 a night get into a 4 person dorm instead of an 8. Much more comfortable :) Always impressed, keep it up guys.

One block from the beach. Staff were super friendly and helpful at all times. Was in 8 bed dorm room. Was a little cramped and bathroom cramped too, but were always cleaned, and the kitchen was great in there and the people staying were friendly. The BBQ's nightly were great and cheap too. Will be staying here again one day for sure.

I stayed at this hostel for a week, travelling on my own for the first time, aged 20. The best thing about this hostel has to be its location from the beach - it's literally only a block away!Stayed in an bed all girls room. The room was a decent size with a kitchenette and a balcony! The dorm was separated into 2 four bed rooms which was nice for a little privacy, although mine doubled up as the kitchen/living area too. Room was of a similar standard to the two hostels I've stayed in in Edinburgh and Berlin, if slightly a little more run down - the bathroom was a bit shabby but fine. The atmosphere here was great - I met some lovely people from all over the world who were down for road trips/surfing in the daytime and drinking/endless games of Uno in the evening! A free (although limited) breakfast is provided and you get can dinner (spaghetti, burger and chips etc) for $5 a night. Staff were friendly and helpful. Travellers are mainly in their 20s with a few older ones too. BAD:However, if you're going to stay on a hostel in Lemon Road - this is the only one I'd recommend - the ones on either side of this one are quite dodgy, with more long-term travellers. On my first day, I witnessed the police carrying a guy out next door who'd got in a fight and been stabbed in the arm.Also, the nearest supermarket is like 30 mins - there are millions of convenience stores around but this is a little annoying if you want to do your own cooking and are trying to save money.

Since I have stayed at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel for a total of 3 times now, I have nothing but praise for the Hostel. A converted effeciency apartment complex, it now houses the "Hostel". Back in 2009 when I first stayed there for 4 days, I had a private room with the use of the kitchen and bathroom. There is daily housekeeping. Phone and T.V. in the room. Large common room on the main level with lots of tropical plants and Wide -Screen TV. and vending machines. The staff are the amazing part. They helped with hand-outs and Bus information on getting around. Breakfast was low key, consisting of Toast, Tea and Coffee. My last visit (Septemember 2010) I noticed that they had a little shop in the Computer room that was offering a nice breakfast. And in the evening, they held a Bar-B-Q which you could order your dinner for a few dollars. Of course the Beach is just about 1 block away. And the famous ABC store right on the corner should you need anything. Scooters and cars for Rent at a discount right next door. You won't be disappointed if you stay there.

This hostel met all of our expectations and more. Generally, I look for just a clean bed to sleep on in a hostel, but this place had excellent accomodations. Rooms were great, washroom was great, and the service was great too.

Obviously the place to go if you want to party: music and lots of loud, drunken debachery until the wee hours of the morning (obviously tolerated by management). Unfortunately for me, I'm not really into it, but got lucky when I booked the semi-private room which was away from most of the noise. If you're in a dorm, you're SOL if you want a peaceful night's sleep. The front desk staff was a little jaded, but they have good meal deals and free wi-fi (bring it because to use their Internet is $5 for a half hour). The best part is they are right on the doorstep to the beach.

I stayed in the 4 person female dorm ensuite, and paid 35 USD per night. Check-in and check-out was quick and fuss-free, and they were quick with answering e-mail enquiries when I lost my booking number. Rooms are dated, but clean and safe.It is located one block from the beach, and breakfast and wifi is included in the price. They serve dinner every night for $5, which is a good price for Waikiki. Internet and lockers are pretty expensive, though. Internet with their computer terminals costs $5 for 30 min, and lockers are per use.
Great location, lots of interesting people!!! Great stay!! They offer few time per week dinner for 5$.

I was a solo male traveller. I stayed at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel for 1 week at the end of January. My main concern about accommodation was security for my belongings since Honolulu was a stopover trip for me, I had 2 expensive guitars and a laptop. From the first phone call the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help me. I kept my guitars in a store room which only the staff have access to and they give you a ticket to take the item out. There are reasonably large lockers in the rooms which is where I kept my laptop and cameras, they are $1 per use and quite secure. I probably could have kept that stuff in the open anyway since all the people who came through were friendly and seemed trustworthy. I was in a 4 person dorm, me and one other in the front room and 2 others in a 2 person room that locked in the back room. I did have friends in 8 person dorms who had some very shady room mates so if you're worried about that that I recommend the 4 person dorm.Basic breakfast (Toast, tea, coffee) is free from 9am and they often have a heartier option for about $4. They also have dinner on offer (burgers, pasta etc.) from 5:30ish for about $5. This is a great way to meet people.There is Free wifi in all the rooms.If people are being noisy past about 11pm, they're pretty good at telling them to shut up and go to bed so sleep quality isn't too bad, but like any hostel in a busy area, I recommend ear plugs.Hi lights in the area were climbing Diamond Head, snorkeling at Hanauma Bay, finding the beach where LOST was shot (kinda near pipeline) and skydiving on the North Shore (find a van with a rainbow on the side that says "skydiving" and talk to them to organise it).DO NOT STAY AT PACIFIC OHANA NEXT DOOR!This place looked so shady, I think they have a lot of long term tenants and there's all sorts of weird people and sounds coming from it, I've only heard bad things.A few of these shady looking people smoke out the front of Waikiki Beachside Hostel but don't seem to come in.
The place is awesome, always something to do. People from all around are very friendly.

This hostel is in the perfect location only a block from Waikiki beach, I stayed for two night in semi private female dorm, cost me $35/night/person, I shared with 3 other female, which make the room cost around 140/night, I felt like they could done better to improve the service especially housekeeping, the room is very dusty and dirty, they have housekeeping service daily but I'm not sure what they do, the floor still dirty, all I see is garbage taken out of room, the place is very noisy too, people talking, loud music, I know this is four season and but with the rates that I paid I feel like the could do some improvement!

As far as hostels go, this is a pretty good one. Its location is really good. You can just walk to best shops and restaurants. More importantly, it is really close to the best beginner surfing spot. There is a big and nice commons area unlike the near by hostels so meeting with new people is easy here. The only negative I will mention is that age diversity is too wide. From teenagers to retired people you can find every kind of people here. I personally prefer hanging out with twenty something international travelers. Of course they are here too but there is more...For the price, location and cleanness, I would say it is the best hostel around Waikiki.

This hostel is great for the budget traveler. 1 block from the beach in Waikiki, and close to all the action. It has different types of rooms to choose from, from 8 person co-ed rooms, to semi private dorms. The staff are very friendly, there is bicycle and mo-ped rentals next door, as well as all other local amenities close by. Great place!

We stayed in a 8 bed dorm room and it was great. We met a lot of fun people on the hostel, it's really close to the beach and shopping. The rooms is very clean and the staff is great! I can definitly recomend it.

We stayed in a semi-private room whilst here. Room was clean. Kitchenette & bathroom shared with 2 others. Always had hot water, which is a must & really friendly staff, who always had a smile on their face. Included breakfast was very basic but there's lots of cafes etc nearby. 1 min walk from Waikiki beach.

Gr8 place!! It takes some time to get used to Waikiki but once u get used to this certain island fever this is the place to enjoy it. Lotta good folk around, staff included, perfect location and good atmosphere. Go there!!!

This hostel is just 1 block from the beach, it's so nice! I went there by myself, I was in room with 7 other girls, so easy to make buddy, there's everything that you can need around, the staff is very helpful. Better book in advance cause even if i was there in december, the hostel was full during 3 days...

My boyfriend and I decided to take an end of summer trip to Honolulu, but we were kinda short on cash. We ended up booking this hostel online after looking at a bunch of reviews on different places. We got a sale, so I think we ended up paying like $120 each for 8 nights. Definitely a steal considering the price of places in Honolulu. The location here is amazing!!! You are literally less than a block from the beach. There are also several bus stops, convenience stores, and restaurants within a block or so. The staff is great. Much better than I've had at real hotels. They have little sheets of paper with what buses to get on to go to different places. They also will give you directions and advice. They know the island really well and apparently love their jobs. (I should note that these people work here full time, they are not working temporarily in exchange for lodging like at many other hostels.)The rooms were ok. I would guess they were pretty standard for hostels. There were 8 bunks in the room we stayed in. I wanted to stay with my boyfriend so we were in a co-ed room. I was the only girl though. There was also a microwave, refrigerator, a table with some chairs, and a balcony. The beds are definitely not comfortable, but you get what you pay for. A maid came through daily, but the room was still pretty messy. Especially the bathroom. I would attribute this to the 5-7 guys that were in the room at any one time though. From what I saw of the all girl rooms, they were much cleaner, lol. The other people staying there were super nice. Definitely gave me the multicultural hostel atmosphere that I was looking forward to. The lounge is great if you just wanna hang out and relax. There's a huge tv and some boardgames and vending machines. I always felt really safe here. It's kind of in an alley, but it is well lit and generally just a nice, touristy part of town. If you are unsure about trying a hostel, this is a great place to start. Just make sure to remember to bring your own towel!

I like this hostel as my last-minute booking was accommodated and I was allowed to check-in earlier than noon by the friendly staff.I stayed at a shared 4-bed female-only room for $35/night and was happy about the free (and strong) WiFi signal in the room. The breakfast that was included reminded me of school recess snacks – jars of peanut butter and jam and a tub of butter were laid out on a long table next to a toaster and two loaves of bread. The coffee was okay. Of course if you’re staying at a hostel the crowd is more sociable. The staff pulled the plug on a hostel party there when it was only 10pm. The beach is so near though so you can keep mingling on Waikiki sand. - The efficient $9 airport shuttle (one-way) drops you off a stone’s throw from the hostel-There’s a $20 deposit when you arrive-Small lockers can be rented inside the rooms for $1- If you get sick of the free brekkie the internet café offers a more substantial $3 plate- The place is not beachside but is very close to the beach as well as stores and the bus stop.- Guys at the apartment next door were so loud the cops were called in. But then again this is a hostel so don’t always expect quiet nights

This hostel is amazing.I loved staying here and can honestly say it is one of the best thigns I have done in my life. The location is amazing, with a bus stop literally around the corner, 5 step away from the world renowned waikiki beach (the nicer..quieter end of it) There's a starbucks, subway, ABC convenience store, Mcdonalds and burger king all within a 5 minute walk away. The zoo is just around the corner too.The hostel staff were so friendly and welcoming, they helped us out with the bus routes to places and recommended places to go and places to stay away from. They did organise entertainment in the nights including beer kegs if you chipped in a few dollars. The hostel is set out amazingly, the air con could be a bit better in the 8 bed dorm rooms but I was still able to sleep. The en suites are good and it's generelly pretty tidy. Handy to have a kitchen within your room, less risk of your food going missing. The out door courtyard area is great too.It is so close tot he beach...you kinda don't believe it..but look on a map...honestly...it takes about 3 minutes to get your feet in the sand...paradise?!
I stayed here for two weeks and was not dissapointed! This is by far the best hostel in Waikiki.

Hostel was ok, what you would expext for the cheapest hostel in town, there was an old guy in my room who was begging for change on the streets, well all hostels get weirdoes from time to time,But the locker situation is nothing short of a cheap shot at making money,Nice lockers, $1 every time you open it, you know the kind you use once in a swimming pool. To me this was very sad indeed, most people would not use the lockers creating a security problem, as for me i like to keep my stuff locked up and would need to get something 5 to 7 times a day, at $7 extra a day this is the most expensive hostel in town and not worth it.Seaside, you have an ok hostel, please review your locker situation, its a true and blatant cheap shot and it frustrates everyone ! How much theaft has there been due to people not using your extortionate locker system ?

Stayed at the Beachside hostel for 4 days at the end of November. This place is in a GREAT location, about 2 mins to Waikiki Beach, bars and shopping. We managed to get a bed for 13$ a night online (they were having a sale, look out for them). Davis usually runs the front desk, very helpful and friendly guy. Breakfast consists of toast and coffee, but its decent. Every few nights a bbq is held by Andy and his partner (SUCH nice guys!) consiting of chicken burger or cheeseburger, fries, beans and corn....so good! It was one of our favourites!About 20 mins up the road is a place called Ono's and its authentic Hawaiian food. Was excellent and I recommend it. Rooms are pretty big, we had an 8 person room with a kitchen and bathroom. Kitchen had a stove and oven and fridge, VERY handy.

I stayed at this hostel pour 9 nights and it was great. I was and a female dorm and I got to meet amazing people with whom I've spent my vacation. Solo traveler maybe, but not at this hostel. The lounge is great to meet nice people. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helping. The location is great also. It's near the beach, the restaurants and those lovely ABC Stores (i'm addicted now !!)You should go there if you want a good time and make new friends !
Nice place. Clean, helpful staff, very close to everything. Fairly good rates. Overall really good and worth it!

The staff were very helpful and friendly. They gave advice on what to see and where to catch the buses. Waikiki beach is only a 3 min walk from the hostel and it's close to an ABC store and restaurants. They have a kitchenette in all of the rooms but not many plates or utensils. The hostel is very large and only two rooms had some bugs in them. If you want to change rooms because of the bugs that was no problem. Other then the bugs the rooms were all very clean. Overall, I had a really great experience staying here. I would definitely come back again.

The staff are great and very helpful with finding places in Honolulu. The kitchens are a bit sparse, but there is a breakfast of toast and coffee given. There is also an onspot kitchen for having breakfast. The location is also great being 2 mins from the beach!

The staff was more than helpful, went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable and comfortable. There is a conveinent interent cafe, restraunt and luonge downstairs. Within walkng distance of everything, and if its ot, the bus stops a block away. If you are travelling on a budget or just want a place you can meet other travelers, this is a great place for you.

This place was nice, clean enough (espicially for a hostel) and a major league outfielder could throw a ball and hit the beach from the hostel. The staff was amazing friendly too. If I return to Waikiki, I will stay here again--even if I am not traveling solo.
