New York City, New York

review_body: I loved the location and felt safe as a young female traveler.

The location is really good since the beach is 200 meters away and the main street is around the corner. The staff here is wonderful and are always around to give a helping hand and tips on what to do here on Oahu. We been staying here for a month and we have enjoyed EVERY night here!

Very friendly and helpful staff. Hostel is very close to Waikiki beach, and everything is in walking distance. Every dorm has a kitchen and bathroom, so you share only with the people in the dorm. An improvement would be if they also have towels available. Furthermore they have simple free breakfast (toast with peanut butter and jelly).
only arrived today so cant say a lot yet, room is ok, bit crowded and very hot. free breakfast is a bonus (toast and coffee). staff seem helpful. location is 1 min from beach.

I had changed my reservation from Hostel International to WaikikiBeachside - and it was great.The front desk folks are really cool. The rooms were good and good daily maid service (cleaning).The top part was the proximity to the beach. I could leave my valuables in locker in room behind and just go barefoot to the beach.Overall it was a great experience and I will come here again next time I visit Waikiki.
Good place, really nice staff, dont expect a beautiful room, neither a nasty hostel. Its really good for the money you pay, and great location as well!! I recommend.

The hostel was really amazing and made my stay on Honolulu the best it could possibly be. If i could go back I would stay at this hostel over the Sheraton. The service was reliable, fast and charming. Everybody working at the facility was extremely friendly. The BBQ food was trully amazing, you will love staying at the Waikiki Beachside Hostel
Good amenities, cheap, near the beach. The staff is friendly. Free breakfast and coffee.

the hostel staff was very friendly. offering a wide array of knowledge about the island. the beach was very close in waikiki. shopping was near by. scooter rentals were next door. everything was near by. surfing lessons were around the corner the hostel didnt offer towels so bring your own. the rooms were clean and pleasant.

An excellent value for money hostel with great staff, dorms and friendly vibrant backpackers! If your stuck for a cheap place to stay then head on down to Lemon road and check in here!! This place makes ur stay in Hawaii very memorable!!!!
This hostel has awesome staff and people. Prices are very reasonable and rooms are kept clean. Will stop here again when i am next in hawaii.

the staff here are friendly and always willing to help out with whatever you need, i have meet loads of great people from all over the world and its 2 mins walk from one of the best beaches you could see! cheers guys mahalo

Very friendly and good value for money. Really good location, obviously for the beach but for food and drinks too. BBQs everynight, good food, good price.Good for lone traveller as 24hour staff at desk, felt safe.Would definately staff again.
daily cleaning service5 days a week delicious BBQ for USD 4no towels

The most reasonable accomodations for the cost and cleanest place closest to the beaches at Waikiki. Also , close to moped rentals and other activities and the Honolulu Bus Stop so you can take the bus from Airport for a $2.00 to get here and also back to the airport if your backpak is not huge . There is a nightly barbie for only $4.00 that includes hamburgers , chicken , veggie burgers and veggie patties , salad , potato salad pasta , etc. Rooms are cleaned daily and common area is clean has WI-FI for internet .Overall best accomodations on Waikiki beach for a hostel ....recommend highly .Loni Larson
While I was travelling I found this hostel with nice & helpful people. You meet boys and girls from all over the world, have fun together and the shortest way to the beach! You will enjoy!
A great place to meet people from all around the world, tidy with great staff, good food and located in an amazing part right by the beach and loads of shops. Brilliant.
We arrived two days ago and absolutely love the hostel. We were not sure what to expect but when we got here were very happy. It is friendly clean and has everything you need.

The staff are helpful and pleasant. The rooms might need some work (e.g. water pressure in the shower) The guests are nice people as well. Has an (working)internet cafe and laundry, so it's convienient. Would be better if the safe locker was free. The location is ok, not the best-west end of waikiki.

Great for the solo traveller, particularly if you're young and looking to meet people on your trip. Just a few minutes by foot to the beach and right next to a convenience store. Bus stop right around the corner as well. First hostel I've stayed at in the US and overall I was pleased with the facilities.

The staff are very friendly; the rooms are clean; the breakfast is free; dinner is $4; the apple store is 10 minutes away (free internet); and the people are great. If you're backpacking in Honolulu you're mad not to stay here.
The staff are great. The other residents are a blast. The rooms are clean and practical! One of the best hostels i have stayed in.
i have been here for 9 days totaly....i relay realy like this hostel...so funny stuff (davis), a really good BBQ, thousands of different people....i love this hostel:)

The staff at this Hostel are always happy to help. It was really nice to be greeted by a friendly face after traveling such a long distance. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the location in central. Walk out the door, around the corner and there is the beach and the buzz of Waikiki! Everything is within walking distance and if not the hostel provides travel information. There is a nightly BBQ which is more then worth the $4! Would recommend this place to friends and anyone looking for a comfortable bed to crash and a central location. Also good for those traveling alone who are looking to meet fun, chilled people.

This hostel is great, definitely one of the best I've stayed in. It's literally a block from the beach! The dorms are clean and there's a chilled out atmosphere. The BBQ for $4 is a must! We liked it so much we came back!!

If you are looking for a hostel to stay in Waikiki, the Beachside Hostel is the perfect place as it is right next to the beach. The Staff is nice and helpful! What I think is negative was the cleanliness in the 8-dorm room and the breakfast time (9 to 10am). But all in all, I would recommend the hostel. Low price and great location!

The best thing about this hostel are the clean, large rooms with a kitchenette and bath. I have been to hostels where everything is communal and dirty! Also, close to the beach... As a solo traveler, meeting people and sense of community beats the nice hotels...

The guys are awesome, helpful, curious, you name it. Great food good people wonderful atmosphere a definite must! Special shout out to my boy George at the front desk, thanks for letting me use the bathroom even when you weren't suppose to.

I was very happy to arrive at the Beachside Hostel to be greeted by a very friendly staff, who were helpful throughout our stay. We arrived in our dorm style room, which was a little unclean. Mostly things left under the beds from previous guests and dust and dirt in the corners, under beds, etc. The hostel works hard to keep things bug-free, and in a tropical climate like this, that is hard to do. There is a 10pm "quiet time" that is not enforced and I had really wished that it was. The proximity to bus lines, shopping, food and of course Waikiki beach is amazing, worth having to wear earplugs to sleep. I'd recommend it to travelers looking for a excellent beach location and a really good price.

I've stayed here 3 times and it gets better each time. The staff are friendly and you can meet lots of fun people from all over and socialize in the lounge area. They have karaoke nights, themed outings, pub crawls, etc. They have very inexpensive BBQ meals served every night(except Monday although I expect Monday will be included as well in the future) free continental breakfast and low-cost grilled omelets and more. The internet cafe also just started serving lunch, so you're covered on the cheap for all meals of the day! (meals generally $4-$5 or $1 per side dish..and they give you lots of food)Large co-ed dorm rooms are a great value. Private rooms not as much as you can get decent hotel rooms nearby for cheaper (however you don't get the fun hostel ambiance and fellow travelers to hang with) So much to see nearby just a half block from the zoo and Waikiki Beach. Waikiki is very walkable, scooters are rented just next door, and the bus is inexpensive, convenient and travels to most of the island. Enjoy :)

the hostel is in a great location, really close to the beach and the hub of shops, bars and restaurants! the staff are really friendly and extremely helpful pointing out amazing places to eat, that you may have simply walked passed and not noticed.rooms are spacious and clean, and communal areas are kept well too, coffee and toast are provided in the mornings which is a definate plus! there is a great friendly atmosphere here, i would definately recommend it! if its value for money and location you are looking for, this is the place!

great location and value for money! rooms are equipped with a kitchenette, so perfect if you want a little home from home... near to the beach and everything else that waikiki has to offer!! staff were friendly and always happy to help you with any of your travelling needs, from recommending somewhere good to eat to booking a shuttle bus to the airport!

The Beachside Hostel is like small community and is just a hop skip and a jump from the beach. Bathrooms and kitchens in every room, and the staff is happy to help you with anything. If your going to Waikiki and you want to save some money, as well as a great place to stay, the beachside is bitc hin.

Great service better than some hotels in the area, very helpful and very pleasant staff. I had a wonderful time meeting locals and travelers from all over the world passing through. Just plain wonderful.
This place is great for travellers and backpackers, looking to hang out, totally undercover surrounded by massive hotels you could totally miss it, lotsa fun.

this place was fun and the staff was cool. the night sh8ift worker steven was the best....!!!! he helped me out with alot of information about getting around the island and finding things to do on my vacation!!!!!!

this is a really nice hostel! one of the best i've stayed in. right in the thick of things near waikiki beach so no extra $$$ spent getting to the action. next to diamond head too. very nice, friendly and HELPFUL staff! rooms are well equipped w/ kitchen, tv etc. would recommend a small dorm room. free wifi is a nice touch too. it is cheap for what you get! recommended to anyone who's coming to waikiki... in fact i'll be back here in a few weeks!

stayed at the hostel for 2 nights, the rooms are very big and spacious plenty of room to unpack and leave your bags, the rooms were always clean and having a kitchen in every room was so helpful as you didnt have to wait for people as you do in communial hostel, even though they do a $4 BBQ everynight but mondays good food and they dont go short on the portions worth checking out. The staff were also friendly and happy to help the only bad thing is you dont have lockers were u can lock your stuff in for free had to pay $1 apart from that it was all good,

I stayed 3 nights in a shared co-ed room in April 2010.Very friendly front desk staff. Very helpful.I met awesome people here, too!Rooms were quite clean and sheets very fresh and clean. For a hostel, I am quite impressed!Beach only 2 blocks away! Good!

This idealic hostel is situated in lemon st, only minutes away from the main street and the beautiful beach of waikiki. A range of people come to stay and it is a great place to meet new people. My stay at this hostel has been pleasent and would totally recommend it to any traveler after a good time.

It was a little hard to find, but worth the trouble. The guy at the front desk, David, was very helpful, and all the staff were friendly. But if you're expecting the Hilton, with all the amenities, you're in the wrong neighborhood. Sheets are free, but bring your own towel.But for a middle-aged dude, it was a great place to crash, although my former roommate snored like a pig being raped by the Hell's Angels. I just moved next door and solved the problem.As far as cleanliness--well, it seemed clean to me. You have to provide your own definition of "Clean." Remember, you might be sleeping in the same room with seven other men who might've been surfing, hiking, sweating, and drinking all day, so "Clean" is a relative term. If you're a military veteran, or active duty, it's just like the barracks.Overall, it's a cool place to stay for little money. Just be cool, don't whine, complain, and be an jerk, and you'll have a nice stay.

I love staying here at this hostel. Everyone here is very friendly and helpful. This was my first trip on my own and I feel very safe being here. They offer either free breakfast or luch which is always nice for the wallet. Its also very affordable. I would diffenitly come back here to stay.

I went to Waikiki with my family and a few of their friends. They all stayed at the Ilikai and I decided I wanted more of an adventure. I have stayed at hostels off-and-on since I was in my 20s (I am now in my 60s and probably the oldest one staying there at the time). Wow! Was my decision a good one. It was so much fun and just a busride away from the rest of my family. It is literally a block away from the beach and a hop-skip to the zoo and aquarium. I roomed with women from Sweden, France and Switzerland. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean with TV, a microwave and a refrigerator. There is free breakfast, but you are also offed a homemade breakfast for $5. At night there is a barbeque offered for $5. The food is delish! If you want swanky then there are plenty of hotels to choose from. If you want to save a lot of money and enjoy meeting new people from around the world in a friendly, safe environment - this is the place to choose.

Not the cheapest, but not the most expensive. The amenities they provide are fairly good. They have a nice deal where you get two free meals if you come in by plane (everyone?) They have a barbeque every night, breakfast every morning, and a japanese-hawaiin food place next door. its a good place to meet people. i easily met and hung out with a couple people, in the day and at night. you got to be a little social, that is the same anywhere, but people are fairly friendly, and the customer base seems down to hang out. There is a 24 hour internet cafe next door.downsides include dirty rooms/ floors, a kitchen in your dorm that has no cooking supplies or dishes, one bathroom for 12 people in your dorm, which is also in the same room as the shower (again dirty floor,) incredibly hot and muggy nights in your room, and finally they charge you $10 to rent boogy boards when other places do it for free. If you can come here, try to stay in a two-person room. odds are good you will have it to yourself. you can still easily meet people in the lobby or during the barbeque. It is a good starting point to get your feet on the island. Then you may consider moving on, or not.

The Waikiki Beachside Hostel was the first Hostel I have ever stayed in and it exceeded all of my expectations. I imagined Hostels to have little privacy and to be very crowded and dirty. However, this Hostel was very spacious and clean. The guests and staff are very friendly here. I have the option to retreat to the privacy of my room or to mingle with the guests and staff in the common meeting area. The common meeting area is a great place to meet new people, read a book, eat dinner, watch television, and simply relax. What I like the most about the Hostel is its location next to the beach, and all the conveniences that surround it, like internet access, moped rentals, and good food and shops. I also really like the daily breakfast and evening BBQ held right on the premisis. I highly reccommend this Hostel.
they have a great breakfast and dinner for 5 dollars. all of the staff was extremely friendly and my stay way pleasant. i will defiantly come back.

Well I stayed here for i bout a week or so, for $30 a night it was great value, upsides are price at least compared to hotels, the location, 5 mins walk to the beach and right at the either start or end of the whole waikiki beach experience, the friendly staff, the cheap but excellent breaky's and dinners they have onsite! Downsides noise at night, tho mainly party nights, cleanliness but i dont think it was as bad as all that, tho dont walk around in bare feet as your feet will be black in no time, as with most hostels don't leave anything valuable lying around.
Clean linens for your bed pretty okay mattress great location chill staff little more expensive but it's still not a bad deal for a week or so4 green dots out of five.

I have stayed at two hostels near this one in Waikiki, and find Beachside to be much cleaner, more up-to-date, and vastly friendlier than the competition. The front desk staff go above and beyond the call, answering my questions, and generally making my stay comfortable. Great guests from around the world too!

I have stayed here 3 times now and I have had no complaints to make. ( I have stayed at 3 hostels so far and one of them i definantly had complaints. The manager was rude and inconsiderate.) Here the atmosphere and management are both pleasant. Also they provide interenet service for a small fee. The location is also convenient to the airport, (take the city bus) and to the beach(a 30 second walk).

Come here for sure! It's tucked away in a nice little alley, which is just off the best part of Waikiki beach! The staff are incredibly helpful and cheery and gave us great value for money with all the cheap barbeque dinners that they have everynight downstairs in a cool open common room area that has everything you'd want to chill out with mates and meet new people, drink and watch TV etc. The atmosphere of this place was awesome- we made great friends with the people in our dorm and felt i could have left my wallet laying around anywhere and it would have been safe. And the nightlife is only a couple of minutes waqlk around the corner so it really is in the best location! I hired a boaqrd late one afternoon and didn't come in til that night because I was able to surf under the moon! And the best part was that this was RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE HOSTEL!!! Without a doubt best backpackers i've been to so far.

I found this to be one of the most hospitable places in Waikiki!The staff were incredible kind and a joy to be around! and the Price this isthe place to stay! Not the most expensive.on fact a rare bargain in the land of aloha.

This hostel has a great location, one block away from Waikiki beach. The staff is very friendly and always ready to answer your questions. The atmosphere at the hostel is nice.I was staying in a 4-bed room, so we had the semiprivate room and one bed in the front, which worked perfect. It is nice that the rooms have toilet and bath and the kitchen in the rooms is very convenient too.

Central location in waikiki, very close to the beach. You will have a nice experience with the people you meet. Right next to the zoo, beach, shopping, and bars. You will have alot of fun staying in a hostel which is much more social than a hotel room.
Fun dorms, friendly staff, cheap good food, 5 minute walk to the beach.

Good things about the hostel - extremely friendly and helpful staff. Close proximity to beach.Bad things about the hostel - unclean rooms (despite asking for them to be cleaned), a bathroom that looked like it was straight out of a crack house, air conditioning that didn't seem to do anything other than make a lot of noise, didn't have a social atmosphere.Don't even think of staying here if you're over the age of 25 and are even slightly used to accommodation being of a semi-reasonable standard. Spend a little bit more money and stay somewhere decent.

It's a very nice place and the location is the best - 2 minutes from the Beach :) The staff is very helpfull and nice.. It's a place where you can meet a lot of people so a gret place for both travellers who travel alone and together with other.
Impressed with the range of services on offer - from internet facilities (wifi + internet cafe) + things like bike storage and excellent communal lounge. Good pricing for meals and rooms.=)

Walking into this place I was a little unsure of the place, because I had never really stayed at a hostel before but after getting in and settling in, I realized that it was such a great place to really stay and for fairly cheap. I would have never really thought that so much could be right under my nose but not really ever talked about.. Maybe its a little secret that I didn't know about unti just now...
This place is right next to the beach, friendly employees, the food was great. Would love to come back.

This is the best hostel ever! This hostel has free wi-fi and even an internet cafe just next door if you need it with the best customer service to navigate the computers. The rooms are spectacular, clean, and well stocked with everything you need: full size refrigerator, stove and roomy cabinet space for groceries. Beds are SO comfortable. And, since this hostel is so close to the ocean, it's also quiet, peaceful, and just relaxing......well, paradise I should say! This place has EVERYTHING! A wonderful tropical lounge where you can barbecue and watch your favorites on TWO big screen tv's! But, if you don't feel like cooking yourself.....well, they cook for you! Their hot full breakfast is awesome- and their evening meals-incredible! Quality of a full service restaurant but for a fourth of the price. You can really see that the staff love their jobs and love to make guests happy and comfortable. You can never ask the staff enough questions. They are always ready to help your stay in Hawaii easy and pleasant. Also, this hostel is in a prime location surrounded by, of course, the beach, shopping, coffee shops, moped rentals, bus lines, restaurants and eateries. All in all ......hands down........i will never stay any where else........!
